story:
(This is the revised campaign for this project. I think I was too aggressive in my goal for the first one, and learned some new ways to promote it after it was too late to use them effectively. I've taken what I learned and am giving it another go!)

     Every time I visit Disneyland, I see connections all around me. Spiritual truth. Life lessons. Ways to help make people's lives better, and their life in Christ more vibrant, more meaningful, and more practical. But it does no good if I keep it to myself. I want it to be part of your visits, too. What we experience in every trip to Disneyland--whether we realize it or not--can have a significant impact on our lives. 

     I truly believe that these lessons and reminders can revolutionize your life in Christ while giving you a greater and deeper appreciation for "The Happiest Place on Earth," Walt Disney's original Magic Kingdom. And that's exactly the purpose of this book.


About Randy

(Who am I & Why Did I Write this Book?)

     I grew up not far from Disneyland. And I grew up in the church. I went to Bible College, and I was a pastor (and still preach as the opportunity arises). But so what? Lots of people could say the same thing. What makes me different? I'm glad you asked.

     My family was usually ill when I was growing up. My Grandma lived with us for the last several years of her life, and I helped my parents take care of her. My Mom was sick several times as well, and I helped take care of her, too. I even quit my first job in part to be home so she could have major surgery without worrying about who was going to take care of Grandma (her mother). I was always a “little adult,” and had to grow up very fast and mature a lot faster than one would typically expect of a child, perhaps partially because I am an only child. A lot was expected of me. “With great power comes great responsibility.” I had the responsibility part, anyway. 

     I did play with friends, have toys, etc., but nearly all of the play I can remember was structured and often to learn something, do an experiment, etc. (my own preference, not forced upon me). In the midst of all of this in my childhood, two things that remained regular parts of my life were my love of and ability to write well, and my faith. 

     At the same time, when I was in third grade my parents were told to be very careful and watch me closely because I was gifted (in the G.A.T.E. program) and highly emotionally-sensitive. If they weren’t careful, my G.A.TE. teacher told them, I was at risk for serious emotional, and maybe even psychological issues. So I learned, subconsciously for the most part, to be careful about that part of my emotional nature. 

     Because I was capable of so much—which I’m grateful was nurtured and encouraged by my family—and had the responsibility and expectation I did, I was a perfectionist. I expected a lot of myself, never wanted to let anyone down, and knew that in some parts of my life (especially the health of my family) there was no room for error, so my standard became 100% all the time. That’s a very exhausting way to grow up. 

     Disneyland became the place where I could “recapture my childhood,” reconnect with the emotional side of myself I’d buried, and escape once I was in my early-20’s and beyond. The more time I spent there and got to know it, the more valuable it became to me and the more I wanted to learn. It, and it’s creator, Walt Disney, has become an integral part of me, and I use it still as an escape, but also as a teaching tool and a writing inspiration, and a resource (in multiple ways). 

     I started with a single sermon. I figured I'd just write it out, cut as much as I needed to to preach it, and that would probably be that. Instead, I cut 75% of what I'd written, and it was still a 50-minute sermon. I realized that there was much more to this than I'd thought, and in July of 2010 I began blogging it at FaithandtheMagicKingdom.net to get my ideas down and develop them. 

     The more I visit Disneyland, the more connections I see. Many of them are spiritual in nature, but not all of them.Last year I published my first book, Once Upon YOUR Time: 7 Strategies for Gaining Control of Your Time Through a Tour of the Magic Kingdom, teaching people 7 simple and effective real-world time management strategies . using Disneyland as the "hook." It's been very well received and has helped people start to see that there's more to Disneyland than meets the eye...in more ways than one. That's why I wrote this book, and why I want to bring it to you.


Why I Need Your Support

     So, here we are, a little more than 3 years after that sermon, and I have 113 lessons and reminders for your Christian life found in Disneyland. This is the most comprehensive book on this subject available. Who am I kidding? This is the only book on this subject available! I have labored for 3+ years, pouring everything I have and everything I am into these pages to bring them to YOU. But I can't do it alone. I need your help.

     Publishing a book is not cheap, not even a self-published book.

     OK, that's not true. Anybody can do it for next to nothing. But that doesn't mean it is well written and well edited, has a great cover design and interior layout, and more. All of these things cost money, and often "you get what you pay for." This has been my dream for years, so I want it done right. I want my readers to have a book that is the highest possible quality.

     I've hired a professional and experienced editor, and he's spent hours with my manuscript. Then I've spent hours going over his edits. It's gone from good to great (if I do say so myself). I've hired an amazing graphic designer to do my cover. I'll be hiring a professional narrator to do an audio book version. I even hired a professional videographer to shoot and the video you see at the top of this campaign. If I'm going to expect you to sit and watch a video, I want it to be the best it can be!

     Of course, I've offered some great rewards to those of you who support this campaign (more on that below, too), and I need to be able to fulfill those promises. And, naturally, I need to pay the Indiegogo campaign fee.

     All of this takes money--more than I have. But if we do this together, Faith and the Magic Kingdom can make it to market! You can get the best rewards I can think of! And many millions of people can have their lives transformed, all because of what we've done here together! 


    But is it really that good? Well, here's what some people have said about it so far...


Advance Praise for Faith and the Magic Kingdom

     "Faith and The Magic Kingdom is a unique gift to Christians who desire to be more childlike in heart yet be deeply immersed in their identity in Christ. It is biblical, applicable and helps you access the presence of God in a simple way." ~ Becky Harmon, Identity Expert and CEO of Success not Sabotage Coaching

     "Walt Disney created one of the most well-loved places in the world, a part of the fabric of society, when Disneyland opened in 1955. Throughout its history, though, most people have seen it as simply an impressive 'amusement enterprise.' InFaith and the Magic Kingdom, Randy does an exceptional job of taking this familiar and fanciful place and showing it to be so much more, drawing from it practical lessons and valuable reminders for a dynamic life of faith. If you're a fan of Disneyland and a Christian, this book is a must-read!" ~ Pat Williams. Orlando Magic co-founder and senior vice president; Author of How to be Like Walt

     "If Disneyland is just a fun place for you to go and nothing more, this book will inspire you to 'look harder!' I love Faith and the Magic Kingdom because it ties in my faith and my passion for Disney. In fact, it gave me many great things to think about and reflect on. I thought I’d seen it all, but with this book, Randy has opened my eyes to a whole new way of thinking about one of my favorite places by connecting it to the most important thing in my life—my faith in Christ.Now, let it do the same for you!" ~ Danielle Ernest, Author/Creator of Tales of a Disneyland Cast Member

     "Many people view a trip to Disneyland as a way to escape reality for awhile and enter a world of fantasy. But in Faith and the Magic Kingdom, Randy Crane flips that notion on its head. He uses a place that is known and loved for its escapism to teach and explain Christian doctrine, turning the Happiest Place on Earth into the ultimate picture illustration of Bible truths." ~ Sue Kisenwether, Disney runner and co-host of the Anomaly Supplemental podcast

     "Randy Crane ingeniously provides what amounts to a Disneyland Devotional, drawing spiritual lessons from life inside the Magic Kingdom to improve our walk with Christ. He uses the attractions, the architecture, the parades, the cast members, the characters, near everything about 'The Happiest Place on Earth' as the springboard for solid, accessible Biblical teaching." ~ David Koenig, Author of Mouse Tales: A Behind-the-Ears Look at Disneyland


TO GET A LOOK FOR YOURSELF...download the Introduction and an entry from the book here. Also, here's the book's Table of Contents! Page numbers will change a bit, but this is essentially the final version. 

Rewards

  • Pledge $1 ~ THANK YOU - Every dollar helps, and I appreciate your support. 
  • Pledge $5 ~ ACKNOWLEDGEMENT - Have your name listed in a special Acknowledgments section of the book. Everyone will know you had an important role in making this happen! (You'll get this if you choose any higher level pledge, too.)
  • Pledge $15 ~ EBOOK - Get a copy of the Faith and the Magic Kingdom ebook before its official release.
  • Pledge $25 ~ PAPERBACK OR EBOOK - Get a copy of Faith and the Magic Kingdom in your choice of paperback or ebook format before its official release.
  • Pledge $25 ~ TIME & LIFE EBOOKS - Name in the Acknowledgments plus a copy of both this ebook and my first ebook, Once Upon YOUR Time! 
  • Pledge $30 ~ AUTOGRAPHED PAPERBACK - Get a personalized autographed copy of Faith and the Magic Kingdom in paperback before its official release.
  • Pledge $35 ~ DIGITAL & PHYSICAL - Can't decide whether you want an ebook or paperback? No problem! Get a copy of Faith and the Magic Kingdom BOTH as an ebook and in paperback before its official release.  
  • Pledge $45 ~ TIME & LIFE PAPERBACKS - Name in the Acknowledgments plus a copy of both this book and my first one, Once Upon YOUR Time, as paperbacks!
  • Pledge $55 ~ 2 PAPERBACKS - 2 copies of Faith and the Magic Kingdom in paperback before its official release.
  • Pledge $75 ~ THE 4-PACK- Get a copy of BOTH Faith and the Magic Kingdom AND Once Upon YOUR Time in BOTH paperback AND ebook formats. 
  • Pledge $90 ~ 5 PAPERBACKS - Get your Christmas shopping done early! Get 5 COPIES of Faith and the Magic Kingdom in paperback before its official release. The perfect gift for your friends and family! 
  • Pledge $250 ~ PERSONAL COACHING CALL - A copy of the book (ebook or paperback--your choice), AND a 90-minute coaching call. You tell me what area you're frustrated with, stuck in, or want to take a leap forward in, and we'll evaluate where you are and what practical steps you can take immediately to move toward your goal! A great way to get ready for the new year! 
  • Pledge $1,000 ~ FAITH AND THE MAGIC KINGDOM VISIT - Reading the book is nice. Seeing it come to life is better. Get a personalized "Faith and the Magic Kingdom Live Experience." (Lodging and park admission are not include, but since I'm also a travel agent I can book either or both of those for you as well.) 
  • Pledge $4,000 ~ I'LL COME TO YOU - You'll get a copy of the book (ebook or paperback, your choice) and ME, wherever you are! How much more can I offer?! I will fly to you (anywhere in continental US) and spend 2 nights and 1-1/2 days (exact number of days depends on flight times, but I'll make it as long as I can). I'll cover my own airfare, lodging, food, and transportation. We'll spend that time as in-person intensive coaching, helping you discover the "you" God made you to be and how to live that out in practical, fulfilling, and meaningful ways so you can experience true success! (If you prefer, instead of the coaching you can use me for a conference speaker or workshops). 
  • Pledge $6,000 ~ OVER THE TOP - You'll get...

* 2 copies of Faith and the Magic Kingdom as either ebooks or paperbacks (or 1 of each)

* Your name in the Acknowledgments 

* Air transportation for you and a guest to Southern California from anywhere in the continental US

* Transportation to/from airport (LAX, SNA, or LGB)

* 2 nights at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel (based on our mutual availability)

* 1-day park hopper tickets for 2 people

* Dinner on day of flight, all meals the next day, and breakfast the 3rd day.

* 1 day of digging deep into discovering who God made you to be and what to do with that (1/2 in Disneyland, 1/2 in hotel) - Your Life Plan!!!

* 2 pre-trip calls to lay the groundwork and 2 post-trip calls to wrap it up and get the momentum going!


I will also provide frequent updates on the project and answer any questions you may have along the way. The content of the book is complete,but there is still work to be done--completing the edits, finalizing the cover design for the ebook, having the paperback cover designed, etc.--and I'll keep you updated all along the way. I want you to know in advance what you're supporting and know that I'm fully engaged in and committed to this project.


Also, you can choose a reward level but increase your support amount. For instance, let's say you just want a copy of the ebook but want to contribute $50, not $15. No  problem, just select the ebook Perk, and on the next page (with the Contribution Summary) it will ask you how much you want to contribute. There you can change the dollar amount to whatever you want, as long as it's at least the level of the Perk you selected. So, in this example, you would change that from $15 to $50.
If you change the dollar amount of a contribution, though, I don't get notified of what the original Perk was you selected. But that's not a problem. Just email me or leave me a comment telling me what the Perk you selected was. You can mark the comment private so only I'll see it.


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign (http://igg.me/at/faithmk2).
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools (directly below the video)!


Thank you!
story_txt:
(This is the revised campaign for this project. I think I was too aggressive in my goal for the first one, and learned some new ways to promote it after it was too late to use them effectively. I've taken what I learned and am giving it another go!)
     Every time I visit Disneyland, I see connections all around me. Spiritual truth. Life lessons. Ways to help make people's lives better, and their life in Christ more vibrant, more meaningful, and more practical. But it does no good if I keep it to myself. I want it to be part of your visits, too. What we experience in every trip to Disneyland--whether we realize it or not--can have a significant impact on our lives. 
     I truly believe that these lessons and reminders can revolutionize your life in Christ while giving you a greater and deeper appreciation for "The Happiest Place on Earth," Walt Disney's original Magic Kingdom. And that's exactly the purpose of this book.




About Randy
(Who am I & Why Did I Write this Book?)
     I grew up not far from Disneyland. And I grew up in the church. I went to Bible College, and I was a pastor (and still preach as the opportunity arises). But so what? Lots of people could say the same thing. What makes me different? I'm glad you asked.
     My family was usually ill when I was growing up. My Grandma lived with us for the last several years of her life, and I helped my parents take care of her. My Mom was sick several times as well, and I helped take care of her, too. I even quit my first job in part to be home so she could have major surgery without worrying about who was going to take care of Grandma (her mother). I was always a “little adult,” and had to grow up very fast and mature a lot faster than one would typically expect of a child, perhaps partially because I am an only child. A lot was expected of me. “With great power comes great responsibility.” I had the responsibility part, anyway. 
     I did play with friends, have toys, etc., but nearly all of the play I can remember was structured and often to learn something, do an experiment, etc. (my own preference, not forced upon me). In the midst of all of this in my childhood, two things that remained regular parts of my life were my love of and ability to write well, and my faith. 
     At the same time, when I was in third grade my parents were told to be very careful and watch me closely because I was gifted (in the G.A.T.E. program) and highly emotionally-sensitive. If they weren’t careful, my G.A.TE. teacher told them, I was at risk for serious emotional, and maybe even psychological issues. So I learned, subconsciously for the most part, to be careful about that part of my emotional nature. 
     Because I was capable of so much—which I’m grateful was nurtured and encouraged by my family—and had the responsibility and expectation I did, I was a perfectionist. I expected a lot of myself, never wanted to let anyone down, and knew that in some parts of my life (especially the health of my family) there was no room for error, so my standard became 100% all the time. That’s a very exhausting way to grow up. 
     Disneyland became the place where I could “recapture my childhood,” reconnect with the emotional side of myself I’d buried, and escape once I was in my early-20’s and beyond. The more time I spent there and got to know it, the more valuable it became to me and the more I wanted to learn. It, and it’s creator, Walt Disney, has become an integral part of me, and I use it still as an escape, but also as a teaching tool and a writing inspiration, and a resource (in multiple ways). 
     I started with a single sermon. I figured I'd just write it out, cut as much as I needed to to preach it, and that would probably be that. Instead, I cut 75% of what I'd written, and it was still a 50-minute sermon. I realized that there was much more to this than I'd thought, and in July of 2010 I began blogging it at FaithandtheMagicKingdom.net to get my ideas down and develop them. 
     The more I visit Disneyland, the more connections I see. Many of them are spiritual in nature, but not all of them.Last year I published my first book, Once Upon YOUR Time: 7 Strategies for Gaining Control of Your Time Through a Tour of the Magic Kingdom, teaching people 7 simple and effective real-world time management strategies . using Disneyland as the "hook." It's been very well received and has helped people start to see that there's more to Disneyland than meets the eye...in more ways than one. That's why I wrote this book, and why I want to bring it to you.




Why I Need Your Support


     So, here we are, a little more than 3 years after that sermon, and I have 113 lessons and reminders for your Christian life found in Disneyland. This is the most comprehensive book on this subject available. Who am I kidding? This is the only book on this subject available! I have labored for 3+ years, pouring everything I have and everything I am into these pages to bring them to YOU. But I can't do it alone. I need your help.
     Publishing a book is not cheap, not even a self-published book.
     OK, that's not true. Anybody can do it for next to nothing. But that doesn't mean it is well written and well edited, has a great cover design and interior layout, and more. All of these things cost money, and often "you get what you pay for." This has been my dream for years, so I want it done right. I want my readers to have a book that is the highest possible quality.
     I've hired a professional and experienced editor, and he's spent hours with my manuscript. Then I've spent hours going over his edits. It's gone from good to great (if I do say so myself). I've hired an amazing graphic designer to do my cover. I'll be hiring a professional narrator to do an audio book version. I even hired a professional videographer to shoot and the video you see at the top of this campaign. If I'm going to expect you to sit and watch a video, I want it to be the best it can be!
     Of course, I've offered some great rewards to those of you who support this campaign (more on that below, too), and I need to be able to fulfill those promises. And, naturally, I need to pay the Indiegogo campaign fee.
     All of this takes money--more than I have. But if we do this together, Faith and the Magic Kingdom can make it to market! You can get the best rewards I can think of! And many millions of people can have their lives transformed, all because of what we've done here together! 

    But is it really that good? Well, here's what some people have said about it so far...




Advance Praise for Faith and the Magic Kingdom
     "Faith and The Magic Kingdom is a unique gift to Christians who desire to be more childlike in heart yet be deeply immersed in their identity in Christ. It is biblical, applicable and helps you access the presence of God in a simple way." ~ Becky Harmon, Identity Expert and CEO of Success not Sabotage Coaching
     "Walt Disney created one of the most well-loved places in the world, a part of the fabric of society, when Disneyland opened in 1955. Throughout its history, though, most people have seen it as simply an impressive 'amusement enterprise.' InFaith and the Magic Kingdom, Randy does an exceptional job of taking this familiar and fanciful place and showing it to be so much more, drawing from it practical lessons and valuable reminders for a dynamic life of faith. If you're a fan of Disneyland and a Christian, this book is a must-read!" ~ Pat Williams. Orlando Magic co-founder and senior vice president; Author of How to be Like Walt
     "If Disneyland is just a fun place for you to go and nothing more, this book will inspire you to 'look harder!' I love Faith and the Magic Kingdom because it ties in my faith and my passion for Disney. In fact, it gave me many great things to think about and reflect on. I thought I’d seen it all, but with this book, Randy has opened my eyes to a whole new way of thinking about one of my favorite places by connecting it to the most important thing in my life—my faith in Christ.Now, let it do the same for you!" ~ Danielle Ernest, Author/Creator of Tales of a Disneyland Cast Member
     "Many people view a trip to Disneyland as a way to escape reality for awhile and enter a world of fantasy. But in Faith and the Magic Kingdom, Randy Crane flips that notion on its head. He uses a place that is known and loved for its escapism to teach and explain Christian doctrine, turning the Happiest Place on Earth into the ultimate picture illustration of Bible truths." ~ Sue Kisenwether, Disney runner and co-host of the Anomaly Supplemental podcast
     "Randy Crane ingeniously provides what amounts to a Disneyland Devotional, drawing spiritual lessons from life inside the Magic Kingdom to improve our walk with Christ. He uses the attractions, the architecture, the parades, the cast members, the characters, near everything about 'The Happiest Place on Earth' as the springboard for solid, accessible Biblical teaching." ~ David Koenig, Author of Mouse Tales: A Behind-the-Ears Look at Disneyland



TO GET A LOOK FOR YOURSELF...download the Introduction and an entry from the book here. Also, here's the book's Table of Contents! Page numbers will change a bit, but this is essentially the final version.

story:
Pop-up Book includes quiz, colouring play mat and press-out activity

                       The perfect gift for children you love.
In 570 A.D. Yemen, the tyrant ruler Abraha leads his army of elephants to destroy God’s House, the Ka’ba in the Holy city of Makkah. Armed with only prayers, the Arabs rely on their faith and trust in God to save the Ka’ba and discover some unexpected miracles along the way!

About our Founder and Author

Salaam / Hello, I'm Hajera, the founder of Shade 7; a new publisher of high quality Pop-up Quranic educational story books & interactive digital 3D apps that help children learn about Islam in a fun way.

I trained and qualified as a banking lawyer in the heart of London. In the summer of 2012, I decided to quit my job and spend my life doing something I was extremely passionate about. I knew I wanted to explore my creative side! 

I had a good think about all the things I’d like to do in my life and thought, if I could do ANYTHING IN THE WORLD, what would it be?

Who could I become that would bring the most benefit to the world as a Muslim woman? I really wanted establish something which would allow me to leave a legacy behind.

Some key thingscame to mind:

  1. On-going beneficial knowledge;
  2. ‘Sadaqah jariyah’ (ceaseless charity); and 
  3. The hadith, or Prophetic saying that “Seven types of people will be shaded by God under His shade on the day when there will be no shade except His.”

Putting knowledge into action

I wanted to turn these key Islamic principles into actions and really make a difference. I'm determined to use my life to create a real legacy in children's Islamic education, not just for me, but for everyone involved.

Why It's Important We Gain YOUR Support!

We need your support to make our vision a reality and create a real legacy in children's Islamic educational publishing! 

  • Our vision is to create a legacy of accessible, high quality resources of on-going, beneficial knowledge which aim to (God Willing) inspire generations to come.
  • We’ve tried to find beautiful, creative and interactive resources that can encourage children to learn more about the magnificent stories from the Holy Quran. 
  • All the adults we’d spoken to had very fond memories of reading pop-up books as children and told us they’d love to have the same resources to teach their children more about the Quran.

We invite you to support us, to pre-order your exclusive signed copy and be a part of the Shade 7 legacy to make our vision a reality for all children to enjoy!

Features of the book: Why it's so special!

  • Hand drawn & painted, creative illustrations with exceptional colour and design throughout the book
  • A variety of carefully thought out pop-up features, interactive flaps and tabs to really bring the story to life like never before
  • Educational quiz to test your knowledge of the story 
  • Colouring play mat and press-out pieces to create your own army of elephants to re-enact some of the historic scenes from the story
  • Hardback cover with high quality finish throughout
  • Beautiful, luxurious, gold foil stamped, hand designed title on the cover
  • Our book is double the size of a standard children’s pop-up story book, containing 13 spreads
  • Each of the pop-up features in the book are put together by hand

What We Need & What You Get

We need as many of you as possible to order a copy (or copies) of our magnificent Pop-up Story of The Elephant: Surah Al-Fil Pop-up Book to arrive God willing, in time for Eid 2014. They will make the perfect gift for any child! 

The purpose of this campaign is also to give many of you who missed out on the first one, the chance to join in and be a part of the Shade 7 publishing legacy, and to give original backers a way to add funds for shipping or choose additional perks, while we continue to develop our website. 

Special Note: The content of this follow-up campaign comes from the first campaign. 

If you have questions or concerns, please email: info@shade7.co.uk 

Description of Perks:

Some of Our Perks

Our Charitable Commitment 

At Shade 7 we firmly believe in supporting the religious, spiritual and educational development of all children.

Our commitment is to donate a minimum of 25 books for every 1,000 copies sold as gifts to less fortunate children around the world via our Charity Partner READ Foundation (Registered Charity Number 1114808) whose focus is on education for children in rural areas.

We’d love for you to help us deliver on our promise to help make less fortunate children really happy too!

The Impact

This project is much more than just publishing children’s Quranic Pop-up Books and 3D apps. It has a much deeper impact and intention for the future of children’s Islamic educational publishing.

We’ve summarised the 7 key things which our project is all about: 

  1. Creating a Legacy of outstandingly beautiful, long-lasting resources to pass on beneficial knowledge that teaches children about the importance of faith and the rich, valuable lessons from the stories in the Quran.
  2. Creating Exceptional and inspirational designs of the highest quality in the material we publish.
  3. Making our published materials Accessible to all children, from all backgrounds and faiths to enjoy. This is highlighted particularly through our commitment with our Charity Partner READ Foundation who champion education for all.  
  4. Igniting a curiosity in all children to Discover the profound and exciting and moral stories in the Qur’an. For Muslim children, we hope it will inspire the discovery into the beauty of the Arabic language to understand the depth of these stories further.
  5. Creating innovative Educational resources to make learning about Islam truly inspiring and fun for all.
  6. Developing a deeper sense of Respect and tolerance in children from an early age towards other faiths and beliefs, bridging gaps and highlighting the similarities in the stories of the Old Testament to the Quranic stories in particular – something which will develop further as our series progresses.
  7. Developing a child’s Spiritual needs and interests as they grow older, cultivating an awareness of their Creator and creating a bond with Him through fond memories of reading these sensational stories.

I Forgot to Pay Shipping on the first campaign!

Not a problem. We realise it may have been a little confusing for our international customers. If you did order a book and forgot to add on shipping, please see our international postage list below to work out the additional cost. You can select the "No Perk" option and simply add the relevant amount. 

Trade Enquiries

All trade enquiries for retail, wholesale and distribution will now be directed to our third party distributors in the UK who will manage all our orders going forward.

Please email: wholesale@shade7.co.uk with your interest. 

Please note you will be asked to fill out a new account and credit application form, which we will forward onto our third party distributors, who will have their own set of terms, conditions and set trade discounts. 

3D Interactive App

If we raise enough support, we want to create an exceptional App, with great 3D graphics mimicking the paper-engineered feel of the books and incorporate a level of interactivity that both parents and children will enjoy.   

Parents will also have an option to record their own voice on the Surah Al-Fil App so the child can hear the story in a familiar voice when mum or dad might not be free to sit and read with them.

There’ll also be plenty of other special treats in store!

Sharing 

We're running this campaign until our website is fully developed, up and running. In order to take advantage of our special packages on offer in time for Eid, please do continue to SHARE, TWEET, EMAIL and SPREAD THE WORD to all your nearest and dearest, via the sharing icons shown under the campaign video (example screen shot below) - and encourage them to be part of our legacy too! 

UK Postage

  • All UK orders include shipping costs within the offer itself. 
  • All UK orders will be sent by a special delivery, fully tracked service. 
  • As each book weighs over 1kg, we are able to offer a flat rate of £6.20 shipping for up to 30 books in the UK and we have already included this in the price of the offers for ease. 

    • International Postage 

    Please find below a table of international shipping rates. If you have any trouble with calculating the shipping amount, please email:

story_txt:
Pop-up Book includes quiz, colouring play mat and press-out activity                       The perfect gift for children you love.
In 570 A.D. Yemen, the tyrant ruler Abraha leads his army of elephants to destroy God’s House, the Ka’ba in the Holy city of Makkah. Armed with only prayers, the Arabs rely on their faith and trust in God to save the Ka’ba and discover some unexpected miracles along the way!
About our Founder and AuthorSalaam / Hello, I'm Hajera, the founder of Shade 7; a new publisher of high quality Pop-up Quranic educational story books & interactive digital 3D apps that help children learn about Islam in a fun way.I trained and qualified as a banking lawyer in the heart of London. In the summer of 2012, I decided to quit my job and spend my life doing something I was extremely passionate about. I knew I wanted to explore my creative side! I had a good think about all the things I’d like to do in my life and thought, if I could do ANYTHING IN THE WORLD, what would it be?Who could I become that would bring the most benefit to the world as a Muslim woman? I really wanted establish something which would allow me to leave a legacy behind.Some key thingscame to mind:
On-going beneficial knowledge;
‘Sadaqah jariyah’ (ceaseless charity); and 
The hadith, or Prophetic saying that “Seven types of people will be shaded by God under His shade on the day when there will be no shade except His.”

Putting knowledge into actionI wanted to turn these key Islamic principles into actions and really make a difference. I'm determined to use my life to create a real legacy in children's Islamic education, not just for me, but for everyone involved.Why It's Important We Gain YOUR Support!We need your support to make our vision a reality and create a real legacy in children's Islamic educational publishing! 
Our vision is to create a legacy of accessible, high quality resources of on-going, beneficial knowledge which aim to (God Willing) inspire generations to come.
We’ve tried to find beautiful, creative and interactive resources that can encourage children to learn more about the magnificent stories from the Holy Quran. 
All the adults we’d spoken to had very fond memories of reading pop-up books as children and told us they’d love to have the same resources to teach their children more about the Quran.
We invite you to support us, to pre-order your exclusive signed copy and be a part of the Shade 7 legacy to make our vision a reality for all children to enjoy!Features of the book: Why it's so special!
Hand drawn & painted, creative illustrations with exceptional colour and design throughout the book
A variety of carefully thought out pop-up features, interactive flaps and tabs to really bring the story to life like never before
Educational quiz to test your knowledge of the story 
Colouring play mat and press-out pieces to create your own army of elephants to re-enact some of the historic scenes from the story
Hardback cover with high quality finish throughout
Beautiful, luxurious, gold foil stamped, hand designed title on the cover
Our book is double the size of a standard children’s pop-up story book, containing 13 spreads
Each of the pop-up features in the book are put together by hand
What We Need & What You GetWe need as many of you as possible to order a copy (or copies) of our magnificent Pop-up Story of The Elephant: Surah Al-Fil Pop-up Book to arrive God willing, in time for Eid 2014. They will make the perfect gift for any child! The purpose of this campaign is also to give many of you who missed out on the first one, the chance to join in and be a part of the Shade 7 publishing legacy, and to give original backers a way to add funds for shipping or choose additional perks, while we continue to develop our website. Special Note: The content of this follow-up campaign comes from the first campaign. If you have questions or concerns, please email: info@shade7.co.uk Description of Perks:Some of Our Perks
Our Charitable Commitment 
At Shade 7 we firmly believe in supporting the religious, spiritual and educational development of all children.Our commitment is to donate a minimum of 25 books for every 1,000 copies sold as gifts to less fortunate children around the world via our Charity Partner READ Foundation (Registered Charity Number 1114808) whose focus is on education for children in rural areas.We’d love for you to help us deliver on our promise to help make less fortunate children really happy too!The ImpactThis project is much more than just publishing children’s Quranic Pop-up Books and 3D apps. It has a much deeper impact and intention for the future of children’s Islamic educational publishing.We’ve summarised the 7 key things which our project is all about: 
Creating a Legacy of outstandingly beautiful, long-lasting resources to pass on beneficial knowledge that teaches children about the importance of faith and the rich, valuable lessons from the stories in the Quran.
Creating Exceptional and inspirational designs of the highest quality in the material we publish.
Making our published materials Accessible to all children, from all backgrounds and faiths to enjoy. This is highlighted particularly through our commitment with our Charity Partner READ Foundation who champion education for all.  
Igniting a curiosity in all children to Discover the profound and exciting and moral stories in the Qur’an. For Muslim children, we hope it will inspire the discovery into the beauty of the Arabic language to understand the depth of these stories further.
Creating innovative Educational resources to make learning about Islam truly inspiring and fun for all.
Developing a deeper sense of Respect and tolerance in children from an early age towards other faiths and beliefs, bridging gaps and highlighting the similarities in the stories of the Old Testament to the Quranic stories in particular – something which will develop further as our series progresses.
Developing a child’s Spiritual needs and interests as they grow older, cultivating an awareness of their Creator and creating a bond with Him through fond memories of reading these sensational stories.
I Forgot to Pay Shipping on the first campaign!Not a problem. We realise it may have been a little confusing for our international customers. If you did order a book and forgot to add on shipping, please see our international postage list below to work out the additional cost. You can select the "No Perk" option and simply add the relevant amount. Trade EnquiriesAll trade enquiries for retail, wholesale and distribution will now be directed to our third party distributors in the UK who will manage all our orders going forward.Please email: wholesale@shade7.co.uk with your interest. Please note you will be asked to fill out a new account and credit application form, which we will forward onto our third party distributors, who will have their own set of terms, conditions and set trade discounts. 3D Interactive AppIf we raise enough support, we want to create an exceptional App, with great 3D graphics mimicking the paper-engineered feel of the books and incorporate a level of interactivity that both parents and children will enjoy.   Parents will also have an option to record their own voice on the Surah Al-Fil App so the child can hear the story in a familiar voice when mum or dad might not be free to sit and read with them.There’ll also be plenty of other special treats in store!Sharing We're running this campaign until our website is fully developed, up and running. In order to take advantage of our special packages on offer in time for Eid, please do continue to SHARE, TWEET, EMAIL and SPREAD THE WORD to all your nearest and dearest, via the sharing icons shown under the campaign video (example screen shot below) - and encourage them to be part of our legacy too! UK PostageAll UK orders include shipping costs within the offer itself. All UK orders will be sent by a special delivery, fully tracked service. As each book weighs over 1kg, we are able to offer a flat rate of £6.20 shipping for up to 30 books in the UK and we have already included this in the price of the offers for ease. International Postage Please find below a table of international shipping rates. If you have any trouble with calculating the shipping amount, please email:info@shade7.co.uk and we'll help you work this out. International Zones

story:
The Wild Hunt's 2013 Fall Funding Drive

"There are few resources I feel benefits all in the Pagan umbrella. The Wild Hunt is on the top of that short list for me." - David Salisbury, author of The Deep Heart of Witchcraft: Expanding the Core of Magickal Practice

Hello, my name is Jason Pitzl-Waters, a journalist who covers the religious movement known as Modern Paganism. Approximately one year ago, I decided to make The Wild Hunt, a Pagan news site which I've been running continuously since 2004, an independent entity again after a year of being hosted by an outside media company. It wasn't an easy decision, and it came with fiscal, logistical, and technical headaches, but I believe, and still believe, that The Wild Hunt's mission to provide news, information, context, and unique perspectives about our interconnected religious communities needed to grow and exist as something outside the confines of its previous host. 

In taking that step, I also did something unprecedented in my history running this site: I brought on staff writers and columnists, and decided to pay them for their high-quality contributions. I wanted The Wild Hunt to stop simply being about me and my perspectives, for it to become a true Pagan news magazine and daily destination for Pagans, Heathens, polytheists, pantheists, and the many other branches of our ever-expanding religious communities. One year later, I think we have made important steps down that road, and I'm incredibly proud of the work we've done. Now, as we get ready to start another year, we need our community, our readership, more than ever if The Wild Hunt is going to thrive and continue its mission. 

Today is the beginning of a new Fall Funding Drive, and we're asking for a base budget of $10,000 dollars to run for another year, and we're hoping that you will help us not only meet this goal, but surpass it and allow us to do even more. The more we raise, the more we can do. Want to see more regular columnists? Want to see more staff writers? Would you like to see that I actually receive a salary from The Wild Hunt in 2013? Then I would love to see us push well past that base goal in the coming month. I know that there are many thousands of readers out there, and I know it would only take a fraction donating to not only fund us, but help us greatly expanding the coming year. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what $10,000 dollars will do:

$2,490 - Professional-level hosting with WP Engine. 
$3,600 - Annual Budget for Current Staff (1) & Columnists (4)
$700 - IndieGogo Percentage (assuming full funding)
$110 - Estimated Credit Card Processing Fees
$2,700 - Paying the editor and primary contributor (Jason), guest columnists, and other fees associated with running the site. 

What I'd like to do if we surpass the goal:

Pay myself a base salary of $5000 per year (an additional $2000). 
Double staff editor/contributor Heather Greene's salary (and additional 1,200)
Add more columnists, and another weekly news writer (additional 2,400)

We could do all that if we raise 5,600 over our goal. 

The more we raise, the more we can do. The level of support you, our community, collectively gives, will dictate our next year. 

This year, for perks, we're expanding! More advertising options, and everyone who donates at least $5 will get enrolled into an exclusive email list where I and the other staff members will send updates, pictures from events, early announcements, and other special exclusive goodies! 

The Impact

The Wild Hunt has a proven track record that stretches over nearly 10 years, and over those years we've become an essential news source and inspired many to create their own media. We've interviewed big-name Pagans like Margot Adler and Starhawk, reported on controversies and inspirational moments that have affected our community deeply, and acted as a watchdog when the mainstream media reports on modern Pagans and other minority faith traditions. However, the commitment, time, and energy needed to make this sustainable can only happen if you are willing to step forward and help us fund it. 

Over the years many have said our community has a hard time supporting institutions and services that benefit them. I don't believe that. I think we can come together if something is worthwhile, and goes to the trouble to ask. I believe The Wild Hunt is giving something unique to our community, and I am asking you, please help us expand and grow into an independent institution that can serve your daily news and information needs. Our success won't just be for us, it will be for you, and for those who follow us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute now, you can still help! Just share this campaign on Facebook, on Twitter, on Tumblr, on your favorite Pagan email list, and let them know why this is important to you. The more people speak out, the better we can do!

The more we raise, the more we can do. Want to see more regular columnists? Want to see more staff writers? Would you like to see that I actually receive a salary from The Wild Hunt in 2013? Then I would love to see us push well past that base goal in the coming month. I know that there are many thousands of readers out there, and I know it would only take a fraction donating to not only fund us, but help us greatly expanding the coming year. What We Need & What You GetHere's what $10,000 dollars will do:
$2,490 - Professional-level hosting with WP Engine. $3,600 - Annual Budget for Current Staff (1) & Columnists (4)$700 - IndieGogo Percentage (assuming full funding)$110 - Estimated Credit Card Processing Fees$2,700 - Paying the editor and primary contributor (Jason), guest columnists, and other fees associated with running the site. 
What I'd like to do if we surpass the goal:
Pay myself a base salary of $5000 per year (an additional $2000). Double staff editor/contributor Heather Greene's salary (and additional 1,200)Add more columnists, and another weekly news writer (additional 2,400)
We could do all that if we raise 5,600 over our goal. The more we raise, the more we can do. The level of support you, our community, collectively gives, will dictate our next year. This year, for perks, we're expanding! More advertising options, and everyone who donates at least $5 will get enrolled into an exclusive email list where I and the other staff members will send updates, pictures from events, early announcements, and other special exclusive goodies! The ImpactThe Wild Hunt has a proven track record that stretches over nearly 10 years, and over those years we've become an essential news source and inspired many to create their own media. We've interviewed big-name Pagans like Margot Adler and Starhawk, reported on controversies and inspirational moments that have affected our community deeply, and acted as a watchdog when the mainstream media reports on modern Pagans and other minority faith traditions. However, the commitment, time, and energy needed to make this sustainable can only happen if you are willing to step forward and help us fund it. Over the years many have said our community has a hard time supporting institutions and services that benefit them. I don't believe that. I think we can come together if something is worthwhile, and goes to the trouble to ask. I believe The Wild Hunt is giving something unique to our community, and I am asking you, please help us expand and grow into an independent institution that can serve your daily news and information needs. Our success won't just be for us, it will be for you, and for those who follow us. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't contribute now, you can still help! Just share this campaign on Facebook, on Twitter, on Tumblr, on your favorite Pagan email list, and let them know why this is important to you. The more people speak out, the better we can do!

story:
As the owner of a beautiful Weimaraner i found myself living with a dog that has a very special character. 

Known by their beauty and spectacular look, you can increasingly see more and more Weimaraners on the streets of big cities. In some cases, however, these dogs unfortunately end up living in shelters as they get abandoned by their owners who initially just picked them amongst other breeds due to their beauty and not because they were the right breed of dog for them.

Is this dog for you?

In 2011 we published a Spanish website to answer some of the questions that Weimaraner owners had and this website quickly gained popularity. The site now has around 3.000 visits per month, is third in Google searches and we receive more and more letters from people asking for tips and advice. http://www.mibracodeweimar.com

This made us think that we should share our experiences more widely by writing a book in English with the help of a professional Dog Whisperer featuring information on how you can train, educate and basically get to know your precious dog closer.

We would like to help current and future  Weimar owners discover whether  this breed fits with their lifestyle, while also learning some basics in obedience and puppy training


What to expect from this book?

14  chapters carefully chosen to include information, advice and tips on:

  1. Origins of the breed
  2. Breeding, health, medical and temperament questions
  3. Vital Statistics: height and weight, life expectancy, intelligence
  4. Characteristics
  5. Temperament
  6. Coat, colors and types
  7. Grooming, nail, ear and teeth care
  8. Feeding and Health issues
  9. Emergency cases
  10. Training
  11. Obedience
  12. Activity requirements & sports you can share with your dog
  13. Is this Weim for you?
  14. Interesting Facts

… alongside a collection of beautiful Weimaraner photos. 


We need your help to  

Finance the writing of the book 

Edit it beautifully and produce paperback copies.

Translate it into Spanish and perhaps additional languages


What You Get in Return

- With 5$ funding we will give a THANK YOU shout out on our website

- With 10$ funding you will get a THANK YOU + this beautiful POSTCARD of our Weimy.


- With 15$ funding you will get a THANK YOU + a copy of our EBOOK in PDF in English or Spanish, as you wish!

- With 35$ funding you will get a THANK YOU + a KEEP CALM and OWN a WEIM Tshirt. 

- With 40$ funding you will get a copy of our EBOOK in English or Spanish + a KEEP CALM and OWN a WEIM Tshirt. 

Check how cool @wizb77 Weims look with this super cool Keep Calm and Own a Weim Tshirts!


Tshirt rewards by Teelaunch


- With 60$ funding you will get a copy of our EBOOK in English or Spanish + a KEEP CALM and OWN a WEIM Tshirt + a paperback COPY of the BOOK in English or Spanish. 

- With 85$ funding you will get a copy of our EBOOK in English or Spanish + 2 KEEP CALM and OWN a WEIM Tshirts + a paperback COPY of the BOOK in English or Spanish.

+ a big THANK YOU on our website.

Questions you Might Have.

Tshirt Sizes available are: S - M - L - XL - XXL 

We will get in touch with you to ask you which size would you like after the campaign is finished.

Shipping is included.

Tshirts and Ebooks will be sent inmediately. Printed copies of the book should be shipped in May.


The Impact

By contributing to this campaign The Weimaraner book will receive more visibility and will help people understand how special this breed of dog is and whether these dogs match certain lifestyles.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute towards the funding but like the idea, then please help us spread the word amongst friends or share it across your social networks

Who We Are 

We are Gemma and Mus and we have been together for nearly four years now.
When Mus was 6 months old we took her to puppy obedience and agility lessons and learnt a lot from our great instructors and friends. When Mus grew up we started joining popular dog&human sports, such as: canicross. In 2011 we created a specialized website to help other Weimar owners to answer some questions and issues they faced when living with these incredible dogs.  

This book will help you learn about how to train your puppy, the basics of obedience, which activities and sports you can share together and much, much more! 


THANK YOU VERY MUCH!

story:
Make 2015 The Last Unfair Election

For months we have been working on a campaign website that will spell it all out – Why Every Vote Should Count! Why Proportional Representation will create the solid foundation we need to deal with the most important issues of our time – climate change, income inequality, a stable economy and fair representation for women and minorities.

Canada's Winner-Take-All Electoral System gives skewed results where a government that only gets 39% of the popular vote can receive 100% of the power. Then, that government can ideologically change the policies of the country without the approval of the 61% of voters who voted for something else. In addition to this unfair by-product of our system, close to 1/2 of all votes in every election don't elect anyone and those voters are unrepresented in our government.

We believe, in a true democracy, all voters should be represented and should be allowed to participate in the policies of the Country. 85% of OECD countries use proportional representation where votes count and Parties get seats that reflect actual votes. It's about democracy.

We Need a Robust Campaign Budget to Change The System

Can you help us build the most important electoral reform campaign in Canada’s history?

  • If we can raise $10,000, we can create 3 motion graphics videos that
    will highlight different examples of proportional representation.

  • If we raise $15,000, we can create three videos plus add an interactive cross-country map on our website that will give voters crucial riding information going into the 2015 election.

  • If we collect $60,000+, we can create the videos, the map and
    organize ads in community newspapers.
I think you get the picture. The more we collect, the more we can do – ads, billboards and lawn signs.

Canadians, like us, know we need a better system – one that represents everyone so we can work on the most important issues of our time.

There are a lot of things wrong with our democracy. Getting rid of our winner-take-all first-past-the-post system and replacing it with a system that makes all our votes count is crucial – and we need the resources to get it done.

It's about Democracy!

We’ve compiled the research. Proportional electoral systems strongly correlate with higher voter turnout, more satisfied voters, lower income inequality, better environmental outcomes, political stability and even higher economic growth. When votes count, people have more power, and policies reflect what they want.

It's not going to be easy

We need politicians to change the system and we know that even politicians who prefer proportional representation often change their tune when they get in positions of power. Heck, even Stephen Harper applauded Proportional Representation in his paper called "Our benign dictatorship" but you won't see him implementing it any time soon.

In order to change the system, we will need to grow a critical mass of Canadians calling for change. We can do it but we need your help!

Chip in now to make sure we're ready in 2015!

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family. (Crowd sourcing only works when we share the campaign with others.)
  • Email it to you friends with a heartfelt plea as to why you think this campaign is so important!
  • Share it on social media.
  • Tweet about it.
  • Use Indiegogo's crowd sourcing tools

Suggested tweets:
Donate today to help build the biggest democratic reform movement in Canadian History. True democracy respects all votes. #PR2015

True Democracy needs your support. Help Fair Vote raise its campaign budget now to make 2015 the last unfair election #PR2015

Thank you! Together, We Can Do This!
www.fairvote.ca

story:
Who We Are

Political Research Associates (PRA) is a human rights think tank that partners with social justice movements both in the United States and around the world.  We provide original, action-oriented research and expert analysis to human rights groups, news media, policymakers, grassroots activists, and all those looking to advance social justice.

In 2009, Political Research Associates researcher Rev. Dr. Kapya Kaoma went undercover in Africa to expose the involvement of American rightwing evangelicals in attacks on LGBTQ rights and women’s reproductive freedom. In Uganda, he filmed the conference where Americans urged Ugandan leaders to persecute LGBTQ people – an event that led directly to the drafting of the “Kill the Gays Bill.” PRA’s explosive video footage brought worldwide attention to the globalization of U.S. culture wars and helped inspire the award-winning documentary,God Loves Uganda, narrated by Kaoma. 

Our Campaign

“Each of us has a role in stopping the persecution of sexual minorities across the globe. Kapya Kaoma and Political Research Associates are showing us why it is urgent that we do so–and how and where to begin. I highly recommend American Culture Warriors in Africa, as an excellent starting point for all who are committed to ending oppression and sharing the true message of God’s all-inclusive love.”
Archbishop Desmond Tutu

On May 19th, more than a million people will watch the national PBS broadcast of God Loves Uganda, and millions more will be able to watch it on Netflix, iTunes, or DVD!  The documentary, which powerfully depicts how U.S. evangelicals foment intolerance and homophobia abroad, leaves audiences shocked, enraged, and asking, “What can I do to stop this?”

PRA has a new tool to help audiences answer that question.  Our guidebook, American Culture Warriors in Africa: A Guide to the Exporters of Homophobia and Sexism, exposes the American bad actors most responsible for this crisis and provides guidelines for concrete actions we can take here in the U.S. to stop the persecution of women and sexual minorities overseas. This guidebook—which includes profiles of key players, an overview of their culture war campaigns in Africa, and a case study in effective local organizing—will orient activists and all people of conscience to the global scale of this threat while empowering them to take meaningful action here at home. Many of the American culture warriors included in the guide actively campaign against the full equality of women, LGBTQ people, and other communities here in the United States as well, creating a shared agenda with human rights activist abroad.

This is an unprecedented opportunity to engage millions of Americans in stopping the U.S.-based roots of global homophobia, sexism, and discrimination—but we need your help to publish this guide and get it into the hands of activists! Publishing costs can overwhelm a small non-profit like ours, and we’re working hard to make sure that our budget restrictions don’t limit the number of people we can reach with this important information. 

What We Need & What You Get

To help cover the costs of publishing and distributing the book, we’re seeking to raise $10,000 before the May 19th national broadcast of God Loves Uganda. Donations will not only help with the publishing costs but will also help us distribute the book to activists in the U.S. and Africa, where, in many countries, this critical information has been banned.

This project is about change, not charity. Many of the American groups and individuals highlighted in our guide are at the forefront of attacks on LGBTQ communities and women’s reproductive autonomy—both the U.S. and in Africa. As people are becoming more aware of the problem, we need to provide audiences with effective actions and recommendations they can take to confront and, ultimately, to put an end to the spread of the culture wars around the world.

$5-Moral Supporter: Social media shout-out.  Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, you name it we’ll let all our friends and yours know how awesome you are!

$10-Social Justice Activist: A heartfelt personalized thank you from PRA

$25-Social Justice Partner: Pre-order one copy of American Culture Warriors in Africa and a $10 donation to PRA!

$50-Capacity Builder: A signed copy of American Culture Warriors in Africa for you + and we’ll ship one book out to a U.S. activist!

$100-Global Citizen: A signed copy of American Culture Warriors in Africa for you + and we’ll ship one book out to an African-based activist!

$500-Solidarity Partner: One copy of American Culture Warriors in Africa for you + and we’ll ship a whole box of books to African activists!  We’ll also sign you up for a two year subscription to our Public Eye quarterly magazine.

$1,000-Human Rights Champion: One copy of book + a personal 60 minutes Skype strategy session with PRA staff!

$5,000-Culture War Blockader: For the first two people who donate $5,000, we’ll fly you out to Boston (from the continental US), set you up for two nights at a local hotel, greet you at our office, and treat you to a delicious lunch with PRA staff!  Oh, and we’ll throw in a signed copy of the book too! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t donate but want to help?  Please share this campaign far and wide, from Facebook and Twitter to Indiegogo and email!  The more people who watch God Loves Uganda and use the guidebook to help fight back, the more change we can make!

Additionally, by educating and inspiring people who live in the same communities as leading American culture war “exporters,” PRA’s new Know Your Neighbors education project aims to connect activists with practical opportunities to take effective local action that makes a difference both here and abroad—and it’s gaining steam!  To find out more about how you can get involved, email us at contact [at] politicalresearch [dot] org.

story: Your funds will allow us to hire a seasoned and published professional author to write the necessary book proposal. As is common industry practice, the proposal will then be used to attract the right publisher who will partner with us to finish the book.  The book proposal is key, and your support and funds are deeply appreciated and essential to this first important step. Thank you for partnering with us to let the world know that miracles still happen! If we do not achieve our goal, the funds submitted will still receive their perks.

story:
Trafika Europe: a vision for literature in Europe

At Trafika Europe, we want to bring you great new fiction and poetry in English translation from across Europe. Our effort is special because we want to foster a greater sense of community in Europe. With our online journal, live cross-border events, and Europe's first streaming online "literary" radio station, we can put a spotlight on our shared family of cultures, and support the beautiful stories of fiction writers and poets seeking to make sense of the extraordinary changes we are living through in Europe. We can do this with just a fraction of the budget of a commercial arts magazine. How is this possible? Only with your support. If every visitor to this campaign gives just £10, we could finish our development, prepare our launch issue and events, and cover our operating costs for the next year. Pretty exciting, right? Can you help with this? It takes just a couple of minutes to make sure that Trafika Europe is here for all of us in the coming year.


As our newest Editorial Board member, Ron Butlin, puts it:

"I am very pleased that Trafika Europe is making its home in Edinburgh. With its impressive history of involvement with contemporary literature in translation, Trafika Europe is well-positioned to help bring literary communities in Europe closer together. Exploring European identity and inclusiveness in culture is a mission which we in Scotland also hold dear, and so I'm delighted to be supporting and participating with Trafika Europe."
Ron Butlin, Edinburgh's Makar - Poet Laureate
Trafika Europe Editorial Board


Our Goals

Trafika Europe wants to celebrate what is best in new literature across the continent. Our goal is also to bridge the gap between old and new publishing models and reach out to a new generation online. We're especially keen to find and translate exciting new talent in Europe, often by offering them an international, English-speaking audience for the very first time.

. . . and featuring Trafika Europe Radio! Enjoy more of the literature you love. Besides great audio readings, we'll go behind the scenes, to host discussions with authors, publishers and translators, cover book launches and readings, festivals and other events, and play "literary" music from across Europe. By partnering with existing literary magazines, university departments, and publishers across Europe, we can help build real community radio for literature in Europe, and honour and connect with the many existing efforts already underway. We'll also help you keep up with events with our updated calendar of literary happenings throughout the continent.

Our launch will include events co-hosted by Ron Butlin  at Summerhall during the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in August, the biggest performance, arts and literary festival in the world. Our launch focus is on writing from Europe's northern islands, including new works from Scottish Gaelic, Irish Gaelic, and from the Faroe Islands, Iceland and Norway.

We really need your help to manage this final push to launch.

Your donation will help us in several vital areas:

  • to complete our website development;
  • to get our radio component up to speed;
  • to open our office;
  • to prepare materials for our first issue, and
  • to host our launch events in the Edinburgh Fringe Festival.

Won't you please help us finish preparations for launch and make this extraordinary project possible?

There is an urgency to such approaches too, as an alternative to the rocky political and economic conversation, as Europe casts about for fresh approaches toward a sense of belonging more together in culture. Trafika Europe wants to explore issues of identity in Europe, in terms of the many ways our literature interacts with who we are. Along the way we'll examine the many related questions of race and ethnicity, minority and migrant cultures, and the cultural interrelations that make up the vibrant face of Europe today.

As one of our friends, the Scottish Poetry Library, says:

Scottish writers have always understood that there should be two-way traffic with Europe, and Scottish poetry in particular has had a dialogue with European poetry that has refreshed and energised the practice of Scottish poets. I am delighted that Trafika Europe proposes to make such dialogue and exchange the heart of its work, and hope that its new homes – physically in Edinburgh, virtually online – will be hospitable to a whole range of European voices.
Robyn Marsack, Director, Scottish Poetry Library

Our History

Trafika Europe has a uniquely wonderful history as the successor to Trafika Press, Inc., producing Trafika, a print quarterly published out of Prague and New York of new literature from around the world in English translation.

In seven issues, we published the work of over 120 authors writing in over 30 languages. Contributors included: Czeslaw Milosz, Tomaz Salamun, Natasza Goerke, Mohammed Choukri, Ales Debeljak, Anna Swir, Gyorgy Konrad, Peter Nadas, Uche Nduka, Eleni Sikelianos, Yusef Komunyakaa, Martin M. Simecka, Hanoch Levin, Tor Ulven, Ilona Lackova, and Javiar Marias.

Our Board of Advisors (in their then-positions) included Morgan Entrekin (Grove/Atlantic); Tracy Cabanis (Alfred A. Knopf); George Dillehay (Publication Management); Jonathan Fanton (The MacArthur Foundation); Daniel Halpern (Ecco Press); Stephen Heintz (EastWest Institute); Peter Kaufman (TV Books); Jeri Laber (Human Rights Watch); Lewis Lapham (Harper’s Magazine); Maristella Lorch (The Italian Academy, New York); Wendy Luers (Foundation for a Civil Society); Marley Rusoff (Bantam, Doubleday & Dell); William Schwalbe (William Morrow & Co.); Elisabeth Sifton (Farrar, Straus & Giroux); Rebecca Sinkler (the New York Times), and Lise Stone. 

We received glowing reviews in several dozen media outlets including the Guardian, Washington Post, New York Times Magazine, Times Literary Supplement, TIME-International, The New Yorker, and an interview on NBC Evening News. Praise for Trafika includes the following:

If magazines still exist 20 years from now… the literary ones are likely to resemble an attractive new quarterly… called Trafika.
The Washington Post
representative of the directions life will take as the world continues to come together: an inclusive one… comparisons neglect the originality… the literature of tomorrow today.
The LA Reader
a lit hit with international readers… sophisticated
 TIME-International
features some heavy hitters… but more committed to publishing emerging writers… translated into English for the first time.
 The International Herald-Tribune
Good stuff!
The Guardian
new voices sing out
Times Literary Supplement

PEN-International honoured our overall effort with an event in New York City in our name.

As the successor organisation, now Trafika Europe is putting a frame of Europe around this effort.

Our pre-launch event was a great evening gala on Romani literature and identity which we hosted at Conway Hall in London last June. Please check out our Romani literature event highlights video. Participants included two top UK poets George Szirtes and David Morley. We hosted this as a charity event for the European Roma Rights Centre, who joined us on stage for a roundtable discussion on identity, hosted by BBC television correspondent for Central Europe, Nick Thorpe. We are pleased to say Nick has also joined the Trafika Europe editorial board.


Trafika Europe is strictly not-for-profit, and plans to give a wide international platform to the authors we select and showcase, with our online journal and radio. We aim to help selected authors with translations, interviews, readings and follow-on publishing opportunities, and to provide an easy click-through facility for direct book purchasing.

Laying down this fresh page for European literature is so easy. All we need is the will and experience, which we have, and really the tiniest bit of support – approximately 0.0002% of the budget Europe has earmarked for culture in this time!

Won't you please help make this effort a reality with a small contribution? Even the smallest bit helps!

To thank you for your support, we have lined up some exciting incentives.

A top highlight of this is a special sculpture donated by renowned sculptor Keith Mellard. Titled Nurture, this warm piece explores one idealised role for Europe. Nurture is made of Hoptonwood Stone about two-thirds of a foot high, and stands on a black Caithness stone base. This piece is gallery-listed at a value of £850, and is our unique thanks to one special donor.


Many thanks to Keith for supporting this campaign with his work.

And profuse thanks to many others, sung and unsung, who are helping make this project a reality. Won't you please consider adding your support to these? If you can, sharing this campaign link with all your friends and colleagues, by email and social media, is the best possible way of helping us spread the word. And please sign up at Trafika Europe – sign-up is in the upper-right corner at the Trafika Europe site – to receive free news and updates as we approach our launch.


It's such a great help, and we really are dependent on this for making this project a success. Let's make this fresh page for European literature happen all together! And thank you so much for any donation to this unique new effort which you can give.
story_txt:

At Trafika Europe, we want to bring you great new fiction and poetry in English
translation from across Europe. Our effort is special because we want to foster
a greater sense of community in Europe. With our online journal, live
cross-border events, and Europe's first streaming online "literary"
radio station, we can put a spotlight on our shared family of cultures, and support the beautiful stories of fiction writers and poets seeking to make sense of the
extraordinary changes we are living through in Europe. We can do this with
just a fraction of the budget of a commercial arts magazine. How is this possible?
Only with your support. If every visitor to this campaign gives just £10,
we could finish our development, prepare our launch issue and events, and cover
our operating costs for the next year. Pretty exciting, right? Can you help with this? It takes just a couple of minutes to make sure that Trafika Europe is here for all of us in the coming year.

As our newest Editorial Board member, Ron Butlin, puts it:"I am very pleased that Trafika
Europe is making its home in Edinburgh. With its impressive history of
involvement with contemporary literature in translation, Trafika Europe is well-positioned to help bring literary
communities in Europe closer together. Exploring European identity and
inclusiveness in culture is a mission which we in Scotland also hold dear, and
so I'm delighted to be supporting and participating with Trafika Europe."
Ron Butlin, Edinburgh's Makar -
Poet LaureateTrafika Europe

story:
Hello again to those of you who saw the first Indiegogo campaign. Last year, my editor, Tara Frauendienst, and I ran a campaign for editing funds on Roll the Bones, the third book in my Peter the Wolf Series. We’ve completed edits on the final book, Thicker Than Blood, and now I’m looking to fund another campaign to pay for her edits. As with the campaign before I won’t be making any funds from this campaign and all contributions will go toward paying Tara.

For those interested, the funds will go to pay for my final semester class of college so that I officially have a degree.

 

This time around, the incentives for contributions are:

For a $5 donation, you get an ebook copy of Thicker Than Blood a few weeks before the final release, and a copy of a new dark fantasy release, A Boy and His Dawg. You can choose between mobi, epub, or PDF editions, though special requests may be offered if your eReader needs some other file format. All contributors can get their names listed on the back page of the book, either their real name or their online handle, whichever they prefer.

For $10, you get both the books offered at the $5 plus a copy of my fallen angel dark fantasy Saving Gabriel.

For $15, contributors will get all of the above plus copies of the previous three Peter the Wolf books. This is the best option to choose if you’ve not yet started the series and want to pick up the whole set at a discount.

Finally, for donating $25, you get all the above eBooks plus copies of Waiting for a Miracle and A Frosty Girl’s Cure. So for your generous contribution, you’ll get a complete series about skinwalkers, a new novel about moon wolves, another about fallen angels, and a pair of novels about super villains and superheroes. Not a bad haul, all told.

Additionally, as added incentive, I (Tara) will bake a batch of homemade cookies (your choice of flavor), for any contributors who donate $100 or more. That will be shipped USPS Priority Mail.

 

So what’s the final book about? (Some spoilers below if you haven’t read the first 3 books.)

After escaping a life of sexual slavery, Peter Holmes has fought weredogs, golems, and vampires, and he’s won his freedom from a term of indentured servitude to a harpy. Yet even with these victories behind him, he still has yet to tame his inner demons and come to terms with his animal urges as a lycanthrope.

His return to Dallas, Pennsylvania also brings new dilemmas with the weredogs and his adoptive family, and his muddled sexuality forces him to reconsider his relationship with Alice. Even as he struggles to behave, Peter’s wolf becomes infatuated with his enigmatic best friend Pi, who thinks that becoming a skinwalker is romantic. But biting Pi will mean war with the weredogs, and expulsion from his family.

Spiraling down into the depths of his addiction, Peter meets a strange werewolf who reeks of death. Chasing down this deadly wolf, Peter learns more dark secrets about the weredogs, and he sees in this monster traces of what he may become if he can’t gain control of his animal urges.

Faced with a moral dilemma, Peter must decide where his loyalties lie. In this shocking conclusion to the Peter the Wolf series, there are no easy answers, and no victories gained without painful sacrifices. Will Peter accept that he is a monster and help destroy the weredogs? Or will he find the strength to be the hero that everyone expects him to be?
