story:
Action-packed South Indian stories

Most of the writing that gets translated into English from Indian languages is serious literary fiction, focused either on social issues or ancient history. But there is an entirely different universe of lurid, fast-paced thrillers that are massively more popular—they're just not usually considered worthy of translation.

The Tamil language has a particularly robust pulp fiction scene that's been going strong since the 1930s. Here are some recent covers:

In our first two anthologies, released in 2008 and 2010, Blaft Publications worked with translator Pritham K. Chakravarthy to bring the work of several bestselling Tamil pulp authors into English for the first time, to an enthusiastic reception well past our expectations. 

Since then, many readers have been asking us for more. 

The contents

Here's what we've got lined up for Volume 3:

  • Operation Nova by Tamilmagan. A science fiction epic that made waves when it was serialized in the Tamil weekly Anantha Vikatan last year. The story begins with a young man being abducted from his seat at Sathyam Cinemas in Chennai and beamed to a faraway spacecraft. "Harder" than most Indian-language science fiction, the book also features a race of nitrogen-eating aliens, a disembodied brain, and extraterrestrial encounters with Bill Gates and Angelina Jolie.

     

  • White Rose, Black Cat by Rajesh Kumar. The world's most prolific living fiction writer (he's been publishing 3 novels a month since 1968) serves up a deadly dish of murder, drugs, poison, illicit love affairs, corrupt officials, and local rowdies.

     

  • Shabaash, Susheela! by Pattukkottai Prabakar. A strange woman who claims to have premonitions of the future shows up in the offices of Moonlight Agencies, and warns the intrepid detective duo Bharat and Susheela about an imminent attempt to murder a popular film actress.

     

  • Look Out, Narendran! by Subha. A mysterious bomber blows up the Mambakkam Police Station, and warns that unless his demands are met, the Taj Mahal will be next. Can Narendran and Vaijayanthi catch him before he destroys the country's most famous monument?

     

  • Nowhere to Hide by Indra Soundar Rajan. A journalist arrives in a village near Thirunelveli to investigate a rash of murders. There he meets a young girl possessed by an angry spirit, who may be the key to catching the killer.

     

As before, we'll also include an assortment of author interviews and jokes from the pulp magazine front pages, as well as a full-color gallery of amazing pulp covers.

The cover art

Shyam, who painted the femmes fatales on our first two covers (download here), will be painting a new lethal enchantress to adorn the cover for Volume 3. Shyam is a virtuoso illustrator who deftly turns out dozens of striking, original images every week to meet the needs of top magazine publishers across all four southern Indian states. 

Read an excerpt

Getting a translation pitch-perfect is a tricky job. We want to keep as much local flavour as possible while still making the English sound natural no matter where you're from. We have a new translation team for Volume 3; to get a taste of our work, you can check out the lead story, which was published online last month by the UK literary magazine Granta. 

Advance order the book–or check out the higher-tier rewards

We love selecting stories, translating, editing, and designing great books. The part of independent publishing we don't love so much is hassling distributors to put the books on the shelves of the (dwindling) brick-and-mortar bookshops, and then fighting to collect money after they sell.

If we can get enough of you to pledge to buy the third volume in advance, we can pay all the authors and translators and editor and illustrator up front and have the book out by December. (But be sure check out the fun rewards for more generous contributions, too!)

Here's how we'll use the money


A few nice things people have said about us

  • "There are two reasons to buy [The Blaft Anthology of Tamil Pulp Fiction]. One, it's a wonderful read and, two, it's the best-produced paperback in the history of Indian publishing."

    —Mukul Kesavan, Outlook Magazine

  • "India needs about fifty more Blafts."

    —Jason Grunebaum, interview in The Quarterly Conversation

  • "Tamil pulp is the hottest thing discovered since sliced bread and heavy breathing."

    —Pritish Nandy, on Twitter

  • "[Blaft's] list of publications is excitingly idiosyncratic... [reading their pulp fiction translations is] like chewing on a big barrel of popcorn at the movies or absent-mindedly eating an entire spindle of cotton candy at a country fair."

    —Daisy Rockwell, Chapati Mystery

Even if you can't pledge money

You can still help us out by telling all your friends! Please use the share tools to let your social media circles know about our campaign!

(Big thanks to Radha Sunder for the video!)

story:
THE LIFE THAT SURROUNDS US HAS ALREADY RAISED $2,375 FROM PRIVATE DONATIONS AND THE A TO Z GRANT! KEEP US GOING!

 

Why?

My name is Iris, and I am an AmeriCorps worker stationed at John Amesse Elementary in the Denver Public School District. An integral part of my decision to join AmeriCorps stemmed from the desire to positively impact literacy and reinvigorate creative writing instruction in the classroom. In my time at Amesse, I have developed and implemented a creative writing enrichment program that includes a literary magazine component. I have been collecting student writing throughout the year, and over the next few months, students from neighboring high schools will join me to serve as volunteer editors. We will be teaming up with Tattered Cover, a local bookstore and independent printing press, to produce a beautiful magazine at the end of the school year. 

John Amesse Elementary is a Title I school (96% of our students receive free or reduced lunch)--funding for extra-curricular and supplementary programming is always a struggle. Please come on board with us to ensure that all 658 Amesse students receive a copy. I have seen the skill, imagination, and wisdom of my students through their writing. This school deserves to showcase its best writers in The Life That Surrounds Us, the 2012-13 literary magazine as named by Amesse student writers.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order for each Amesse student to receive a copy of the magazine, we need to raise a minimum of $4,000 for printing and production costs. Any leftover funding will be put toward a literary magazine for the 2013-14 school year. 

All donation levels will get you a copy of the magazine. Any donation above $20.00 ensures that your name will be included on the Contributor's List. From there, we will be reserving advertising space for donors inside and on the back cover. A $1,000 donation will get you everything, and your complimentary magazines will be signed by student authors! Please see the Perks section for details.

If I fail to reach my goal, we will still print as many magazines as we possibly can. 

 

The Impact

Your contribution will encourage a school culture of reading, writing, and creative expression. My students need to know that they deserve a space on the blank page. Please help me prove that to them. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word! Post our campaign link anywhere, anytime.

story:
Hello!

My name is Erin Lyndal Martin, and I am a writer.

I got my B.A. in English at Virginia Tech and my MFA in creative writing at the University of Alabama.  I have pretty much been writing consistently since I was 12 (I'm 31 now), and I keep getting more and more dedicated to it.

I write poetry, fiction, and creative nonfiction. I am also a music journalist and book reviewer.  Currently, the sites to which I regularly contribute are PopMatters, The Quietus, and The Rumpus (where I am assistant music editor).  I love all these publications, but it is all unpaid work.

Here are some links with more information about my work or links to articles:

-My CV (list of publications): http://erinlyndalmartin.tumblr.com/cv
-My PopMatters page: http://www.popmatters.com/pm/archive/contributor/414/
-My Rumpus page: http://therumpus.net/author/erin-lyndal-martin/
-My Quietus page: http://thequietus.com/users/7933

I have much more of a web presence than just the above links; feel free to Google me or contact me if you would like to read more.

Unfortunately, I am disabled in a way that prevents me from having a traditional job, so I receive SSDI benefits as my only income. (I can verify this if need be.) My Mac laptop died the other day, and there is no way I can afford to replace it on my own, so I am reaching out to you.

In addition to needing a laptop to continue to interview musicians and record those interviews, I need a laptop for all of my current writing projects. I have many various short stories, poems, and essays in progress.  Here are a few things I am working on that I need a laptop to complete:

-Deepest Mauve, a memoir (read more about it here: erinlyndalmartin.tumblr.com/post/48387633828)


-Nymphlight, a book of poems about early avant-garde films


-An untitled collection of inter-related short stories


-If a Body, a poetry manuscript largely concerned with female embodiment

As I own a lot of Mac software and am most used to using a Mac, I am trying to raise the funds for one.  I will be getting the most affordable one, which is still $1200. The other funds I am asking for will cover IndieGogo's portion of what I raise, shipping, and incidental accessories.

i have tried to include some fun perks for contributing, but please let me know if you have an idea for one that isn't listed.

I encourage you to check out the updates, as there will be interesting things posted there throughout the campaign.  Thank you for looking, for contributing as you are able, and sharing this with others.

story:
The Historic Savannah Theatre, the oldest continually operating theater in America, has agreed to host a book release and open-mic reading for our DeepKids (200 local public middle school students) in June 2013--but we need to raise $1000 to rent the space!

Deep is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that helps public middle school kids in Savannah, Georgia become better writers by providing free writing workshops. We recruit local writers and train them in running writing workshops. Every year, we serve about 400 kids, bringing them 10-12 weeks of workshops and one-on-one mentorship and instruction. And twice a year we publish their best work in a beautiful, professionally illustrated, printed, and bound book of their work. We want to give DeepKids this event in order to to honor and celebrate their hard work next spring.

Help us celebrate, encourage, and listen to our talented young people.

After we've met our goal of $1,000, additional monies will go towards funding the next Deep Speaks!

story:
Know Your Enemy: Reflections Of Narcissistic Personality Disorder

Know Your Enemy is a book that aims to create awareness of NPD (Narcissistic Personality Disorder), the associated abuse in relationships that accompanies the disorder and how to identify and cope with narcissistic people.  Many people all over the world are being emotionally and mentally abused and manipulated by narcissists yet have no idea the disorder even exists.

The contents of the book stem from:

12 Years direct experience of narcissistic abuse.

Psychological research and study into the personality disorder.

Study of the underlying factors that contribute to the disorder.

Study of the effects of narcissistic abuse.

Study of the narcissistic defense mechanism in order to learn how to cope with it.

For these reasons the book will be more about insightful information related to the experiences that spouses, relatives and friends of narcissistic personalities could be faced with, an understanding of why these traits are present and learning how to cope with them more effectively.

 

What Is Needed & What You Get

Funding is needed in order to print hard copies of the book (paperback).

A $5 (£3) option is available: e-book download & future downloads forever.

A wide range of incentives (perks) are available, be a part of the project!

If the target is not reached, the relevant number of books will be produced.

The book will never be made available commercially, if you wish to sell you choose your own price - no more will be printed after this project.

You will be entitled to free future e-book downloads by Sparkster... forever!

You will gain exclusive inside access to all future projects.

By contributing $20 or more your name/site/business will be published in the 'thanks to' section of the book.

The Impact

Creating awareness of NPD (Narcissistic Personality Disorder) is essential, the disorder is growing and the abuse often results in suicide as a form of escape. Together, we can help such people understand their experiences and potentially prevent these tragic deaths from happening:

Inflicted suicide as a result of narcissistic abuse needs to end.

Narcissistic abuse can lead to Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (and other disorders) and it can take 5 years or more to recover from the abuse.

You can also help by learning more about NPD at Hubpages.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you know someone who may be experiencing mental and/or emotional abuse please direct them to this link: http://sparkster.hubpages.com/hub/Narcissistic-....
  • Please help spread awareness of this campaign via your Facebook, Twitter, G+ and other social networking accounts.

Thank you for taking the time to read this campaign, I hope together we can make a difference.  Even if you do not contribute you can still help by sharing this campaign.


Sparkster

story:
Hello, my name is Jerry Brunoe. I am a Wasco Indian and was raised on the Warm Springs Reservation.  After graduating from high school (circa 2001), I attended OSU and immediately immersed myself in the writing world.  For a better understanding of who I am, please visit my staff page.

I am starting an indiegogo fundraiser to keep myself connected to my beloved craft.   I understand that I may never make it into the mainstream literary world, so I decided to start my own literary tradition. 

By becoming a Toe Good monetary contributor you will help not only myself become a part of the literary world, but also the poets that I will be publishing in book form.  I asked a friend what it was like to be published and she mentioned it was one of the best feelings she ever had.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise 7,500 dollars to start the book publishing part of Toe Good Poetry.

  1. Rhino would print 500 copies at 2,2150.10$.
  2. Neebin would do the cover design, table of contents, and typography at 500$.
  3. 750 dollars for book review (postage, copies, etc).
  4. 500$ for my web designer, Eric Sears.
  5. 120$ to set up a Pay Pal account for the website.
  6. 50$ fee for State of Oregon Central Business Registry.
  7. 250$ for 10 ISBN's through myidentifiers.com
  8. 250$ for 10 Barcodes through myidentifiers.com
  9. 750$ in postage for First Copy, Signed Copy, and First Five Book donors' books.
  10. The remaining money is for the leeway that I will need to ensure a succesful first printing.

We have six different monetary donation levels for potential contributors. Please see the right-hand sidebar for more information.

Some Fun Facts

  • The Literary Arts, especially poetry, often takes a back seat to other artistic endeavors.  By contributing to our start-up fund, you are helping many poets achieve their personal goals. 
  • Toe Good Poetry published their first poem on March 3, 2011.
  • We originally intended to publish only one poem per month, but started publishing two poems after our first submissions call was met enthusiastically.
  • We will be publishing 4-5 poems a month by March 3, 2013.
  • We have an International Fan Base.  We have readers that visit our site weekly.  They are from The United States, The United Kingdom, Canada, France, Mexico, Peru, Columbia, and Portugal.
  • We also have semi-regulary (monthly) readers from The Phillipines, Russia, Sweden, and a handful of other Countries.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the Toe Good Poetry Campaign.
  • Sign up for our subscription notices via facebook (facebook.com/toegood), twitter (@toegoodpoetry), or on the website's subscription notice page.

Why Contribute to us?

  • We are looking to publish those who don't get a chance in the traditional or mainstream literary communities.
  • To be succesful in this literary art, you are either raised by a handful of academic institutions and receive a stamp of approval through them such as a BA, Masters, or PhD; or you are an unbelievably talented and lucky spoken word artist that has a set of places to perform.
  • We want to support those that are between those two mediums--those Native Americans, Minorities, and other Literary Outcasts.
  • If you don't believe that it is the case, that it is hard for groups of people to make it in the literary world, please view Phillip Levine's quote below:

"I think that with blacks and Chicanos-- and Indians... something else has taken place that isn't so much in the awarding and judging.  It is something that takes place in their education where they are told that they can't write.  It's as simple as that.  They are discouraged from writing, so that you don't have chicano poets to speak of until rather recently.  They endured a school system which conspired, I think consciously, to tell them they could not write and even if they could learn to write they wouldn't write anything sophisticated or interesting enough to ever please this tremendous audience... In fact, they were told they were illiterate." -- Phillip Levine

story:
Short Summary

We can't see what we haven't healed. It is time for all sexual trauma survivors to re-claim their power so that we can watch out for our children and co-create a healthy world.

What is this 1 in 3 thing all about?

It’s a sad truth, but statistics tell us that one in three children has experienced childhood sexual abuse. Most of these women (and men) live lives of deep isolation and quiet desperation.

My book Blossom-Your 7 Step Journey to Healing Childhood Sexual Trauma is designed to help these women and men take charge and heal their hearts so that they can bring their light and gift to the world.

You might have heard this quote by the Dalai Lama - “It will be the Western woman who will help the planet at this time.” For that to happen, many women still need to come into their true, authentic power. I beleive that Blossom can make a huge contribution to this shift.

Meet Carolin Hauser

Hi there. For those of you who don’t know me, my name is Carolin Hauser. I’m a mother, a wife, an author, a dancer, and I am 1 in 3.

As you may or may not know, I’ve spent my life since the age of fifteen in search of finding a way to heal my own broken heart. I had to overcome severe eating disorders, and later, lived through co-dependent and abusive relationships. Then, continuing on my search, I even left my home country, Germany, and went to La Gomera, which is a small island off of the West Coast of Africa. I lived there in a tent in an intentional community, wedged between the huge mountains and the Atlantic Ocean.

I then left that part of the world and traveled across the Atlantic Ocean and over the Rocky Mountains to come to the West Coast of the United States, to Santa Barbara, where I live now. I love it here, compared to Germany it’s so much nicer. I live here with my children, my husband, and my community and I’m very happy to be here. My journey also led me through the study of naturopathic medicine and humanistic psychotherapy in Germany. I’ve  also been immersed in the world of Family Constellations, and have become a Family Constellations facilitator, and now work in that capacity. 

For the past three years I’ve been focused on taking everything that I’ve learned in healing myself and in working with other women, and that's how Blossom was born.

Why do I need you?

Blossom is written and it is edited, and I’ve really done all that I can do on my own. My husband has supported me greatly and lots of friends and people from my family have supported me greatly, but I’m at a point where I need the village to help spread the message, because it’s about that time. The book is ready to go to publication and it’s ready to do its work.

I’m doing this campaign to raise funds (10k to be exact) so that I can have the support and the tools that I need in order to get Blossom into the world, to publish it and to launch it successfully in November 2012, and to make it accessible to as many women as possible.

If you decide to participate, there is a whole list of nice perks that you get and of course, the greatest reward for you will be the transformation that women may have because Blossom will make it into their hands. (Good Karma!!!)

Here is how you can help:

Get your credit card out and give as much as you can.

For $15 you get Blossom (yes, the whole book) in its current PDF form.

For $1,000 you get to spend an entire VIP day with me.

There is lots of room in between... just look over to the right and pick a perk that you like.


Additionally, or perhaps more importantly, tell all your friends, your mother, your sister - anybody you know who we don't - to give us their money!

Spread the word! "Like" us on Facebook! Tweet something funny, inspiring and/or heartfelt (bonus points for doing both in 140 characters). Go to YouTube and "thumbs-up" the video. Leave a nice comment... 

You can share right from the Facebook/Twitter/Google+ buttons below the video or use some of these pre-crafted tweets to let the world know!

Are you 1 in 3? If so check out what @carolinhauser is up to http://tinyurl.com/945uelm

The Dalai Lama said it will be the Western woman who will save the world. Here is how: http://tinyurl.com/945uelm

Help women step into their authentic power.http://tinyurl.com/945uelm

Looking for ways to help others let their light shine?http://tinyurl.com/945uelm
 
Help @carolinhauser turn 1 in 3 to 0 http://tinyurl.com/945uelm
 
....Or if you feel creative and confident make up your own tweets and send them for us!
 
 
PS: And of course a campaign like this one wouldn't be possible without the help of many!
 
Thank you to my team: On the homefront, to Daniel (my husband) for copy editing and videographing and much more, to Maja (my daughter) for being my cheerleader, promoter, videographer and inspiration always..
to Nouri (my son) for being the light that he is!
 
To Christina Nett (my mom) for believing in me and helping me promote.
To Jenn August (my business coach) for supporting me and helping me stay on track!
To Caroline Bamforth-Firman for helping me with all the little things that need to get done.
 
To Heather Young and Varuna Narval for helping me take care of my kids when I can't.
 
To Christiane Ashleine for masterminding, helping me come up with creative ideas and being my friend.

Blossom is written and it is edited, and I’ve really done all that I can do on my own. My husband has supported me greatly and lots of friends and people from my family have supported me greatly, but I’m at a point where I need the village to help spread the message, because it’s about that time. The book is ready to go to publication and it’s ready to do its work.
I’m doing this campaign to raise funds (10k to be exact) so that I can have the support and the tools that I need in order to get Blossom into the world, to publish it and to launch it successfully in November 2012, and to make it accessible to as many women as possible.
If you decide to participate, there is a whole list of nice perks that you get and of course, the greatest reward for you will be the transformation that women may have because Blossom will make it into their hands. (Good Karma!!!)
Here is how you can help:
Get your credit card out and give as much as you can.
For $15 you get Blossom (yes, the whole book) in its current PDF form.
For $1,000 you get to spend an entire VIP day with me.
There is lots of room in between... just look over to the right and pick a perk that you like.
Additionally, or perhaps more importantly, tell all your friends, your mother, your sister - anybody you know who we don't - to give us their money!
Spread the word! "Like" us on Facebook! Tweet something funny, inspiring and/or heartfelt (bonus points for doing both in 140 characters). Go to YouTube and "thumbs-up" the video. Leave a nice comment... 
You can share right from the Facebook/Twitter/Google+ buttons below the video or use some of these pre-crafted tweets to let the world know!
Are you 1 in 3? If so check out what @carolinhauser is up to http://tinyurl.com/945uelm
The Dalai Lama said it will be the Western woman who will save the world. Here is how: http://tinyurl.com/945uelm
Help women step into their authentic power.http://tinyurl.com/945uelm

Looking for ways to help others let their light shine?http://tinyurl.com/945uelm
 
Help @carolinhauser turn 1 in 3 to 0 http://tinyurl.com/945uelm
 
....Or if you feel creative and confident make up your own tweets and send them for us!
 
 
PS: And of course a campaign like this one wouldn't be possible without the help of many!
 
Thank you to my team: On the homefront, to Daniel (my husband) for copy editing and videographing and much more, to Maja (my daughter) for being my cheerleader, promoter, videographer and inspiration always..
to Nouri (my son) for being the light that he is!
 
To Christina Nett (my mom) for believing in me and helping me promote.
To Jenn August (my business coach) for supporting me and helping me stay on track!
To Caroline Bamforth-Firman for helping me with all the little things that need to get done.
 
To Heather Young and Varuna Narval for helping me take care of my kids when I can't.
 
To Christiane Ashleine for masterminding, helping me come up with creative ideas and being my friend.

story:
The last remnants of humanity cling to survival on the Grid, a narrow patch of the planet visible to the world’s only remaining spy satellite. A secretive group of Analysts use the satellite feed to warn settlements of danger before it strikes. But their view of the Grid is only refreshed every 30 minutes, and the demons that live on the edge of their vision are getting craftier in their raids.

Anyuka is on the verge of becoming a full-fledged Analyst, working directly under her father in their base hidden in the mountains. A base they never leave. Nor do they permit any form of wired or wireless communication for fear of giving away their position. To get their warnings out to the settlers before it's too late, they use Couriers riding armored SlitPods, the fastest tech left over from before the apocalypse. But the mounting price of their secrecy forces Anyuka to question her father’s stark moral calculus, and begin to doubt their entire strategy for protecting humankind.

Finn is a veteran of the war to protect the Grid, leading the team of couriers on their Slitpods through this hellscape of bandits, demons, and mysterious outsiders in a daily race to save outlying settlements from destruction. The SlitPods they ride are immensely powerful machines but, built on old, forgotten tech, they are ticking time bombs. Once they suffer enough damage they instantly explode. Finn’s concern for the safety of his team is compounded after a number of incidents on the plains convince him that their presence is hurting the settlers as much as helping them. Perhaps even more.

An action-packed post-apocalyptic novel set in a world ruled by mutated monsters and shock-troop bandits, OFF GRID is the first in the Couriers trilogy. If you're looking for a touch point, think Mad Max: Fury Road with more advanced tech and deeper intrigue.

Hey there! My name is Jay Swanson and I’m a fantasy and sci-fi writer living in Paris (and trying to avoid all of the clichés that image conjures). You may have seen me wandering around the city over on YouTube - if not, check it out! When I'm not lost in France I'm lost to my writing, including books like Into the Nanten, Dark Horse, and Shadows of the Highridge.

I wrote the original draft of Couriers: OFF GRID three years ago after throwing around various ideas with a mainstream publisher. Sadly they weren’t looking for the post-apocalyptic coming-of-age action novel that Couriers turned out to be, so I set it aside while I moved on with other projects. But the story was always in the back of my mind, brewing in the darker corners and demanding to be brought to light. You can read the first two chapters here.

The last year of my life has been transformative and I realized that I couldn't sit on Couriers any longer. I went back, re-read it, and fell in love with the characters and world all over again. I'm really excited to give you the opportunity not only to read Couriers: OFF GRID, but to have a part in creating it.

Of all the things I've learned over seven years of self-publishing and 500+ daily vlogs, the biggest is how I most value a direct connection with my readers and subscribers. There's something very unique that transpires when you create something and hand it off directly to someone else with as little preamble as possible. Even more unique when those people come together to be a part of improving what you're making. I don't want to miss out on that opportunity here - I think Couriers: OFF GRID is the perfect book to produce with you, and give straight to you.

Couriers: OFF GRID. I’ve written it, re-written it, put it through developmental edits, beta readers, and incorporated notes from one of the most respected sci-fi publishers in the world. I don’t want it to languish in obscurity – books are never written to be hidden – I want to share it.

This is where you come in. I need your help to take it off the digital shelf and convert it into something you can hold, whether on Kindle or paperback. I don't have the funds necessary to send it for a full print run on my own. This is the first area I need your help.

If you want a paperback or audiobook you can jump on that today. And as a bonus, you'll also get the eBook months before its official release so that you can read Couriers: OFF GRID before September. Go snag it now before you suffer choice paralysis!

Take the audio on the road!

SlitPod Posters!

(See them in more detail below)

Get the audiobook!

Bonus eBook at every pledge level! More details and bonuses below.

Grab a copy in the sidebar today!

Poster Design One - by Nimit Malavia

 You name a SlitPod, we make a poster.

SlitPod draft image - see below for more details

The second way you can help is to tell a friend! Do you know someone who loves a good book? Action, intrigue, mystery, and post-apocalyptic shootouts? Let them know about this campaign! The more people that jump on board, the better the finished product will get (and the hidden stretch goals will be worth it). Not sure what to say? I wrote this tweet especially for you.

Sweeten the Deal

Just to sweeten the deal, I'm including the eBook of my fantasy thriller Shadows of the Highridge in every pledge level. I wanted to make sure you had something to read while you wait for OFF GRID!

About the book: Moving along the soil is the quickest way to die; for Tolly to survive she must learn to stay silent. Life on farms like hers was difficult enough in the face of plague and a decade of drought, but something worse has come to the foothills under the Highridge Mountains. Something that will destroy everything she loves. Mere miles away, Vanig’s search for water to revive his farm is cut short when soldiers arrive bearing dark news of disaster striking farms throughout the region – and they suspect he is the root cause of it all. Those suspicions spike when a disheveled warrior appears hundreds of miles from home and takes Vanig hostage. Death looms in the shadows of the Highridge.

 

Meet The Team

I’ve been living in Paris for over a year now and intend to stay here forever because, if given the option, wouldn’t you? I’ve self-published seven novels over the last seven years including Into the Nanten, the world’s first real-time fantasy blog. When I’m not writing or hunting for nachos, odds are good I’m out discovering a new coffee shop or exploring Paris and putting what I find on my vlog.

Nimit has the ability to capture raw emotion with a few strokes of his pen, and his artwork has always stood out to me. Nimit created nearly 200 unique illustrations for me over the last few years. He’s also worked for more obscure outfits you might have heard of, like Marvel Comics, 20th Century Fox, and most recently the vinyl cover artwork for Playstation's Shadow of the Colossus.

Jenna has been my line editor since my very first book – slashing redundancies left and right while bemoaning my inability, to, use a, comma, properly. We met in Washington State as she wooed one of my post-college roommates. She currently lives in Indiana with her two kids and my aforementioned roommate.

Jake is a design stud who salvaged the cover of my book Shadows of the Highridge from certain ridiculousness and worked up early designs for the cover of Agnar’s Box. He'll be in charge of the interior layout as well as the cover design. He’s quick and his work is always sharp.

You Pledge - We Produce

We won't be going to offset printing as we didn't hit the necessary quantity to justify it (I had an error in my original calculations so we had to drop this feature) which means that hopefully you get the book even sooner! I've also added a few weeks of buffer in the timeline to budget for unforeseen circumstances.

More About Couriers: OFF GRID

Strangely enough, the entire Couriers series was launched with a scene that doesn’t even occur until the third and final book in the trilogy. As with many of my books, it was inspired by a song. I’ll tell you more about that in a campaign update, but the image of a high-tech motorcycle battling it out with an attack-helicopter style hovercraft in the ruins of a fallen civilization bored its way into my mind and refused to leave.

So much of the fun of crowdfunding is in building out a little bit of the ephemera - the bits left over from before the apocalypse. These SlitPods were once luxury off-road sports bikes - expensive leisure vehicles. And now they've been re-purposed for war. The posters that we'll create with your support are the equivalent of if you walked into a Ducati dealership or shop today and saw posters of their bikes on the wall. These are the leavings of a world that no longer exists. A world that knew peace.

I’ve planned out a trilogy for the Couriers series, one I’ve begun writing again even as I prepared for this campaign. I have the outlines and in-depth synopses of the second and third book finished and ready to guide me forward. I'm looking forward to the additional motivation only a ravenous audience can provide.

Reward Details

The eBook will be released as soon as the formatting is complete in all formats (mobi, epub, and pdf) and delivered through Instafreebie. The paperback will take some time to print, ship, and fulfill so delivery is expected in September/October at the latest (international shipping introduces further variables). The hardcover was a Kickstarter exclusive.

Bonuses unlock with stretch goals for each level. The digital wallpaper downloads will be uniformly unlocked for all 35€ backers and above (in other words, all of the wallpapers will be made available to everyone at that level and up). 35€ level backers will receive one printed shop poster of their choice. The audiobook will be narrated by myself and made available to all 50€ level backers and up (or for 20€ if no paperback is desired) - I have been doing professional voice acting for France's national science and research division for the last year, among other projects, and would love to narrate my own book.

Name a SlitPod! These are the first of ten unique SlitPod designs that are going to be fully finished and turned into shop posters - promotional materials from before the apocalypse - and your name could be emblazoned on the side in style. Five remain after the Kickstarter campaign. The SlitPod's final name will ultimately be decided by Nimit and myself based upon one or a combination of: your name, your recommended name, or a derivative based off what you submit - in other words: we get the final say. No Boaty McBoatface type names will be accepted for this project -we'll have to turn it into something cool if you try. SlitPods are cool, dangit ;P

So grab yours today!

story:
* * * UPDATE: We reached our £3000 target in just five days! Thank you so much to everyone who has donated so far, we’ve been bowled over by the response. Rojava needs as much support as we can give so we’ll be keeping the fundraiser going for the full 31 days and are currently discussing what we should do with extra funds raised. This is just the start of our fundraising for Rojava and it’s really encouraging to be able to raise so much so quickly. Keep an eye out for future solidarity actions from the cluster and please keep sharing the fundraising link! * * *

The recent ISIS attacks in Beirut and Paris, and last week’s downing of a Russian jet by Turkey have refocused international attention on ISIS and the Syrian crisis. European states have responded with a racialised crack-down on civil liberties at home, whilst preparing for increased military activity abroad. Seemingly lost in the arguments for bombing campaigns or international “boots on the ground” is the fact that a progressive, democratic, and feminist force is already fighting ISIS – the democratic experiment in Rojava.

No Friends but the Mountains?

The escalating military conflict in Syria has recently seen Turkey directly attack Rojavan defence forces. Facing both military action and economic embargo international support for the Rojavan cantons is even more important. For those of us that believe in supporting this struggle we need to move beyond "virtual solidarity" on facebook or our leftist blogs. We hope this campaign can be a small example of the kinds of practical solidarity we need to be showing with Rojava.

What Do We Want to Do?

We want to raise £3000 for projects connected to the struggle in Rojava. This money will be split into a few different parts:

1) £2000 to Kobane, to be split into two parts:

·  £1400 to Kobane reconstruction, sent directly to Kobane.

·  £600 for medical supplies to support direct medical work in the region. This will pay for life saving medical supplies that are expensive and hard to obtain in Rojava. The supplies will include tourniquets, hemostatic dressings, chest seals, and trauma bandages, all essential in preventing avoidable deaths by treating the serious injuries that are suffered by both civilians and YPG/J members in Rojava.

2) £1000 to Kurdish projects in the UK. The struggle in Rojava is being supported by a large network of Kurdish communities across the world. By helping Kurdish projects in the UK, we are helping build the basis for longer term support for Rojava.

Any extra money we raise will go directly towards reconstruction in Kobane.

When?

We hope to raise this money by the New Year. If we are short we will continue raising funds until we reach our target.

£3000, is this all?

We hope not! Our plan is to start with something we think should be achievable and we hope to do larger fundraising campaigns next year. Hopefully we will involve more groups from the UK and Europe in this next campaign.

story:
MY STORY

I'm Chris G. Wright, an indie author aiming to make the Sci-Fi genre proud. Writing became a hobby at the age of 13 when I picked up Homeland by fantasy author R. A. Salvatore, to who I dedicated my first novel. When family and friends persuaded me to self-publish a draft of 400 pages, that novel became The Alliance. Find out more about me (and feel free to contact me/get to know me; I always find time for a friendly chat) at:

GOODREADS - FACEBOOK - TWITTER - WEBSITE

MY GOAL

I want to inspire and entertain. I want readers to reach the end of a story and feel fulfilled, to think "Well done, Chris. What's next?" This is why I need your support.  If I can afford a professional editor, I'll have a book that is as perfect as it can be. Who knows, I might even attract a publisher.

THE IMPACT

Great Science Fiction began in books. Some authors got luckier than others, but one way or another, they inspired directors, artists, game developers, and more authors. I might be dreaming big, but one has to start somewhere. And you can be a part of it.

[The poster for the entire series. Designed and painted by my partner, Meaghan Hunter]

VERY IMPORTANT DETAILS

Story finished. Cover done. Developmental edit done (aka Line Editing). A professional copy edit remains. I chose True Editors, an established editing agency in the UK. These guys are great and I'm certain they will deliver an excellent product. The edit will cost £2000 ($2500).

@Backers: IF for some reason this campaign doesn't hit its target, I will cover the rest of the funds, even if it means pulling out a bank loan. Therefore, I guarantee you your perks. Period.

Depending on which perk you choose, you will receive a digital version of The Alliance (mobi/epub/pdf) and/or signed Paperbacks. For Indiegogo supporters, paperbacks will not be printed by Amazon, but by a high-quality local press.

Your name could be featured in the acknowledgements, become the name of a spaceship, a military base or research lab, even a space colony.

Of course, if your name is similar to this guy's, then I might be forced to tweak it:

If you didn't get that, his name is (wait for it)... Uvuvwevwevwe Onyetenyevwe Ugwemuhwem Osas

    OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

    Sharing it on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram is hugely appreciated.

    Thank you for your support!!!

     

     

     

    ADDITIONAL INFO BELOW

    [cover by Leon Tukker]

    Achieved so far...

    Writing a book is a lengthy process, and enjoyable for the most part. But when you're going indie, it's all up to you, and there are plenty of learning curves along the way. There were many factors that influenced my writing journey. Apart from forms, account setups, building my own website, and research, even outreach, these were:

    • Time: My daytime job meant working in front of a computer 9-5 Monday to Friday, so finding time to write 400 pages wasn't easy.
    • Editing: It can cost between £2K-3K. After plenty of research, I chose an affordable freelance editor instead. However, I still found myself editing further with the help of software and manuals.
    • Cover: Some artists replied with price tags like £6K, others for no less than 1K!!! As I wasn't in the position of selling my organs, I continued searching. Eventually, I found the talented Leon Tukker from the Netherlands, who offered me a great deal.
    • Promotion/Outreach: This process is full of surprises, huge prices for promotion, emails with no reply, your inbox filling with spam, etc. I'm sure you can imagine. Also, there's no guarantee that paid promotion will succeed, and it's a huge risk to dish out £3-6K when the unfortunate truth is that newspapers, magazines and bloggers have little to no time for indie authors.

     

    About The Evox Chronicles

    The Alliance lays the groundwork for a 6-volume science fiction series. It takes Humanity on a thrilling journey from dystopia to utopia, from an Earth occupied by other members of the Milky Way to interstellar travel and galactic warfare to space colonization and the formation of the Galactic Alliance. It studies the outlook of the races and their conflicting cultures, the evolution of a diverse society across the centuries, and the cataclysmic events inspired by the most devious of minds. And finally, how will the G.A. endure a most unusual group of heroes destined to defend it from the cosmos's greatest threats. 

     

    About Volume 1 The Alliance

    Click here for Goodreads book page: 21 Ratings 14 Reviews

    Invaded by the ambitious and malevolent Rabast, Earth's greatest military powers have been crushed. Mankind's legacy is nothing but scattered pockets of resistance surviving in city ruins.

    Their salvation is a mysterious ally from the Pleiades star cluster. The last colony of Pleodians has formed an elaborate plan to save Earth from the oppressor Vadist and his legions. But the Alliance comes at a price... the Humans are required to share their planet. Nearing extinction, do they have a choice?

    For the plan to work, both species must rely on two men who possess alien artifacts of seemingly infinite energy: Ethan Alexander Colt is a resistance fighter expected to make the ultimate sacrifice; the other is the tormented Captain Donovan Ford, who must conquer his ghosts and embrace his destiny as a soldier.

    Outnumbered and outmatched, the allies turn to a collection of War Engines, the Conduits, ancient combat suits once operated by the infamous Scientists. But Humans were designed with flaws, and Ethan and Donovan are no different. Will they see beyond their own aspirations and fight for the greater good? Or will they threaten the endurance of the Alliance and stability of the cosmos?
story_txt:
MY STORYI'm Chris G. Wright, an indie author aiming to make the Sci-Fi genre proud. Writing became a hobby at the age of 13 when I picked up Homeland by fantasy author R. A. Salvatore, to who I dedicated my first novel. When family and friends persuaded me to self-publish a draft of 400 pages, that novel became The Alliance. Find out more about me (and feel free to contact me/get to know me; I always find time for a friendly chat) at:GOODREADS - FACEBOOK - TWITTER - WEBSITEMY GOALI want to inspire and entertain. I want readers to reach the end of a story and feel fulfilled, to think "Well done, Chris. What's next?" This is why I need your support.  If I can afford a professional editor, I'll have a book that is as perfect as it can be. Who knows, I might even attract a publisher. THE IMPACTGreat Science Fiction began in books. Some authors got luckier than others, but one way or another, they inspired directors, artists, game developers, and more authors. I might be dreaming big, but one has to start somewhere. And you can be a part of it.[The poster for the entire series. Designed and painted by my partner, Meaghan Hunter]

VERY IMPORTANT DETAILS
Story finished. Cover done. Developmental edit done (aka Line Editing). A professional copy edit remains. I chose True Editors, an established editing agency in the UK. These guys are great and I'm certain they will deliver an excellent product. The edit will cost £2000 ($2500).
@Backers: IF for some reason this campaign doesn't hit its target, I will cover the rest of the funds, even if it means pulling out a bank loan. Therefore, I guarantee you your perks. Period.
Depending on which perk you choose, you will receive a digital version of The Alliance (mobi/epub/pdf) and/or signed Paperbacks. For Indiegogo supporters, paperbacks will not be printed by Amazon, but by a high-quality local press.
Your name could be featured in the acknowledgements, become the name of a spaceship, a military base or research lab, even a space colony.
Of course, if your name is similar to this guy's, then I might be forced to tweak it:

If you didn't get that, his name is (wait for it)... Uvuvwevwevwe Onyetenyevwe Ugwemuhwem Osas

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Sharing it on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram is hugely appreciated.
Thank you for your support!!!
 
 
 
ADDITIONAL INFO BELOW

story:
Story of My Book

Force of Nature is a lyrical compilation that explores the intersections of African womanhood, emotional vulnerability, and spiritual liberation. This body of work is an ode to the divine feminine energy and power that exists within all African women.

My name is Odemi Pessu, and I am the author of Force of Nature. I was inspired to write this book because African women globally are subjugated to societal expectations that force us to hide our feelings and complexities and look to external factors for strength when God’s power already lives within us. We are often told we are too much and too little all at the same time. But, like forces of nature, we cannot be confined to societal definitions of who we should be and what we should feel.

My hope is that, in reading Force of Nature, you will discover the innate power that shines through when we unabashedly embrace who we are and what we feel. Ultimately, I hope this book will prompt you to honor the divine feminine energy that lives within you.

In this book, you’ll join me in embracing the complexities of African womanhood, exploring decolonization of the mind, reconciling tradition with growth, rejecting patriarchal oppression, and discovering new ways to love ourselves deeply and fully through poems like:

  • “By Any Means Necessary” — a poem about colonialism, Black liberation, and Western Christianity.
  • “Welcome Home” — a poem about identity, solitude, and the healing power of Mother Earth.
  • “Keeping Score” — a poem critiquing society’s silence regarding violence against women.

You will love this book if you enjoy challenging the status quo, have a passion for women’s empowerment, and appreciate thought-provoking, yet lyrical, literature. Force of Nature speaks to African women and women of color who want to grapple with vulnerability and womanhood in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Force of Nature inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How can I work to honor myself more authentically each day?
  • How can I utilize vulnerability to strengthen my relationships, and what is keeping me from experiencing my emotions more freely and deeply?
  • What intrinsic work can I do to decolonize my mind and embrace the divinity that exists within me?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing vulnerability, spirituality, and the nuances of Black womanhood more frequently will change us all for the better.
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring 2021.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more! 

 

About the Author

Odemi Pessu is an author, multi-media artist, and award-winning scholar. She holds a Master’s of Public Affairs and B.A. in International Relations and Political Economy from Brown University.

During her baccalaureate career, she focused on matters of neocolonialism, maternal healthcare, and political ecology in Nigeria, her family’s home country. The broader depth of her work, creative and academic, explores gender, spirituality, academia, culture, and Black liberation from a contemporary standpoint. As an artist, Odemi is fascinated by the spatial relationships between material culture, society, and nature. She aims to capture the stories that lay in the angles, sculptural patterns, and forms of everyday life.

Odemi’s simple pleasures include spending time with her family, yoga and long walks through her favorite park, traveling to new countries, live music, and a great glass of Chianti. She loves to have new experiences that push her out of her comfort zone.

For more information, you can connect with Odemi Pessu at odemi@odemipessu.com and on instagram @odemipessu
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ForceOfNatureBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

With love & light,
Odemi
