story:
“The Divine” is a multicultural 90+ page coloring book for people of all ages (especially the child in all of us) inspired by folklore and spirituality from the Philippines (Diwas), Haiti (Lwas of Vodou) and Brazil (Orixas of Candomble and folklore of the Tupi Tribe). Pre-order YOURS today!

Thirteen divinities from each culture are represented along with the folklore and symbolism associated with each of the divinities. Included throughout the book are inspirational quotes, mindfulness activities and poetry featuring Eniafe Isis of All Her Words. In addition to the 39 divinities, there is a surprise included in the book.

While many of us grew up with the mythologies about Greek and Roman gods, as well as stories like Cinderella, Little Mermaid and Robin Hood, few of us have been exposed to the stories included in “The Divine” — stories that have been passed down from generation to generation through traditional dance, music and oral storytelling. “The Divine” draws the connections between these cultures, beliefs and that which is always sacred, bringing to the forefront the cultures of the diaspora that are rich in wisdom but rarely given the attention they deserve.

From the Americas to Africa to the islands, let’s continue to carry and pass down these truths.

It's taken a village.

I may be the creative behind this project, but I couldn’t have done it without these phenomenal folks. Thank you!

Illustrators: Fermina Caragay Armstrong, Salima Silagon Saway, Andre Hora, Grace Bio, Rahana Dariah, Zachary Present, Stephen Hamilton, Nikila Badua, Wisthon Thime, William Rhodes, Dee Jae Pa’este, Ubi Maya, Mitzi Ulloa, Cece Carpio, Rodney Sanon, Willorna DML, Gabrielle Tesfayetra

Advisors, Mentors, Cultural Bearers and Collaborators for this project include: Alleluia Panis (KulArts), June Arellano (Parangal Dance Company), Salima Silagon Saway, Myrna Pulna, Marlon Martin (Indigenous Peoples Education (IPED) Center), Portsha Jefferson (Rara Tou Limen), Daniel Brevil, Laure Fleurentin (FAL Danse), Jorge Alabe, Paco Gomes, Dandha DaHora, Djenane Saint-Juste (Afoutayi), Tania Santiago (Aguas Dance Company), Urubu Malandro (Capoeira Ijexa), Eniafe Isis (All Her Words) and Jarrel Phillips (AVE).

A big shout out to my crowdfunding guru Desi Danganan (Balay Kreative) for his wisdom and to Jeremiah Ysip (ABC-CBN) for editing my promo video!

To all the families and kids who have been helping me with the marketing materials AND to all my friends who have so generously put up with my numerous requests for advice, I have soooooo much love and gratitude for you.
 


Some years ago, when I was teaching a CreativFolkloric workshop for MAS Summer Camp at the Mission Cultural Center for Latino Arts in San Francisco, I was having my students choreograph movements inspired by Yemanja (Brazil), La Sirene (Haiti) and Magwayan (Visayas, Philippines) — all divine feminine spirits of the ocean. Having the kids color illustrations of those divine spirits of the ocean seemed like a good way to inspire them. However, I was unable to find any existing illustrations online that I could use. As a last resort, I set out to create some of my own coloring pages using Adobe Illustrator to adapt images I found online.

And so was born the idea for “The Divine” coloring book — a personal creative journey of many months that has also been a very transformative and healing process for me. Art brings healing. Creating is medicine.

I am just so blessed to have the advice and guidance of many mentors, advisors and teachers, whose heritage and ancestry is from these cultures, who are extremely knowledgeable about the folklore represented in this project, and some of whom actively practice these spiritualities. I am greatly indebted to them for their help in ensuring that each story and culture is honored and represented with the greatest respect and with due mindfulness about cultural appropriation.

A special thank you to all my friends, fam and guides who believed in me even when I didn’t believe in myself. With your help, I hope to continue to breathe life into the project.

I hope each person sees a little bit of themselves through these stories, and that their symbolism resonates within you. I also hope that you will find these coloring pages not just educational, but also healing and therapeutic.

You are divine, and the divine is you.
 


Hey all, I’m Christine Joy Amagan Ferrer (most people know me as ‘Tine’). I am a pinay multidisciplinary creative from San Francisco of Tagalog, Iloko and Visayan known roots. I am a cultural movement youth arts educator and dance artist by day, and a designer and media producer by night. I am inspired by folklore, spirituality and cultural movement storytelling.

I’ve been studying and practicing Haitian, Brazilian and Philippine folkloric dance for a little more than a decade. Over the years, I’ve traveled on a few cultural immersions to Haiti and the Philippines to expand my spiritual and cultural growth. And my connections to all these cultures -- through spirituality, dance, music and song -- have deeply shaped my life, carried me through my struggles, taught me to root myself in joy, brought me healing, connected me to my ancestors, and to the God within and the God without. Each day, I learn more and more. And for that, I am incredibly grateful. “The Divine” coloring book is my offering.
 


Most of you know, I have been working very hard for the last few months, prepping for the launch of “The Divine” coloring book, hustling hard on its production. But in the present moment, I have had to pause and reflect on how I, as a Filipina, non-Black American sharing stories that represent heritages that are not my own, can honor, celebrate and uplift Black Power.

To be fully honest and transparent, it has been challenging trying to navigate how to better support Black lives, Black families, Black communities, Black culture, basically Black EVERYTHING, with my work on this platform -- being that I am a practitioner of Haitian and Brazilian folkloric cultural dance forms of the diaspora but NOT Black.

Though I had hoped to launch the project in June, I decided to postpone it. Because I realized that sometimes it’s important for some of us to fall back, so others can step forward.

What matters most is the day-to-day. How we live our lives, treat and teach one another, and hold space for others and ourselves, even when we don't fully understand it all.


THE DIVINE BLACK ARTISTS AND COLLABORATORS: 
Row 1: (Left to Right)

  • Wisthon Thime, Painter/Illustrator - Boston, CA
  • William Rhodes, Artist, Mixed Media - San Francisco, CA
  • Eniafe Isis, Writer/Poet and Founder/Ceo of Exi Concepts - Los Angeles, CA


Row 2:

  • Stephen Hamilton, Painter, Illustrator, Textiles - Boston, MA 
  • Fermina Caragay Armstrong, Illustrator - San Francisco, CA 
  • Rahana Dariah, Illustrator - London, UK


Row 3:

  • Jarrel Phillips, Youth Educator, Writer, Visual Storyteller - San Francisco, CA
  • Gabrielle Tesfaye, Painter, Animator, Filmmaker - Ubud, Bali
  • Rodney Sanon, Illustrator, Cartoonist, Portrait - Brooklyn, NY
     


THE DIVINE BLACK ADVISORS AND MENTORS:
Row 1: (Left to Right)

  • Urubu Malandro, Capoeira Mestre, Capoeira Ijexa - San Francisco
  • Daniel Brevil, Haitian Music and Drum Educator - Newport News, VA
  • Tania Santiago, Afro-Brazilian Dance Educator, Artistic Director, Aguas - SF


Row 2:

  • Dandha DaHora, Afro-Brazilian Dance Teacher, Lead Vocalist, Sambada - Santa Cruz, CA
  • Portsha Jefferson, Haitian Folkloric Dance Educator, Artistic Director, Rara Tou Limen - Oakland, CA


Row 3:

  • Paco Gomes, Afro-Brazilian Modern Choreographer, GriotLab - Salvador, Brazil
  • Djenane Saint-Juste, Founder/Artistic Director, Afoutayi - Minneapolis, MN
  • Laure Fleurentin, Haitian Folkloric Dance Instructor, FAL Danse - Oakland, CA




I am a member of Parangal Dance Company (Philippine folkloric) and Aguas Dance Company (Afro-Brazilian contemporary). Learn more about me by visiting, eomvmnt.org. Hire me for quality freelance web design and UI development, print and graphic design, marketing and web administration at a reasonable price. Follow me on Instagram @tinejoy. Subscribe to my blog, EclectikSol.com.

“Sting like a bee, fight like a panther and flow like water. Weave your story like a spider, harness the energy of a hummingbird, fly swift like a butterfly and listen through the darkness like a bat so you can see.” - Christine Joy Amagan Ferrer
 


Here’s what your contributions will get you:
 

  • $20 Digital Illustration Set
  • $25 Digital Coloring Book (Downloadable PDF)
  • $35 Coloring Book + Digital Illustration Set
  • $50 Coloring Book + Poster
  • $75 Coloring Book + Flashcards
  • $125 Divine Bundle x 5 (Five Coloring Books)
  • $150 Coloring Book + Flashcards + Poster
  • $250 Divine Bundle x 10 (10 Coloring Books)
  • $500 Special Edition: Hardcover Coloring Book + Sponsor Acknowledgement + Digital Book + Poster
  • $1,000 Special Edition: Hardcover Coloring Book + Sponsor Acknowledgement + Dedication + Digital Book + Poster


How I will be spending the money:
 

  • Printing, publishing, shipping and handling of the coloring book, 11×17 poster, flashcards
  • Print-on-demand fees for BookBaby.com
  • Indiegogo Administrative Fees
  • The amazing illustrators who have contributed to this project
  • Myself, as the creator, author and designer
  • The copy editor/editor
  • Other miscellaneous and unforeseen costs


I will also donate a percentage of the proceeds from this project to some of my mentors/cultural bearers from the communities represented in “The Divine” who have guided me through this project.

P.S. I fully intend to have it all ready for you by the end of 2020 BUT with all the uncertainty right now, please bear with me if things get pushed to the first part of next year.


If you can’t contribute, I get it, we’re in some crazy times, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please show some love and spread the word about “The Divine” coloring book by sharing this crowdfund on your social media.
  • If you need promotional media just holla’ at me.
  • You can also use Indiegogo share tools!
  • I don’t have a Facebook page or Instagram set up yet for the coloring book, but please visit my website, eomvmnt.org/divinecolor for more info.



Maraming Salamat, Mèsi Anpil and Obrigada!

In Love and Liberation,



A.k.a. Tine

Author, Creator and Designer of “The Divine” Coloring Book
story_txt:
“The Divine” is a multicultural 90+ page coloring book for people of all ages (especially the child in all of us) inspired by folklore and spirituality from the Philippines (Diwas), Haiti (Lwas of Vodou) and Brazil (Orixas of Candomble and folklore of the Tupi Tribe). Pre-order YOURS today!Thirteen divinities from each culture are represented along with the folklore and symbolism associated with each of the divinities. Included throughout the book are inspirational quotes, mindfulness activities and poetry featuring Eniafe Isis of All Her Words. In addition to the 39 divinities, there is a surprise included in the book.
While many of us grew up with the mythologies about Greek and Roman gods, as well as stories like Cinderella, Little Mermaid and Robin Hood, few of us have been exposed to the stories included in “The Divine” — stories that have been passed down from generation to generation through traditional dance, music and oral storytelling. “The Divine” draws the connections between these cultures, beliefs and that which is always sacred, bringing to the forefront the cultures of the diaspora that are rich in wisdom but rarely given the attention they deserve.
From the Americas to Africa to the islands, let’s continue to carry and pass down these truths.
It's taken a village.
I may be the creative behind this project, but I couldn’t have done it without these phenomenal folks. Thank you!
Illustrators: Fermina Caragay Armstrong, Salima Silagon Saway, Andre Hora, Grace Bio, Rahana Dariah, Zachary Present, Stephen Hamilton, Nikila Badua, Wisthon Thime, William Rhodes, Dee Jae Pa’este, Ubi Maya, Mitzi Ulloa, Cece Carpio, Rodney Sanon, Willorna DML, Gabrielle Tesfayetra
Advisors, Mentors, Cultural Bearers and Collaborators for this project include: Alleluia Panis (KulArts), June Arellano (Parangal Dance Company), Salima Silagon Saway, Myrna Pulna, Marlon Martin (Indigenous Peoples Education (IPED) Center), Portsha Jefferson (Rara Tou Limen), Daniel Brevil, Laure Fleurentin (FAL Danse), Jorge Alabe, Paco Gomes, Dandha DaHora, Djenane Saint-Juste (Afoutayi), Tania Santiago (Aguas Dance Company), Urubu Malandro (Capoeira Ijexa), Eniafe Isis (All Her Words) and Jarrel Phillips (AVE).
A big shout out to my crowdfunding guru Desi Danganan (Balay Kreative) for his wisdom and to Jeremiah Ysip (ABC-CBN) for editing my promo video!
To all the families and kids who have been helping me with the marketing materials AND to all my friends who have so generously put up with my numerous requests for advice, I have soooooo much love and gratitude for you. 

Some years ago, when I was teaching a CreativFolkloric workshop for MAS Summer Camp at the Mission Cultural Center for Latino Arts in San Francisco, I was having my students choreograph movements inspired by Yemanja (Brazil), La Sirene (Haiti) and Magwayan (Visayas, Philippines) — all divine feminine spirits of the ocean. Having the kids color illustrations of those divine spirits of the ocean seemed like a good way to inspire them. However, I was unable to find any existing illustrations online that I could use. As a last resort, I set out to create some of my own coloring pages using Adobe Illustrator to adapt images I found online.
And so was born the idea for “The Divine” coloring book — a personal creative journey of many months that has also been a very transformative and healing process for me. Art brings healing. Creating is medicine.
I am just so blessed to have the advice and guidance of many mentors, advisors and teachers, whose heritage and ancestry is from these cultures, who are extremely knowledgeable about the folklore represented in this project, and some of whom actively practice these spiritualities. I am greatly indebted to them for their help in ensuring that each story and culture is honored and represented with the greatest respect and with due mindfulness about cultural appropriation.
A special thank you to all my friends, fam and guides who believed in me even when I didn’t believe in myself. With your help, I hope to continue to breathe life into the project.
I hope each person sees a little bit of themselves through these stories, and that their symbolism resonates within you. I also hope that you will find these coloring pages not just educational, but also healing and therapeutic.
You are divine, and the divine is you. 

Hey all, I’m Christine Joy Amagan Ferrer (most people know me as ‘Tine’). I am a pinay multidisciplinary creative from San Francisco of Tagalog, Iloko and Visayan known roots. I am a cultural movement youth arts educator and dance artist by day, and a designer and media producer by night. I am inspired by folklore, spirituality and cultural movement storytelling.
I’ve been studying and practicing Haitian, Brazilian and Philippine folkloric dance for a little more than a decade. Over the years, I’ve traveled on a few cultural immersions to Haiti and the Philippines to expand my spiritual and cultural growth. And my connections to all these cultures -- through spirituality, dance, music and song -- have deeply shaped my life, carried me through my struggles, taught me to root myself in joy, brought me healing, connected me to my ancestors, and to the God within and the God without. Each day, I learn more and more. And for that, I am incredibly grateful. “The Divine” coloring book is my offering. 

Most of you know, I have been working very hard for the last few months, prepping for the launch of “The Divine” coloring book, hustling hard on its production. But in the present moment, I have had to pause and reflect on how I, as a Filipina, non-Black American sharing stories that represent heritages that are not my own, can honor, celebrate and uplift Black Power.
To be fully honest and transparent, it has been challenging trying to navigate how to better support Black lives, Black families, Black communities, Black culture, basically Black EVERYTHING, with my work on this platform -- being that I am a practitioner of Haitian and Brazilian folkloric cultural dance forms of the diaspora but NOT Black.
Though I had hoped to launch the project in June, I decided to postpone it. Because I realized that sometimes it’s important for some of us to fall back, so others can step forward.
What matters most is the day-to-day. How we live our lives, treat and teach one another, and hold space for others and ourselves, even when we don't fully understand it all.
THE DIVINE BLACK ARTISTS AND COLLABORATORS: Row 1: (Left to Right)


Wisthon Thime, Painter/Illustrator - Boston, CA

William Rhodes, Artist, Mixed Media - San Francisco, CA

Eniafe Isis, Writer/Poet and Founder/Ceo of Exi Concepts - Los Angeles, CA

Row 2:


Stephen Hamilton, Painter, Illustrator, Textiles - Boston, MA 

Fermina Caragay Armstrong, Illustrator - San Francisco, CA 

Rahana Dariah, Illustrator - London, UK

Row 3:


Jarrel Phillips, Youth Educator, Writer, Visual Storyteller - San Francisco, CA

Gabrielle Tesfaye, Painter, Animator, Filmmaker - Ubud, Bali

Rodney Sanon, Illustrator, Cartoonist, Portrait - Brooklyn, NY 


THE DIVINE BLACK ADVISORS AND MENTORS:Row 1: (Left to Right)


Urubu Malandro, Capoeira Mestre, Capoeira Ijexa - San Francisco

Daniel Brevil, Haitian Music and Drum Educator - Newport News, VA

Tania Santiago, Afro-Brazilian Dance Educator, Artistic Director, Aguas - SF

Row 2:


Dandha DaHora, Afro-Brazilian Dance Teacher, Lead Vocalist, Sambada - Santa Cruz, CA

Portsha Jefferson, Haitian Folkloric Dance Educator, Artistic Director, Rara Tou Limen - Oakland, CA

Row 3:


Paco Gomes, Afro-Brazilian Modern Choreographer, GriotLab - Salvador, Brazil

Djenane Saint-Juste, Founder/Artistic Director, Afoutayi - Minneapolis, MN

Laure Fleurentin, Haitian Folkloric Dance Instructor, FAL Danse - Oakland, CA


I am a member of Parangal Dance Company (Philippine folkloric) and Aguas Dance Company (Afro-Brazilian contemporary). Learn more about me by visiting, eomvmnt.org. Hire me for quality freelance web design and UI development, print and graphic design, marketing and web administration at a reasonable price. Follow me on Instagram @tinejoy. Subscribe to my blog, EclectikSol.com.
“Sting like a bee, fight like a panther and flow like water. Weave your story like a spider, harness the energy of a hummingbird, fly swift like a butterfly and listen through the darkness like a bat so you can see.” - Christine Joy Amagan Ferrer 


Here’s what your contributions will get you: 

$20 Digital Illustration Set
$25 Digital Coloring Book (Downloadable PDF)
$35 Coloring Book + Digital Illustration Set
$50 Coloring Book + Poster
$75 Coloring Book + Flashcards
$125 Divine Bundle x 5 (Five Coloring Books)
$150 Coloring Book + Flashcards + Poster
$250 Divine Bundle x 10 (10 Coloring Books)
$500 Special Edition: Hardcover Coloring Book + Sponsor Acknowledgement + Digital Book + Poster
$1,000 Special Edition: Hardcover Coloring Book + Sponsor Acknowledgement + Dedication + Digital Book + Poster

How I will be spending the money: 

Printing, publishing, shipping and handling of the coloring book, 11×17 poster, flashcards
Print-on-demand fees for BookBaby.com
Indiegogo Administrative Fees
The amazing illustrators who have contributed to this project
Myself, as the creator, author and designer
The copy editor/editor
Other miscellaneous and unforeseen costs

I will also donate a percentage of the proceeds from this project to some of my mentors/cultural bearers from the communities represented in “The Divine” who have guided me through this project.
P.S. I fully intend to have it all ready for you by the end of 2020 BUT with all the uncertainty right now, please bear with me if things get pushed to the first part of next year.


If you can’t contribute, I get it, we’re in some crazy times, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please show some love and spread the word about “The Divine” coloring book by sharing this crowdfund on your social media.
If you need promotional media just holla’ at me.
You can also use Indiegogo share tools!
I don’t have a Facebook page or Instagram set up yet for the coloring book, but please visit my website, eomvmnt.org/divinecolor for more info.



Maraming Salamat, Mèsi Anpil and Obrigada!
In Love and Liberation,
A.k.a. TineAuthor, Creator and Designer of “The Divine” Coloring Book

story:
The Story of Identifiable

Identifiable takes you into a world where just by looking at you, an individual can learn everything about you instantaneously. They can see every photo that’s ever been released, and unearth your most intimate details through posts that have been shared. But Rory Walsh’s life has been narrated through the lens of someone else. How can he create his own identity when everything that people see is of a version of him that doesn’t exist?

My name is Julia Tvardovskaya, and I am the author of Identifiable. I wrote this book not only because of my passion for telling stories, but because I believe that this story in particular is necessary to be told at exactly this point in time.

Although the internet and social media have immense benefits, including having the chance to connect with friends and family across the world, they also pose great challenges to us as individuals and as members of society. Children have a virtual footprint that is born well before they are with parents sharing intimate details that will follow them for the rest of their lives. Polarization has continued to grow as algorithms manipulate information and as individuals screen virtual friends by their political affiliation or religious beliefs, removing the capacity for true dialogue. As our use of social media expands, so does our need to truly understand it. With this novel, I hope that we can all ponder the question “what will happen if we’re not more conscious of our use of virtual social networks?”

 

Let's go deeper...

When a corporatocracy gains power in the United States, the government of the Founding Fathers is completely dissolved. The three largest technology companies come together to form the Corporate Council, a governing body that prides itself on the freedom of information. In pursuit of their mission, they create a technology known as the AIP, the Accessible Internet Product, that is injected into every individual at birth... voluntarily. The AIP works its way through the body and attaches itself to the occipital lobe, giving each individual viewing access to the internet in their brain as though there is a computer monitor just behind their eyes. Working on a thoughtsearch algorithm, each individual sees results that align with exactly what they want to see.

The eyes, now becoming facial recognition scanners, allow an individual to just look at anyone else and to instantaneously see everything that’s ever been posted about them on the Internet. There are no tags, no way to hide. When everything can be learned about an individual just by looking at them, the decision to love or hate them becomes immediate, causing people to classify and segregate themselves into communal systems, known as broods.

Rory Walsh, born into his parents’ brood, has had his entire life documented through the lens of his mother, Nora. Like any mother, she wants the best for her son, curating a social profile for him that will guarantee his acceptance into their traditionalist brood, forever.

But the version of him that Nora creates doesn’t exist.

The Rory Walsh that everyone sees when they look at him, is not the true Rory Walsh. He doesn’t belong in the brood for which he’s been bred, in the virtual skin he’s been given. In defiance of his parents, he goes on a journey to override the AIP system, to find a way to create his own identity, and to show that identity to the rest of the world. With the help of his best friend, Sebastian Desjardins, the wealthy heir to a large lobster exporter, he sets out to leave the world he’s known for an adventure to find a better life... a different life... a life he can call his own. But will he make it, or will the trek destroy him?
 

Let's fall in love.

You will love this book if you’ve ever wondered what our world could be like in the future. Just one option of many, this book touches on current cultural themes while following characters that struggle with their past and search for... and hide pieces of... themselves, while also celebrating the changing planet on which we all live (just in a world where the internet is utterly inescapable).

Identifiable speaks to adults and emerging adults who want to explore a world not too far away from our own, where the themes of identity, community, and technology all intertwine.

Ultimately, I hope that Identifiable inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • How do we create our own identities that may be so different from others’ expectations of us?
  • How much more challenging does dialogue become when communities voluntarily segregate themselves?
  • What challenges do we all face when the only information we see is that which we want to see?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

 

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in January, 2022.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

 

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals:

 

Tier 1: Hit $7,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published
Tier 2: Hit $8,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $11,000 and the book will be translated into Ukrainian

 

*If 250 copies are preordered, each preorder will receive a custom bookmark with a character sketch by the talented Brooklyn-based artist, Sophie Furman.

 

About the Author

Julia Tvardovskaya, also known affectionately as JT, is a full-time parent and a part-time author after having graduated from Georgetown University (Master of Business Administration and Master of Science in Foreign Service) in May of 2021. She is passionate about sharing stories in print, on the stage, and on the screen.

JT decided to write this book for two reasons. After studying Lifespan Development and watching the documentary A Social Dilemma, she became interested in the impacts of social media on children, which have been widely studied, but particularly on the generation of children growing up with a virtual profile that predates them and that they had no say in creating. She was also particularly attuned to the polarization of society and wanted to more understand social media’s role in that polarization.

When she’s not chasing a toddler around or thinking about future book ideas, you can find JT curled up with a book, planning post-COVID dream travel, re-watching Gilmore Girls or Schitt’s Creek, or doing baby yoga (imagine goat yoga, but with a different kind of kid!).

For more information about JT or Identifiable, you can connect with her at jultvard@gmail.com, on Instagram @jul_tvard, or through her website www.julia-tvardovskaya.com. 
 

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this form [International Preorders] to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

 

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #IdentifiableBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:
Instragram - @jul_tvard / @newdegreepress

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Julia (JT) Tvardovskaya

story:
¿Qué?

El legado de Thalios narra las peripecias de un joven en busca de su destino y, por ende, de salvar a la Humanidad.

Cuando Dainen, Príncipe de Dainen, encuentra el escondido Reino Élfico de Isinda, no imagina que acaba de iniciar una venganza de proporciones divinas. Su esperanza es encontrar el objeto con el que podrá poner fin a la amenaza o cumplirla.

Pero no solo los problemas acechan al joven Príncipe desde el exterior, pues en el interior de palacio se ciernen los planes para su caída y deberá enfrentarse a algo más oscuro que, poco a poco, se abre paso en su interior.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Sandra Adrián.

Nacida en Valencia en 1986, comienza a escribir con diez años tras recibir como regalo una máquina de escribir.

De niña escribía cuentos y en la adolescencia poemas, sin abandonar la pasión por la literatura fantástica. Poco a poco creció en su pensamiento un mundo de otra época, el cual trata de dar a conocer a través de su primera novela: El legado de Thalios.

Sandra Adrián es capaz de evocar maravillosos mundos de fantasía.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El legado de  Thalios que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Sandra Adrián vea publicada su obra. 

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Cuando Dainen, Príncipe de
Dainen, encuentra el escondido Reino Élfico de Isinda, no imagina que acaba de
iniciar una venganza de proporciones divinas. Su esperanza es encontrar el
objeto con el que podrá poner fin a la amenaza o cumplirla.
Pero no solo los problemas acechan al joven Príncipe
desde el exterior, pues en el interior de palacio se ciernen los planes para su
caída y deberá enfrentarse a algo más oscuro que, poco a poco, se abre paso en
su interior.
¿Quiénes?Tandaia es
 una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a 
autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes 
ideas como es el crowdfunding. De este modo eres tú, 
ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra 
que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro 
catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.Hoy te presentamos a Sandra Adrián.

Nacida en Valencia en 1986,
comienza a escribir con diez años tras recibir como regalo una máquina de
escribir.
De niña escribía cuentos y en la adolescencia poemas, sin
abandonar la pasión por la literatura fantástica. Poco a poco creció en su
pensamiento un mundo de otra época, el cual trata de dar a conocer a través de
su primera novela: El legado de Thalios.
 

Sandra Adrián es capaz de evocar maravillosos mundos de fantasía.¿Cómo?Para
 arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la 
cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con 
un ejemplar de esta primera edición.
Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.
Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El legado de  Thalios que saldría pocas semanas 
después a la venta.Además... Sabemos
 que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible 
que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en 
estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, 
incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta 
campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Sandra Adrián vea publicada su obra. Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Who is D'j?
*and what's the deal with that apostrophe???

D'j is a spoken word poet from the Tonight It's Poetry community in Saskatoon. She was a member of the 2015 Canadian Festival of Spoken Word championship winning team. Her poetry is sad and funny, kind of like a clown stuck in the rain.

*The apostrophe is everything. The apostrophe is nothing. All hail the apostrophe!

What is CIPS?
*and what the heck is a poetry slam???

CIPS is the Canadian Individual Poetry Slam. It's an annual spoken word poetry competition that takes place as part of the Verses Festival (http://versesfestival.ca) in beaUtiful Vancouver, BC.
40 poets from all across Canada compete to be crowned the national individual champion! It's also an amazing opportunity to listen, to learn, and to meet other poets and poetry lovers, 

*A poetry slam is a silly game where poetry is read aloud on stage and then assigned numerical scores by randomly selected judges in the audience. It's basically competitive vulnerability. It's basically the best.

What is this fundraiser for?
*and why should I contribute???

This fundraiser is for travel and accommodation expenses. The train ticket to and from Vancouver. Taxi Fares while there. Tacos (when necessary).

*Now listen, I'm not in the business of telling people what to do. I am however, in the business of believing that poetry matters. Writing poetry. Reading poetry. Saying poetry. Sharing poetry. It helps us articulate the unarticulatable. It gives us a dictionary for the ways we can feel. And in the case of a poetry slam, it's darn exciting, too.

If you feel this way too
If you want to see poetry travel
If you care about the emotional future of the human race!!!
this campaign is for you.

OKAY SHUT UP AND TELL ME ABOUT THE PERKS!

It's this simple: for every dollar that you donate, I will write you a line of poetry about a topic of your choosing and send it to you.

$2 = 2-line poem
$8 = 8-line poem
$17.50 = 18-line poem but half of the last line is missing

Any amount helps, even pocket change!

story:
I am an up and coming poet whose goal is to positively affect the world with my words.

Forgive My Gypsy Heart is a compilation of heartfelt poetry regarding the joy and pain of leaving home for the first time. From moving across the country to traveling around the world, I have documented the rollercoaster of emotions I have felt. I explore the concept of loneliness and finding myself on the road. I want people to know that it is okay to live their lives for themselves.

This campaign is meant to raise the money I need to publish my debut poetry book. A 20 dollar donation includes the book, shipping, and a couple of preorder exclusive perks. The expected release date is October 13th, 2017.

A Little Bit About Me:

  • My name is Courtney and I struggle with bipolar disorder. I combat this mental illness by writing poetry and blogging.
  • This campaign is meant to raise funding for my debut book. This book is meant to help launch my career as a reputable author.
  • Your contribution is my book. I wouldn't be publishing if it weren't for you.

What I Need & What You Get

  • The 2,000 dollar goal pays for all foreseen publishing, shipping, and production costs.
  • Everyone who donates the minimum gets an autographed copy of the book. I plan to include a couple of limited edition items including bookmarks. Larger donations ($50+) are eligible to receive custom canvas prints of any one of my poems, your choice which!
  • If I do not meet my goal, the funds will still go towards publishing costs. I might have to push back the publish date, but I will get this book out.

The Impact

  • I am hoping that "Forgive My Gypsy Heart" will empower those who feel stuck where they are. I want my readers to know that they are not alone.

Risks & Challenges

  • I feel like I have built a decent enough following to go through with this book. The only challenges I foresee are exposure and publishing cost, in which this campaign may alleviate both of those factors.
  • Regardless, I plan to actively pursue marketing and the income from my blogs will be going towards this project as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Not everyone has the money to just go about buying books, I get it. Your continued support is all I ask for.
  • Please share this page! The more potential contributors I can reach, the faster I can get this book printed.
  • Google CourtneyHype and show your support! I utilize most all of social media. Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Mirakee, WordPress, SnapChat. Your interaction on any of these platforms means the world to me.

story:
The Project

Chasing Olives is a book I am writing that chronicles my participation in the intensive format of a therapy called Surrogate Partner Therapy (SPT). SPT is a profoundly complex and delicate form of exposure therapy that addresses dysfunction in one's ability to experience emotional and physical intimacy. In my case, the dysfunction stemmed from childhood sexual abuse.

Surrogate Partner Therapy is conducted within the framework of an authentic, albeit clinically motivated and time-limited, relationship between a client and trained surrogate partner. The relationship is supervised by a licensed psychotherapist with whom the client processes thoughts, feelings, and reactions generated from the emotional and physical intimacy inherent in the relationship.

SPT is not widely accepted by the traditional psychotherapy community. Traditional psychotherapy relies on rigid boundaries that forbid touch beyond a handshake or supportive hug. There is considerable hand-wringing over SPT's flexible boundaries that allow the fullest expression of intimacy according to the client's needs.

For one year prior to SPT, I worked with a psychotherapist to reveal and understand the cognitive distortions I carried that are common to those who suffered egregious boundary violations as children. After so many hours of therapy, however, I could not say that I was close to being healed.

Shame, fear of touch, fear of intimacy, and a pervasive numb disconnectedness through which I filtered the entirety of my life experience crippled every aspect of my existence. Continuing to talk about it wasn't helping me to resolve the ingrained trauma response.

Surrogate Partner Therapy is the therapy that healed deeply rooted dysfunction and allowed me to embrace life and love with the courage of an open heart. That is the story I will share in Chasing Olives.

My Motivation To Write This Book

Surrogate Partner Therapy transformed my life in a way that traditional psychotherapy could not. I found freedom from the shame and fear that ruled my life and now feel a peace I've never known. I share my story with deep compassion for those who continue to suffer, and with the hope that Chasing Olives will help to draw attention to this remarkable therapy.

Coming To A Movie Theater Near You

Among the films previewed at the 2012 Sundance Film Festival, audiences screened The Surrogate. This movie recounts the true story of the therapeutic relationship between surrogate partner Cheryl Cohen Greene (played by Helen Hunt) and author/poet Mark O'Brien (played by John Hawkes). Anticipated to be an Oscar contender, the film will be released nationwide in Fall 2012 under a new title, The Sessions.

Greene worked with O'Brien two decades ago. Surrogate partners continue to work today in the United States, the United Kingdom, and Israel under the auspices of the International Professional Surrogate Association (IPSA).

The success of the movie at Sundance and its upcoming release nationally has generated media interest in Surrogate Partner Therapy. Hopefully, as more people become aware of SPT via media coverage, Chasing Olives will prove helpful to those needing additional insight.

Your Donation

Thank you for reading about my project! Your time and attention is a donation itself, and I am so grateful.

I will self-publish Chasing Olives by December 2012. Any donations will be used to support basic life necessities while I write full-time. I also will hire a professional editor and a publicist.

Another Great Way To Help

If you are comfortable doing so, please share with your family and friends a link to this page. Thanks!

For More Information

The International Professional Surrogates Association's website: http://surrogatetherapy.org/what-is-surrogate-partner-therapy/

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you'd like information from a client's perspective in advance of Chasing Olives being published: chasingolives2012@gmail.com

story:
Story of My Book

This book tells the Saudi story of the recent changes and reforms implemented in different sectors from a Saudi perspective. The book will talk about notable trends in the region and how Saudi Arabia made an effective change.

I wrote this book because I want to share the Saudi success story with the world and document the enormous change from a Saudi perspective.

If you’re an international reader, you will discover or rediscover Saudi Arabia and change your perspective. If you are a regional reader, this book will sum up the reforms and the changes that happened in Saudi Arabia from a public policy perspective.

In this book, I hope to instill the same passion and excitement that I have for Public Policy in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you rebuild your image of Saudi Arabia and see how a small, well-formed policy could change the whole country.

This book will teach you about the Saudi national transformation and the vision 2030 goals and programs and its influence on specific sectors and trends.

Building indicators as an essential step to start measuring performance

Empowering women as a hugely active part of the society

Expanding in different sectors and improving government performance

You will love this book if you are interested in Saudi Arabia or are passionate about public policy.

The World Gate: Public Policy in Saudi Arabia is a non-fiction book that speaks to regional readers interested in following up on Saudi changes and international readers looking at Saudi Arabia, the progress that happened in the past few years, and public policy at the same time.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Ghada is a consultant, writer, and podcaster who is interested in strategic management and public policy. Ghada holds a degree in International Business Management from King Abdulaziz University and another Master’s Degree in Public Policy Management from Georgetown University.

Ghada started her career as a teaching assistant; later she pursued a different career path that allows her to follow her dreams. Ghada has been a host of an Arabic podcast called “as simple as” since 2018 and she is currently a MISK trainee working for the UNESCO at Amman, Jordan in the Education Department.

Ghada is an avid reader and is passionate about culture and music. She loves to go out of her way to discover different cultures and places, either through reading or travel.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

story:
Story of My Book 

The book is about the practical lessons and principles I’ve learned as a result of growing up without my father. I wrote this because of the ever-present need for strong, compassionate, committed and positive male role models in our society. I want to encourage and empower others who have grown up without their fathers and give them practical principles to help push them towards greatness. My book will publish in October of 2019.

Without A Father - From Fear to Faith
This book uncovers the deep wounds of pain, anger, and resentment that developed in me as a result of not having my father in my life. Through life’s hardships, I am able to use my faith to conquer all of my fears and become the man I was destined to be.

My name is Kenny Joyner and I am the author of Without A Father - from Fear to Faith. I wrote this book as a resource to help strengthen those who did not grow up with their fathers. My hope is to give several principles that every young boy can use to develop himself into a great man.

While reading this book, you will discover that life is always teaching and growing us towards our purpose. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same passion and enthusiasm that I have for building strong young men. My hope is to illuminate the significance of the male in our society. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool that can help you navigate through some of the difficulties many have faced as a result of not having their fathers in their lives.

In this book, you'll learn about overcoming fear, disappointment and how struggle produces success in every area of our lives.

The Book - Without A Father - From Fear to Faith

This book is written in 4 Parts...

  • The Beginning - You’re Just Like Your Father - Your beginning doesn't determine your end. In a traumatizing scene, I recount an experience of growing up in a home where domestic violence was prevalent. It leaves me with a deeper connection with my mom, but with an unbridled hatred towards my stepfather. This is a mindset that I would carry well into my 30's. This scene sets the stage for a recurring theme throughout the book of not feeling good enough to become all that I was designed to be.
  • The Young Man - Hood Lessons - In this chapter of the book I develop a shift in thinking that helps me to learn from every situation I face in life. It changes my mindset from victim to being victorious. Hood Lessons examines some of the things that others may take for granted and uses them to create life-changing principles which help me in this season of life. The pain that we face in every situation can be used to push us past our fears and develop a greater sense of self-worth.
  • The New Man - First Class - In this chapter I talk about overcoming the anxiety of not feeling good enough to be great. I make the decision to change my overall approach to life. Every one of us has or will doubt our ability at some point, but if you know that you are First Class material, then you can eventually change your life for the better.
  • The Redeemed Man - Just as Job questions God as a result of all the pain he had to endure, I find myself later in life with the opportunity to ask my father questions about why he wasn’t there for me. As our relationship hangs in the balance, tragedy strikes and new hope for redemption begins.

You will love this book if you love stories about people who have overcome unfavorable odds and who are now making a difference for others.
Without A Father - From Fear to Faith is a non-fiction book that offers practical principles and skills needed to navigate successfully in this world.
 

What You Get & What I Need


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in October 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copy editing for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - Launching October 2019

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish a Paperback Edition. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audio-book. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition. If you know anything about me you know I always set the bar high. I’m looking to pre-sell at least 500 copies or more, but I need your help.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback on and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book and more.

About the Author

Kenny Joyner is a dynamic speaker, teacher, mentor, and leader of the non-profit organization, Boys with A Purpose. His passion is to help everyone reach their full potential. He is committed to building strong young men.

He grew up in the Washington DC metropolitan area. His mom, a single mother who raised four children, gave him the strength and support he needed to survive. Watching his mother survive domestic violence and overcome poverty helped to strengthen him and pushed him towards his destiny. Growing up without his father, however, left a profound effect on his overall development as a man. As he grew, life became his teacher and he developed his passion to help develop young people. His journey led him to South Carolina where he became a teacher and the co-founder of Boys With A Purpose, a non-profit organization that mentors young boys and help them find and fulfill their purpose in life. His family and faith are the most important things in the world to him. His goal is the success of others.

For more information, you can connect with Kenny at kjoyner@thechangemakersc.com

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenges with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #WithoutaFather and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it.
  • Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media.

Follow my adventure and be inspired to make a difference.

 CHANGE MAKER@Joy2Teach1 or change_maker1 on Instagram.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Kenny
aka - The Change Maker
story_txt:
Story of My Book The book is about the practical lessons and principles I’ve learned as a result of growing up without my father. I wrote this because of the ever-present need for strong, compassionate, committed and positive male role models in our society. I want to encourage and empower others who have grown up without their fathers and give them practical principles to help push them towards greatness. My book will publish in October of 2019.Without A Father - From Fear to FaithThis book uncovers the deep wounds of pain, anger, and resentment that developed in me as a result of not having my father in my life. Through life’s hardships, I am able to use my faith to conquer all of my fears and become the man I was destined to be.My name is Kenny Joyner and I am the author of Without A Father - from Fear to Faith. I wrote this book as a resource to help strengthen those who did not grow up with their fathers. My hope is to give several principles that every young boy can use to develop himself into a great man.While reading this book, you will discover that life is always teaching and growing us towards our purpose. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same passion and enthusiasm that I have for building strong young men. My hope is to illuminate the significance of the male in our society. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool that can help you navigate through some of the difficulties many have faced as a result of not having their fathers in their lives.In this book, you'll learn about overcoming fear, disappointment and how struggle produces success in every area of our lives.
The Book - Without A Father - From Fear to Faith
This book is written in 4 Parts...

The Beginning - You’re Just Like Your Father - Your beginning doesn't determine your end. In a traumatizing scene, I recount an experience of growing up in a home where domestic violence was prevalent. It leaves me with a deeper connection with my mom, but with an unbridled hatred towards my stepfather. This is a mindset that I would carry well into my 30's. This scene sets the stage for a recurring theme throughout the book of not feeling good enough to become all that I was designed to be.

The Young Man - Hood Lessons - In this chapter of the book I develop a shift in thinking that helps me to learn from every situation I face in life. It changes my mindset from victim to being victorious. Hood Lessons examines some of the things that others may take for granted and uses them to create life-changing principles which help me in this season of life. The pain that we face in every situation can be used to push us past our fears and develop a greater sense of self-worth.

The New Man - First Class - In this chapter I talk about overcoming the anxiety of not feeling good enough to be great. I make the decision to change my overall approach to life. Every one of us has or will doubt our ability at some point, but if you know that you are First Class material, then you can eventually change your life for the better.

The Redeemed Man - Just as Job questions God as a result of all the pain he had to endure, I find myself later in life with the opportunity to ask my father questions about why he wasn’t there for me. As our relationship hangs in the balance, tragedy strikes and new hope for redemption begins.
You will love this book if you love stories about people who have overcome unfavorable odds and who are now making a difference for others.Without A Father - From Fear to Faith is a non-fiction book that offers practical principles and skills needed to navigate successfully in this world. What You Get & What I NeedThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in October 2019
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copy editing for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - Launching October 2019
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish a Paperback Edition. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audio-book. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition. If you know anything about me you know I always set the bar high. I’m looking to pre-sell at least 500 copies or more, but I need your help.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback on and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book and more.
About the AuthorKenny Joyner is a dynamic speaker, teacher, mentor, and leader of the non-profit organization, Boys with A Purpose. His passion is to help everyone reach their full potential. He is committed to building strong young men.He grew up in the Washington DC metropolitan area. His mom, a single mother who raised four children, gave him the strength and support he needed to survive. Watching his mother survive domestic violence and overcome poverty helped to strengthen him and pushed him towards his destiny. Growing up without his father, however, left a profound effect on his overall development as a man. As he grew, life became his teacher and he developed his passion to help develop young people. His journey led him to South Carolina where he became a teacher and the co-founder of Boys With A Purpose, a non-profit organization that mentors young boys and help them find and fulfill their purpose in life. His family and faith are the most important things in the world to him. His goal is the success of others.For more information, you can connect with Kenny at kjoyner@thechangemakersc.comRisks & ChallengesOne of the biggest challenges with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

story:
Seventeen-year-old Alvis possesses a gift of inexplicable strength. Raised in the slums by his genius-mechanic father, Alvis wants to use his strength to help people, but his temper gets in him in trouble instead. Level-headed Rae is a half-dragon, half-human hybrid called a Guardian. A wanted criminal, Rae carries with him the trauma from his time as a gladiator, when he was forced to fight against (and kill) other Guardians for the entertainment of the wealthy. Despite their differences, Alvis and Rae can agree on one thing: they fight best when they’re fighting alone. But when faced with the corruption in their homeland, Zen, one thing becomes clear- they'll have to keep each other alive if they want to survive.

THE GUARDIAN is the first installment of a planned trilogy titled WHEN THE LAST DRAGON DIED. For fans of fantasy stories such as Carry On by Rainbow Rowell and anime like Hunter x Hunter and Fullmetal Alchemist, it tackles themes like mental illness, discrimination, and morality in the face of war with a light-hearted, but earnest tone. And, of course, it wouldn’t be a YA novel without a little romance - Alvis has a thing for guys with strong jawlines and toned biceps. (He also can’t flirt to save his life.)  

The Guardian started as a NaNoWriMo project in 2014.  After a few years of fleshing out characters, outlining, and using two more NaNoWriMos as driving forces, I finished the first draft in the Winter of 2017. The next two books have been outlined and writing for book two began in Fall of 2018.

If you would like a sample of The Guardian, the first two chapters are available here!
 

You can check out each perk individually or you can check out this helpful chart below.

SPECIAL NOTE: All E-books, Paperbacks, and Hardcovers, will be sent out about 3 months before the official release!

$3: A big ol' lifetime THANK YOU on the website!

$10: An E-book copy (PDF) of The Guardian emailed to you and a lifetime thank you on the website.

$25: A Paperback of The Guardian, an E-book copy (PDF), a sticker, and a lifetime thank you on the website.

$30: A SIGNED Paperback of The Guardian, an E-book copy (PDF), a sticker, and a lifetime thank you on the website.

$45: The perfect combination: a bag of Dodger Coffee Co Coffee Beans as well as a signed paperback of The Guardian, an E-book copy (PDF), a sticker, and a lifetime thank you on the website. (Is there anything better than curling up with a new book and a warm cup of coffee?) 

$50: Exclusive art print created specially for this Indiegogo. You will also get a signed paperback of The Guardian, an E-book copy (PDF), a sticker, and a lifetime thank you on the website.

$75: A Signed Hardcover! Also included is the art print, an E-book copy (PDF), a sticker, and a lifetime thank you on the website.

$200: Your name will be printed in the book's acknowledgements! You will also get a signed hardcover of The Guardian and signed hardcover copies of books 2 & 3 when they are released. This tier also includes the art print, an E-book copy (PDF), a sticker, and a lifetime thank you on the website.

$300: Your name will be printed in the acknowledgements of all 3 books of the When the Last Dragon Died series! In addition to a signed hardcover of The Guardian, you will also receive signed hardcover copies of books 2 & 3  when they are released. Also included is the art print, an E-book copy (PDF), a sticker, and a lifetime thank you on the website.

INTERNATIONAL SUPPORTERS: Because of how expensive overseas shipping can be, please note that there will be an additional cost for international shipping. Shipping is included in all US orders.

 

Can't donate?

No problem! You can still join the mailing list here! This will get you updates on the book such as release date, pre-orders, your chance to get an ARC, new content, and more! (I WON’T SPAM I PROMISE.)

 

Self-publishing means I've gone from being solely the author to also being the publisher and advertiser. The Guardian is incredibly important to me and I want to release the best product possible as professionally as I can. There are many aspects- and people! - that go into bringing this book to life, and I want to be fully transparent with you guys about those costs. Please note that this budget of $8,500 accounts for the worst case scenario.

Professional Editor: 32% of the budget. Rebecca Faith Editorial has worked with both traditionally published and self-published authors. She is helping me with content feedback, proofreading, and line editing. I'm confident she's going to help me take my novel to the highest level it can be.

Cover and other Art: 13% of the budget. Toni Infante is an incredible illustrator who has done work for Boom!, DC Comics, and more. When he accepted to not only create the cover but was also genuinely excited to work on the project, I can't describe how honored I was! As you can see by the progress sketch, IT'S GOING TO BE AWESOME. I can't wait to reveal the final cover!

Distribution Prep: 15% of the budget (Includes the first 20 printed books, ISBN Registration and additional distribution services). I plan to use a publishing house and distributor that has worked with many self-published authors. In addition to helping me with the layout for The Guardian for both e-book and physical formats, they will also handle distribution with Amazon, Kindle, Barnes and Nobel, and more!

In addition to the above costs, the budget also covers printing of books (13%), purchase of fundraising rewards (6%), shipping of your rewards (11%), and Indiegogo processing fees (10%).

If the goal is exceeded and there are funds left over, these will go towards the pre-launch of The Guardian, as well as towards the investment of the next two books.

 

My name is Erin, though I’m known more online as HappiLeeErin! I have a youtube channel dedicated to anime and manga, including a podcast. While my channel has taken a backseat while I’ve worked on my novel project, I’m also very active on twitter where I tweet about white-haired anime boys and the funny stuff my three-year-old says. I love character driven stories that aren't afraid of playing with tropes, and fluff on fluff with a little side of angst when it comes to my romances. While The Guardian is my first novel, I've been writing since I was around 8 years old thanks to some long since buried Dragon Ball Z fanfic (Gohan and Rini are MEANT 2 B DON'T @ ME).

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any sort of crowdfunding, there can always be unforeseen difficulties with timeline, shipping, and other things. However, because "The Guardian" as a novel is completely written, has gone through numerous beta readers, and is now in the editing phase, I don't foresee any major changes to it and feel confident in my timeline for its release. I also believe I've given myself enough time to order, package, and ship all tier rewards in a timely manner- and I have a husband with an impressive amount of experience when it comes to mail and shipping, so I find any issues with that to be near non-existent. 

Of course, I know there is always a chance the project won't be fully funded. If that is the case, the book will not be abandoned. I really believe in my little book baby and I think it would be cool for other people to be excited about it, too. I fully intend to move forward with it next year with our family budget and supporters will still receive their rewards no matter what!

story:
Escribes con nosotros una bonita historia?

Tenemos un sueño y queremos que participes con nosotros, el Panda Raid 2017

El Panda Raid 2017, es un evento consistente, en recorrer 3.000 km por el desierto Marroquí repartiendo ayuda humanitaria. La organización obliga a ir mínimo con 30 kg de ayuda humanitaria, pero nosotros consideramos que debemos ir con lo máximo posible, y deseamos ir con 70 kg, para llegar a la mayor cantidad de gente posible, y que así también se beneficien de nuestra visita.

Este evento empieza desde Madrid, pero nosotros nos ubicamos por temas laborales en Heidelberg, Alemania. Por lo tanto empezaremos esta aventura en Heidelberg, en lo que hemos calculado tendremos, unos dos días de viaje hasta Madrid, lugar donde se producen las verificaciones (lugar donde se comprueba, que el coche está en regla, que se llevan todos los accesorios que pide la organización, y por supuesto que se lleva la ayuda humanitaria que requiere también la organización, donde nosotros queremos aportar 70kg, 40 más de lo que la organización obliga a llevar).

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 

Cuanto es el presupuesto necesario?

  • Necesitamos 12.000€ de financiamiento para poder llevar a cabo este proyecto. Los gastos calculados para este proyecto, son los siguientes:
    • 2.100 € para la inscripción en el Panda Raid 2017
    • 1.200 € para la compra del coche
    • 6.500 € para la preparación del coche
    • 600 € en gastos de comida, ida y vuelta
    • 500 € en gastos de peajes ida y vuelta
    • 1.500 € gasolina para ida y vuelta

Aportaciones y Recompensas

  • Las aportaciones que se pueden hacer para estos eventos, van desde pequeñas aportaciones de personas, hasta el primer patrocinador que nos quiera patrocinar en esta aventura.
    • Para todos aquellos pequeños patrocinadores que nos aporten una pequeña cantidad, inscribiremos su nombre completo en el nuestro coche a modo de pegatina, y tendrá una mención especial en la película que queremos realizar en esta aventura.
    • Para las empresas, ofrecemos posibilidades que van desde ser nuestro protector del sol en el Sahara a modo de banda alargarda en nuestro cristal delantero del coche, o ocupar un cristal hasta ser nuestro principal patrocinador ocupando todas la parte delantera de nuestro coche. La recompensa a dicha aportación será de tener todo nuestro capó para el solo, aparte de que tendrá mayor repercusión a la hora de hablar de los patrocinadores, redes sociales, y la película que realizaremos sobre el Panda Raid 2017
  • Si estos fondos que se están aportando una vez, finalizada la campaña, no consiguen llegar a la meta, nosotros pondremos el restante para participar en el evento Panda Raid 2017

El impacto 

Explica tu campaña en mayor detalle y cuéntale a la gente la diferencia que hará su contribución:

  • Creemos firmemente, y por eso te damos la posibilidad de colaborar con nosotros, que es una forma muy interesante de aportarle algo al mundo en tus vacaciones sin dejar de vivir una experiencia inolvidable. A la vez que se lucha por que un Panda cruce 3.000 km de puro desierto, se lucha también contra la desigualdad social, aportando nuestro granito de arena llevando ayuda humanitaria. 
  • Este proyecto, tiene la misión de acercar también culturas, y ver como no tan lejos, se vive otra realidad. En la película que organicemos acerca de nuestras aventuras por el Panda Raid 2017, queremos que os sintáis partícipes de esta experiencia,  aparte de simplemente colaborar con nosotros, os ofreceremos la posibilidad de ver como con vuestra a ayuda, habéis empujado 70 kg de ayuda humanitaria y como es recibida por quién la recibe.  

Desafío

El desafío es muy grande, cruzar 3.000 km de desierto a bordo de un Panda, puede en principio parecer una locura, pero lo conseguiremos.

Riesgos

Obviamente hay riesgos, el Panda es un coche muy antiguo como para andar haciéndole más de 10.000 km en unos 10 días, 3.000 km de ellos por el duro desierto africano. Lo que no nos cabe duda es que aguantará

  • La cuestión es que no nos pensamos rendir. Tenemos un objetivo y es acabar el Panda Raid 2017, y lo que puede diferencia a un coche tipo Panda de otros, es que la mecánica es bastante más sencilla que otro tipo de coches, donde muchas veces con un martillo y una brida se puede solucionar el problema mecánico.
  • Cualquier cosa de mecánica que surja, no nos supondrá mucho problema, ya que una de las personas participantes de este proyecto es un entendido de los coches, con larga experiencia en eventos deportivos. Siempre existe la posibilidad de que el coche rompa por completo, pero deseemos que eso nunca ocurra.  

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Sabemos que no todas las personas nos pueden ayudar económicamente, pero lo pueden hacer de otras formas como puede ser, compartiendo nuestro proyecto en redes sociales, o colaborando dándonos ayuda humanitaria para que nosotros la llevemos al Panda Raid.

En nuestra Fan Page de Facebook Duras on Tour podéis ver toda actualidad que haya al respecto del Panda Raid 2017.

Para cualquier consulta también puedes contactarnos a través del siguiente correo electrónico. perezdanielalejandre@gmail.com

Muchas gracias por tu colaboración. Juntos contaremos una bonita historia.
