1.500 € gasolina para ida y vuelta


Aportaciones y Recompensas

Las aportaciones que se pueden hacer para estos eventos, van desde pequeñas aportaciones de personas, hasta el primer patrocinador que nos quiera patrocinar en esta aventura.
Para todos aquellos pequeños patrocinadores que nos aporten una pequeña cantidad, inscribiremos su nombre completo en el nuestro coche a modo de pegatina, y tendrá una mención especial en la película que queremos realizar en esta aventura.
Para las empresas, ofrecemos posibilidades que van desde ser nuestro protector del sol en el Sahara a modo de banda alargarda en nuestro cristal delantero del coche, o ocupar un cristal hasta ser nuestro principal patrocinador ocupando todas la parte delantera de nuestro coche. La recompensa a dicha aportación será de tener todo nuestro capó para el solo, aparte de que tendrá mayor repercusión a la hora de hablar de los patrocinadores, redes sociales, y la película que realizaremos sobre el Panda Raid 2017


Si estos fondos que se están aportando una vez, finalizada la campaña, no consiguen llegar a la meta, nosotros pondremos el restante para participar en el evento Panda Raid 2017


El impacto 

Explica tu campaña en mayor detalle y cuéntale a la gente la diferencia que hará su contribución:

Creemos firmemente, y por eso te damos la posibilidad de colaborar con nosotros, que es una forma muy interesante de aportarle algo al mundo en tus vacaciones sin dejar de vivir una experiencia inolvidable. A la vez que se lucha por que un Panda cruce 3.000 km de puro desierto, se lucha también contra la desigualdad social, aportando nuestro granito de arena llevando ayuda humanitaria. 
Este proyecto, tiene la misión de acercar también culturas, y ver como no tan lejos, se vive otra realidad. En la película que organicemos acerca de nuestras aventuras por el Panda Raid 2017, queremos que os sintáis partícipes de esta experiencia,  aparte de simplemente colaborar con nosotros, os ofreceremos la posibilidad de ver como con vuestra a ayuda, habéis empujado 70 kg de ayuda humanitaria y como es recibida por quién la recibe.  



Desafío
El desafío es muy grande, cruzar 3.000 km de desierto a bordo de un Panda, puede en principio parecer una locura, pero lo conseguiremos.
Riesgos
Obviamente hay riesgos, el Panda es un coche muy antiguo como para andar haciéndole más de 10.000 km en unos 10 días, 3.000 km de ellos por el duro desierto africano. Lo que no nos cabe duda es que aguantará

La cuestión es que no nos pensamos rendir. Tenemos un objetivo y es acabar el Panda Raid 2017, y lo que puede diferencia a un coche tipo Panda de otros, es que la mecánica es bastante más sencilla que otro tipo de coches, donde muchas veces con un martillo y una brida se puede solucionar el problema mecánico.
Cualquier cosa de mecánica que surja, no nos supondrá mucho problema, ya que una de las personas participantes de este proyecto es un entendido de los coches, con larga experiencia en eventos deportivos. Siempre existe la posibilidad de que el coche rompa por completo, pero deseemos que eso nunca ocurra.  


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
Sabemos que no todas las personas nos pueden ayudar económicamente, pero lo pueden hacer de otras formas como puede ser, compartiendo nuestro proyecto en redes sociales, o colaborando dándonos ayuda humanitaria para que nosotros la llevemos al Panda Raid.En nuestra Fan Page de Facebook Duras on Tour podéis ver toda actualidad que haya al respecto del Panda Raid 2017.
Para cualquier consulta también puedes contactarnos a través del siguiente correo electrónico. perezdanielalejandre@gmail.com
Muchas gracias por tu colaboración. Juntos contaremos una bonita historia.

story:
Background and objectives

My wife and I have the skills to write, edit, produce and publish great books and have been successfully doing so since 2014, but the stock photo libraries we rely on for images for our covers do not have the range to truly reflect our characters, and, therefore, our readers. We are hosting this crowdfunding campaign to raise money for a photo shoot to create our own library of images for use on our books.

After years writing for other people, the self-publishing revolution means we have the freedom to write and publish the fiction we've always wanted to for the readers we always knew were there. They just weren't of interest to traditional publishing. We write diverse lesbian fiction under the pen name Elizabeth Andre. We write diverse gay male fiction under the pen names Kendall Morgan and Danielle Summers.

Covers that could be improved

Here are examples of our book covers that are adequate but could be vastly improved by a photo library designed by and for us.

Right Time for Love is about an interracial pair of lesbian retired nurses who fall in love and have sex on a cruise ship, but the lack of sexy senior ladies in stock photo libraries means we have this for a cover.

It's not good enough. What we really want is a photo of a 65-year-old Caucasian female and an Asian female about to kiss passionately. That's not in stock photo libraries, and this was the best we could do with the images available to us.

When we wrote about an interracial pair of middle-aged gay bears falling in love in Rough Cut, we ended up with this.

We couldn't find any images of sexy, burly, middle-aged hairy men that truly reflect how sexy our characters are and the true passion of the story we are telling. Stock photos of middle-aged hairy men are in limited supply, and the ones that do exist are clown-like. Not sexy, not in the passionate embrace that reflects the love in our story.

Goals

Every story deserves a happy ending, and people like us deserve to have our stories told. Readers deserve covers that reflect back at them. Everyone benefits when we see ourselves in the stories we tell each other. Everyone benefits when we see ourselves in the book covers.

We are aiming to raise $6,000 to create the images we need because, not only do people like you belong on book covers, everyone involved in this project deserves to be paid fairly. That money will pay our fabulous photographer (Scott Barnes), a stylist, a venue and our models whose beauty will come in a range of colors, ethnicities, shapes and sizes. Any money raised over our target will be used to create even more fabulous images. If we don't meet our target, we'll just create fewer images, but we'll never stop writing and publishing the stories that mean the world to us!

Perks

If you invest $750 in our project you will have the opportunity to be the star of a gay or lesbian erotic romance novella. The main character will have the name of your choice, and we will design him or her and their tale of love around some details of your choosing (subject to mutual agreement and Amazon's content guidelines). This story will be written by us and published as part of the Lesbian Light Reads or Pacific Palms series. For $250 the supporting character such as a wise friend or loving relative will be based on you. We think you would be a fabulous love interest in our next romance story or maybe the best friend character who dispenses wise advice to the lovelorn. A $15 investment will get you an early electronic copy of Roll With Me, Lesbian Light Reads 10, which tells the story of a love affair between a wheelchair racer and a runner or an electronic copy of Coming Back To You, Pacific Palms 3, which tells the story of a middle-aged interracial gay couple who attempt to rekindle their relationship at an all-gay resort. It will have a much sexier cover than this because of our campaign. 

What you can do

We hope you will take this opportunity to be a part of this project in some way by:

  • Sharing this project on social media or by email
  • Writing about it on your blog or other publication
  • Investing at the level comfortable for you

Thank you for helping make this project a reality.

Models wanted

P.S. After the fundraising campaign is complete, we will be recruiting models. If you would like to be one of our models, please register your interest here: https://goo.gl/forms/IGuSOVRYa5Zgnxsq2. When the model call is open, we will be in touch.

story:
¿Qué?

La búsqueda es una narración a ritmo de road-movie con una trama de madurez y de superación serpenteando por sus páginas.

Esta novela trata de las aventuras de dos amigos por entender la vida. Vida que les parece aburrida, carente de sentido, muy diferente a la imagen que tenian cuando eran jóvenes, y eso que se supone tienen todo lo que la sociedad les dice que los hará felices (una profesión, trabajo, dinero). Para ello iniciaran un viaje por la carretera que los llevará a distintos lugares, situaciones y en el que conocerán distintos personajes (un chamán, un astrólogo, una estudiante de cine), que les ayudarán a descubrir ese sentido que se les escapa.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Joaquín Hameau.

Nacido el 27 de Julio en Viña del Mar, Chile, es el tercero de diez hermanos. Ha trabajado como Ingeniero Comercial en prestigiosas empresas de su país. Actualmente se encuentra haciendo un MBA en Madrid y estrena un película en Julio en Chile. Hace unos años, en una búsqueda a un sentido más profundo a su vida, dejó su trabajo y se fue a viajar. Lo que cambio su vida por completo ya que encontró en la escritura su vocación. Es, además, amante de los deportes y de la lectura.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La búsqueda que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Joaquín Hameau vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Oh, Hi!
Since 2016, Geoff Bottone and I have been working hard on the rules and setting for Dark Times- a strongly themed Ancient World campaign LARP making use of the MASI rules. We'll be running it at Burgundar, a great camp in Harrison, Maine, and we hope to run it for 3-4 years, depending on story arc progression. 

Burgundar, and our friends at Mystwood and at Parallax, have some excellent Medieval and late Dark Age items available for costuming and for weaponry, but we're thinking big when it comes to setting for Dark Times. Our game is meant to be pre-Roman in feel, emulating the dress and cultures of the Ancient World, and the Pulp Fantasy traditions of Robert Howard. Michael Moorcock, Clark Ashton Smith, and of course, HP Lovecraft. 

In order for our game to feel like Dark Times, it needs to look like Dark Times.

Risks and Challenges
We will be running this game in 2019, whether we have the costuming and props we dream of or not. But if we can get the help we need now, we can summon the sandestins, brew the homunculi, and call down the starspawn, in order to put them to work on the amazing props we know we can get with your help.

What We'll Do With Your Money
After we finish rolling around in it like cats, we'll be focusing primarily on costumes. The go-to for LARPs in our area is colored tabards for various groups- we don't want this level of costuming. Robes, dalmaticas, togas, kilts, and tunics are the order of the era we're portraying in Dark Times, and the styles are wildly different from medieval costuming. We also need plenty of accessory pieces- bronze amulets and brooches, fibulae, torcs, and the like.

Once we know we've got enough costuming to show off our setting, we'll turn an eye toward weaponry, set pieces, and the other special effects we know we'll need. Dark Times is designed to not need a lot in the way of module area set dressing, but of course having it will only serve to help our game. We have a couple of spots (the Tomb, where the dead return, and the Whispering Monolith, in the center of town) that we need props for, but we don't expect those to be terrible expensive with what we envision.

Any money we have above and beyond costuming, set pieces, and weapons we'll be putting into armor. Our friends at the Bonaparte Company will help us with the helms, bracers, and greaves typically to the lightly armored warriors of the ancient world.

story:
What is Gnow.it?

Gnow.it (pronounced “know it”) is a new way to consume digital information that learns your reading interests to deliver the content that truly matters to you. It is a new medium that harnesses the power of artificial intelligence to scan all new publications in the world, and curate a set of articles personalized to your interests.

It is the virtual “you” on the internet.  Your digital secretary that is constantly scouring the internet for the freshest content that matches your particular interests.

It brings you all your favourite content from across the web in one place that is easy to read and fun to use. It curates news from a content library spanning thousands of niche categories to find news on any topic you could think of.

 

Features

Personalization Done Right

 

Gnow.it changes the game by learning your preferences and specific interests to create a personalized reading experience. Our artificial intelligence technology will go to work for you to bring you news and blog material to suit your unique tastes. No two individuals will have the same news feed which speaks to the level of personalization made possible by the AI technology that powers this app.


Recommendations Improve Over Time

Within a short period of time of using the app, you will notice that the app can “read your mind” by suggesting articles to read. The app will adapt to your ever-changing interests so that you will always be reading relevant content. Oh, and did we mention that this is all done automatically?


Summaries to Save You Time


Struggling to keep up with all of the news in this fast-paced world of ours? You can read concise summaries of articles to save you time. We know your time is valuable. Our summaries will help you decide if an entire article is worth reading by giving you the main ideas of the content in only a few short sentences.  


News Without Limits


Offers much more than the traditional source listing of most tablet and mobile readers. Find news from any niche on the Internet, no matter how small. Gnow.it brings content from thousands of categories from across the web into the palm of your hand, even from sources that you have never seen before.

*concept image of the app



*concept image


For the Niche. For the Masses. For You

Find news from any niche on the Internet, no matter how small or quirky. Gnow.it offers much more content than the traditional source listing of most tablet and mobile readers. The app will come pre­loaded with common topics such as Politics, Technology, or Business to name a few. Gnow.it will also give you access to thousands of categories for you to choose from. 

These categories can range from the downright particular (quantum physics, Nicholas Cage memes, piano-playing cats…) to the everyday - and everything in between. 

 

 *concept image

Artificial intelligence powered reading

Struggling to keep up with news within this fast paced world? Read summaries to save time. Get your information at a glance without having to read entire articles. Information overload will be a thing of the past. 

We've married content, design and speed.  All three agreed.

No need to worry about loading times anymore to read your news. The app will even work on 2G speeds. Our team has made it a priority to make this app fast and not be bogged down by slow loading images.

*concept image 

Be a good friend - the interesting, smart kind.

Alongside saving your favourite articles you can also share anything interesting you find with your social networks. Don't get unfriended by suggesting stale content ever again*. 

*Gnow.it cannot guarantee that this will never happen to you.

 

         

*concept image 

The Perks?

Our app is still in development which means that many features can be modified before our worldwide launch. This includes everything from the user interface to the top 12 categories of news featured on the home screen and everything in between (see Like a Boss perk).

Anyone who opts in for the “First in the World” or “Pioneer” perk will be given the opportunity to get early access to the pre­launch versions of Gnow.it. This allows you to give us your feedback on what changes can be made to every aspect of the app. Your valuable input during both alpha and beta testing will lead to a higher quality version of Gnow.it, a version far better than anything our team could accomplish on its own. You can help decide how the app will turn out. Come on, join the team! 

The Boss and The Chosen One perks will get you this exclusive t-shirt design that will ONLY be available to Indiegogo contributors.

   

                                           

 

Our Team

We have an awesome team with decades of collective experience working at Mediagator, the company behind this app and campaign.  We have one of the foremost thinkers in natural language processing (NLP) and AI working on the team. We also have a development team that has helped to launch a major news monitoring alternative based on artificial intelligence.

The funds you contribute will enable us to finish the development of Gnow.it by bringing it to your smartphone before the end of 2013.

 

The Team in the News:

Techvibes: http://www.techvibes.com/blog/canadian-startup-gnowit-tackle...

Crowdfundinsider: http://www.crowdfundinsider.com/2013/07/19241-crowdf...

Crowdfundingguide: http://www.crowdfundingguide.com/project-launch-aler...

 

FAQ

1. Will the app be free when it is officially released?  

The app will be free to download when it is completed.

2. In what order of operating systems will the app launch?

The launch of our app will be for both Blackberry and Android. Don’t worry Mac-o-philes, we have a plan to develop for iOS as well.

3. Are there not other apps that have the same personalization features?

There are similar apps that offer personalization but they require manual inputs in order for the app to start recommending articles for you to read. Gnow.it does this automatically without having you to think about it at all.

4. How did you come up with the name?

The core feature of this news reading app is to personalize your reading experience on a mobile device. For an app to offer any form of personalization, it must first get to know you. Based on this premise we decided to give it the name Gnow.it. This is meant to illustrate that the app can learn to "know" what content interests you in order to bring you the news that truly matters to you.  Look, we thought we hit the “K” key, but slipped and hit the “G” instead.  We’ve stuck with it because we’re loyal.

 

Press Tools

Visit www.gnow.it/media

 

Questions?

Email us at hello@mediagator.ca for any questions, suggestions, or feedback you may have.

No two individuals will have the same news feed which speaks to the level of personalization made possible by the AI technology that powers this app.
Recommendations Improve Over Time
Within a short period of time of using the app, you will notice that the app can “read your mind” by suggesting articles to read. The app will adapt to your ever-changing interests so that you will always be reading relevant content. Oh, and did we mention that this is all done automatically?
Summaries to Save You Time


Struggling to keep up with all of the news in this fast-paced world of ours? You can read concise summaries of articles to save you time. We know your time is valuable. Our summaries will help you decide if an entire article is worth reading by giving you the main ideas of the content in only a few short sentences.  
News Without Limits

Offers much more than the traditional source listing of most tablet and mobile readers. Find news from any niche on the Internet, no matter how small. Gnow.it brings content from thousands of categories from across the web into the palm of your hand, even from sources that you have never seen before.



*concept image of the app


*concept image

For the Niche. For the Masses. For You
Find news from any niche on the Internet, no matter how small or quirky. Gnow.it offers much more content than the traditional source listing of most tablet and mobile readers. The app will come pre­loaded with common topics such as Politics, Technology, or Business to name a few. Gnow.it will also give you access to thousands of categories for you to choose from. 
These categories can range from the downright particular (quantum physics, Nicholas Cage memes, piano-playing cats…) to the everyday - and everything in between. 
 

 *concept image
Artificial intelligence powered reading
Struggling to keep up with news within this fast paced world? Read summaries to save time. Get your information at a glance without having to read entire articles. Information overload will be a thing of the past. 

We've married content, design and speed.  All three agreed.
No need to worry about loading times anymore to read your news. The app will even work on 2G speeds. Our team has made it a priority to make this app fast and not be bogged down by slow loading images.

*concept image 
Be a good friend - the interesting, smart kind.
Alongside saving your favourite articles you can also share anything interesting you find with your social networks. Don't get unfriended by suggesting stale content ever again*. 
*Gnow.it cannot guarantee that this will never happen to you.
 
         
*concept image 
The Perks?
Our app is still in development which means that many features can be modified before our worldwide launch. This includes everything from the user interface to the top 12 categories of news featured on the home screen and everything in between (see Like a Boss perk).
Anyone who opts in for the “First in the World” or “Pioneer” perk will be given the opportunity to get early access to the pre­launch versions of Gnow.it. This allows you to give us your feedback on what changes can be made to every aspect of the app. Your valuable input during both alpha and beta testing will lead to a higher quality version of Gnow.it, a version far better than anything our team could accomplish on its own. You can help decide how the app will turn out. Come on, join the team! 
The Boss and The Chosen One perks will get you this exclusive t-shirt design that will ONLY be available to Indiegogo contributors.

   
                                           
 
Our Team
We have an awesome team with decades of collective experience working at Mediagator, the company behind this app and campaign.  We have one of the foremost thinkers in natural language processing (NLP) and AI working on the team. We also have a development team that has helped to launch a major news monitoring alternative based on artificial intelligence.
The funds you contribute will enable us to finish the development of Gnow.it by bringing it to your smartphone before the end of 2013.
 
The Team in the News:
Techvibes: http://www.techvibes.com/blog/canadian-startup-gnowit-tackle...
Crowdfundinsider: http://www.crowdfundinsider.com/2013/07/19241-crowdf...
Crowdfundingguide: http://www.crowdfundingguide.com/project-launch-aler...
 
FAQ
1. Will the app be free when it is officially released?  
The app will be free to download when it is completed.
2. In what order of operating systems will the app launch?
The launch of our app will be for both Blackberry and Android. Don’t worry Mac-o-philes, we have a plan to develop for iOS as well.
3. Are there not other apps that have the same personalization features?
There are similar apps that offer personalization but they require manual inputs in order for the app to start recommending articles for you to read. Gnow.it does this automatically without having you to think about it at all.
4. How did you come up with the name?
The core feature of this news reading app is to personalize your reading experience on a mobile device. For an app to offer any form of personalization, it must first get to know you. Based on this premise we decided to give it the name Gnow.it. This is meant to illustrate that the app can learn to "know" what content interests you in order to bring you the news that truly matters to you.  Look, we thought we hit the “K” key, but slipped and hit the “G” instead.  We’ve stuck with it because we’re loyal.
 
Press Tools
Visit www.gnow.it/media
 
Questions?
Email us at hello@mediagator.ca for any questions, suggestions, or feedback you may have.

story:
*** UPDATE: The dog has now been claimed for naming! Four additional
             character namings are still up for grabs, though! ***

Hi, friends and fans!

Question: Would you buy me a drink? If your answer is Heck yeah, buddy! then please consider supporting my creative work by pre-ordering my book instead. It's not like my liver needs more booze to contend with. ;)

Need more incentive? How about this:

For every pledge received, $1 will go to the Capital Area Humane Society in Columbus, Ohio. For all monies raised beyond the $2,000 mark, I will donate 50% of the proceeds to help local animals in need! Thanks, CAHS, for partnering with me!

Read on to find out more about the book and this Indiegogo campaign.

Modogamous: What's the book all about?

Boy meets Girl. Boy and Girl screw it up.

Girl meets New Boy. Boy meets New Girl.

New Girl meets New Boy.

…and then things start to get complicated.

Relationships, bah! Wouldn’t it just be easier to get a dog?

You can read an excerpt from the book here. 

Expected publication date is Late Summer 2013!

Why did I write this the book?

I love to read, and I love to write. In fact, I write for a living. Most of the time, I write "work for hire," which means someone pays for my writing and then they own the rights to it. That's okay with me - after all, I get to work from home in my pajamas, and I get paid to do something I love. 

But over the years, I've probably fielded the question, "So, when are you going to write your own book?" about a hundred thousand times. 2012 was the year I decided to tackle that goal, thanks to an unexpected break in my schedule and an insane writing competition, NaNoWriMo. As for the genre I chose (chicklit), well, I write serious stuff all the time for work, and I just wanted to write something light and fun for a change.

Writing a book has been exciting; it has been exhausting; it has been one helluva ride.

And now I'm in the home stretch - phew!

What's the money for?

Everybody has a hobby or two. My passion for the past nine months has been writing this novel. Like many hobbies, I've sunk some money into my little labor of love (and have a bit more to spend before the publication process is through). So far I've spent about $1,100 on various costs (artwork, cover design, writing software, online and print resources, admin services, etc.), and I expect to spend another $600-800 before the publication process is finished (book formatting for print and digital, more needed design work, and the fees for this Indiegogo campaign, among other things). 

That breaks down to just about $2,000. That number doesn't include compensation for the time I spent writing the novel - upwards of 300 hours at this point. (And at minimum wage, that figure would be $2,175!)

Maybe someday I'll make a little money from the book, I dunno, but for now I'd be delighted just to break even. If I don't, though, that's okay. As I said, everybody puts their money into the pursuits that excite them. And it's been a great learning experience, so no matter how things turn out, it's been worth it.

What's in it for you?

Well, hopefully, an entertaining read that you'll enjoy when you steal away for a little leisure time in your favorite reading nook! But beyond that, your pledge will:

  • raise money to benefit animals in the Columbus, Ohio area. The mission of the Capital Area Humane Society is to fight animal cruelty, help animals in need and advocate for their well-being.
  • help me achieve a goal that's been on my bucket list for a long, long time: writing a novel of my own.
  • earn you some great perks, from beautiful artwork to the opportunity to name a character in the book after anyone you please ~ including yourself!

In additional, ALL contributors will be invited to a special
Book Launch Party (date & time TBD) in Columbus, Ohio!

Hey, want to raise MORE cash to help out animals in need?

Write a review of the book on Amazon or GoodReads and I'll donate an additional $1 to a local pet shelter here in Columbus, Ohio. I don't care if the review is good, bad, or ugly, just so long as it's honest & says something meaningful about the book. I'll post the amount of money raised online, and I'll link back to the reviews you wrote, too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can’t contribute right now. That's okay, I get it. (As a writer, I've been there myself sometimes!) There are still other ways that you can help.

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about this campaign! 
  • Like my page on FB, follow me on Twitter, or subscribe to my blog. I appreciate hearing from my friends and fans, whether they're "buyers" or not.

Thank you all for your support and encouragement. (And the animals thank you, too!) 

~Karen

P.S.  Special thanks goes out to the crew of talented ladies who have helped me get the book this far: Sara Adrian (artist), Cindy Patterson (cover design), Liezl Schewe (Editorial Team), and Karen Maheu (Editorial Team). You guys rock!!!

---------

The Fine Print (AKA Terms and Conditions):

E-book formats will be available for Kindle, iPad, Nook, Sony Reader, and more. 

The Scooby Snack perk:  Books include:
Unfinished Business, by Carolyn Ridder Aspenson (Chick Lit/Paranormal; mobi/ePub)
Through the Eyes of the Heart, by Lisa Leon (Spirituality/Angels; PDF)
Alpha, Omega, by Lori Stephens (Mystery/Suspense; PDF)
The Dragon Incident, by Bethany Maines (Fantasy/Mystery/Adventure; PDF/mobi)
Vice and Vengeance, by Dennis Zingrang (Crime Fiction; PDF)
Hot Property (sneak peek!), by Susanne O'Leary (Contemporary Romance; PDF)
Dream Student (Book 1), by J.J. DiBenedetto (Paranormal Romance/Suspense; PDF/mobi)
Fast Cash: Selling Used Items for Profit, by Eric Michael (Business/Sales; PDF)
Alpha's Mate, by Caryn Moya Block (Paranormal Romance; multiple formats)
A Born Victim, by R.P. Rochford (Thriller/Technothriller; PDF/ePub)
Undisclosed Desire, by M. Peters (Gay Paranormal Romance; PDF)
Scruffy Trainers, by Louise Wise (Short Stories; PDF)

See full details on each book in the Gallery section!

Character naming is subject to approval; name chosen must be reasonable for the character; money will be refunded if the requested name is unable to be approved. Character namings are first-come, first-served; there are only 5 characters to be named, after which the option will no longer be available. More info on lead characters available from the author by email or phone. Contact me at info@karenemartin.com if you have any questions.

Reviews must be posted within 30 days of the official publication of the book to qualify for donations. After you've posted your review, kindly email me at info@karenemartin.com with a link to your review so I can keep track of the donation requests more easily.

Authors Only perk:  Promotional materials submitted will be reviewed for content; inappropriate images, language, and so on will be rejected. Promos will be at the end of the e-book and the beginning of the paperback version. I'm also happy to feature your work on my blog, at your request. Authors must submit promotional materials within a reasonable timeframe in order for them to be included in the publications. Contact me at info@karenemartin.com and we can work out a timeframe.

Terms are subject to change.

story:
Quick synopsis:


Almost 100 years after the Raconii wars, Fear has returned to the Northern Continent. Tetra, a world split in two, is on the brink of war, and everywhere the signs point to the end of life as it is known.

However, to one man, there is only one crisis happening. Protecting a girl he found lost in the woods with no memory. Filled with action, romance, adventure, and fantastical bounds, this is a tale to enjoy with a cup of tea.


"Hey I was able to read some of your story and it's pretty cool so far. I love how I can picture what's going on, it's easy to visualize!" -- Jennifer Roger

"I'll buy it when it's done." -- Toria White

If you want a small sample, there is one included in the gallery, so please take a look.

 

Short Summary:

I started writing this story my junior year of high school. That was 6 years ago. It didn't take off till my senior year. For inspiration, I used Tolkien, Chris Bunch, and Lodoss War. The entire reason it isn't finished is partially due to a lazy bug. I lost a lot of what I had written a few years back when I lost my pc, but I resumed writing recently and finished the first half. The second half is what this indiegogo is for. I plan on finishing it and publishing a full fledged book by June. All I need is help. That is where you come in.

What We Need & What You Get

Basically this is how it breaks down:

  • The larger portion is going towards paying for publishing (including everyone's contribution gift), while the smaller portion is to help pay rent while I write the book.
  • Perks include free copies of part 1, physical copies of the book (signed!) and what I call Punch the author! (You get to criticize as I write part 2, and tell me things that need fixed in part 1)
  • If I don't reach the full goal, all funds will be saved until I can afford the publishing, but only Ebooks will be able to be given away. The weekly changes and punch me in the face parts will still apply though. Just ebooks instead of physical copies.

Don't worry about international shipping, I'll cover it by the way. If you feel generous, you can cover it yourself.

If your broke:

Please help spread the word.

 

Stretch goals:

These are simple:

At 3000, EVERYONE who gives more than 10 USD will get a physical copy. Also, this makes part 1 free (because it's only the first half)

At 3500, I will make tshirts for everyone who gives more than 15 USD

At 4000, I will throw a launch party inviting everyone who gives more than 20 USD, where they can pick up their copies of the book as well.

At 5000, well I don't know at that point, but I doubt I'll get that high. If I do, I'll post a youtube video of me doing stupid stuff people ask me to do that contributed. (Oh and everyone who contributes gets a physical copy and t-shirt.)

 

Big Update

If I meet the goal, I will also turn the story into an interactive fiction game. If I get 500 over the goal, it will be a Visual Novel made with RenPy. The game will be on WIN/Mac/Lin. As a thank you, all backers would get a copy of the game, which will be made available after the book.

story:
HI guys,
Hope you are all well.. 

You all know that I have a passion to share with Children that they are not a mistake, that they are wanted and Loved by God. That is why I wrote the book "Three little lights". My heart has always been for everyone to know that their father in Heaven loves them, especially children. How different would our world look if we all had the un-shaking confidence we are wanted, loved and are not a mistake! 
I am writing this to you because for my birthday in June I wanted to do something really special. recently I had the book translated into spanish and I had a desire to send it to children's homes and children's pastors in South America! So that is what I am writing to you about. I need to raise the money to have the books printed up and then sent to two places in South America. two amazing opportunities have opened up where by they would like my book.

The first is a children's home in Mexico - A ministry that our church is heavily involved with. "Rancho de sus ninos" was founded by the Horner family in Tijunana. They have a after school program, a children's home, and go into local schools to minister to the children among other things. They have requested 350 books be sent for their younger school aged children. 

Here is their website for more information: http://ranchodesusninos.org/?AspxAutoDetectCook...


The second is an equally amazing opportunity to reach an entire nation for God! The beautiful country of Honduras is having a national holiday on July 20th. The president has given his authorization where doctors and other medical professions, along with missionaries go to every province, every town and village in a crusade for the entire country and preach the gospel.
here is a captivating video that will explain the vision:

http://www.1nation1day.com/vision

An entire nation can be reached in one day with the Love of God. My heart is that on that day the children's ministry all across the country will have the gift of my book to read and hear the message that they are wanted and loved by God. 

I need your help! I am funding this all by myself! As a single mom & living off child support, at this point there is no way I can do this alone. That is why I am asking for your help.Help me make this a birthday to give to God and make heaven smile!

My book campaign is going to be set up on indiegogo here: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/books-for-the...

Every single dollar raised will go directly to print each book at cost which in tern goes directly to sending the books to the children's home in Mexico AND to my friend who is involved in the 1 nation 1 day campaign. I make no money from this.

I am trying to finalize the printing costs of each book as we speak, but it looks like each little book could cost $2-$3 each. As many books as I can raise the money for would be awesome! Please would you consider contributing to my campaign?

My goal is to raise $3000 at least. If you can imagine in Honduras alone there could be up to 10,000 children's pastors wanting this little book for their church. so I want to beat my goal!

Please help me reach my goal!!
Many Thanks

Lizzie Gan 


Here is the story behind WHY I wrote this book.. It comes from my heart!

Enjoy

The idea for the book came from two inspirations.

 

One day I was sitting in my living room with my roommate at the time and we were praying and talking. In the middle of our prayer time I started thinking about how every child is a gift from God no matter what the circumstances of their conception or birth were. I happened to open my mouth and say it out loud and as I did, my roommate said that a pastor once told her that because she was conceived out of marriage, she did not have the same covering that her other siblings had, as they were born inside the marriage. Well that sounded just plain stupid to me, so I asked God about it, and again he repeated the idea that Children were HIS idea. And that no child is a mistake or an accident. No child is surprise to him and no matter what the circumstances of their conception, they are wanted.

 

 

The second thing that made me start thinking about this subject happened was a year of so after. It was christmas time! God knows my love language is gifts, so he asked me one night what I would like for Christmas. I told him that I wanted a story from him as a gift. Something that I could share with people and that it would change the world, and something for children. God instead of giving me a gift in the usual sense started going after a unknown forgtten area of my heart. As I sat by the fire with God, he started to point out areas in my childhood where I told that I was a huge mistake, and that I was not wanted etc. Those phrases again and again came out of my mouth and it hurt deeply. I realized that I had thought most of my life due to circumstances, that I was a mistake, that I was a annoyance and not really wanted. In the midst of this flashback, Father God appeared in the middle of a scene from my childhood where I was being told those very things. Just his mere presence in the midst of the pain showed me that in fact I was not alone in the midst of that and that he did not agree with the way I was being treated.  Again he reiterated that ‘no child was a mistake’, that everyone was planned for and wanted, and that they were all a twinkle in his eye before time began. I started to heal a little as I sat there praying through some of those things that were being shown to me.  As I got to the end, I went into a vision where by Father God told me a story about "3 little lights". These three lights had a naming ceremony where by Father God called them out of his heart and named them, prophesying over them, and after he sends them to earth to be born. 

 

The story developed from there and it felt like together Father God and I wrote it together as we sat by the fire. While God was healing my heart, he had created a story that would touch others lives too. As I let the truth settle in, the story became part of my little bit of healing and I so wanted other children to know the truth too. I immediately started writing it with God. Within a few hours I had written it all out and had started drawing the artwork out for the book. It was sort of my Christmas present from God! The following Christmas, I got to give it back to him and present him with the gift of a finished book.

 

I feel like this book is extremely important for right now. In a time where abortions are such a prevalent theme, the respect for life and especially a child’s life has not been given as it should be. Children need to know that no matter where they are born, what situation they are born into, or what happens to them in their lives, that they are originally and lovingly Gods idea. They need to know that they are important, and that just because they are small it does not disqualify them in Gods eyes. 

 

What if a generation of children were brought up knowing that they are wanted, that they have the confidence to not entertain the negative thoughts that the world bombards them with. What if when a lie that raises it head says “You are a mistake, you are not wanted..” and they respond with Love and cut down the lie immediately and is unshaken by it? What if they can see and understand Father Gods Love for them from an early stage and have a respect for ‘life’ and other children? What if one child grows up with the unshakable knowledge of how much they are loved and that person goes on to change the world?  What if?...

There has to be a shift in this world. We cannot carry on and parent or bring up, or teach children the way we have always done. I believe that now is the time to have respect for the life of a child. It is a time to fully grasp the idea that we are all Gods idea, that we are all an answer to prayer in some way or another.

 

I don’t think that children have been given enough respect in this world. If you look back at the way people have parented from the very beginning, there are periods where the world has treated them as second class citizens or even worse, expendable, or even worse then slaves etc. looking through literature like Charles Dickens, Jane Austen, and countless others have given us a glimpse at how children are treated in years gone by. Somehow people forget that those little people that are mistreated or hurt, grow up to be adults who can hurt in bigger ways if the cycle is not cut.  “It is easier to grow strong children then to mend a broken man” said Fredrick Douglas, it is gravely true. If we turn our focus on receiving the full Love of the Father, to pour into healthy loved children then I believe the world would be a different place. Bullies would not exist, hatred would lessen, respect and acceptance would be found in everyone’s lives. Orphans would know without a shadow of a doubt, that they are loved and have a father who wants them. And from there they can change the world.

 

This book is dedicated to the little ones who need to know that they are not a mistake, that they are wanted and loved, that they were planned for and foreseen and that they were Gods idea first. That every life is an answer to prayer, that he never holds the circumstances of your conception or birth against you, no matter what man may say or do. And that, as God has respect for free will and life, he respects your life.

 

Liz Gan

story:
PLEASE VIEW THE MINI MUSIC-VIDEO/AUTHOR INTERVIEW in the "Gallery" section... highlighting original music and animation!  As well, check the Gallery for a video of me howling at the moon!

In the town of Wolf's Wood... Love changes your life from that of a normal human existence to hunting meat on all fours by moonlight.  

She's not a witch, or faerie, or a fragile, enlightened being of any sort... she doesn't cower in the woods, hiding from the monster... Raven is a monster... the kind with curves, a sharp tongue, and even sharper teeth.  He's the Sheriff of a modern-day Brigadoon... its inhabitants on the verge of extinction.  Does Sheriff Boyd keep the peace over the last days of a clan of werewolves... or does he oversee the greatest expansion of the pack since the Dark Ages?

I am completing the novel, Raven In A Wolf's Wood, and writing the adapted screenplay in its entirety all in one six-month period!  I have the first ten chapters written, but to complete the first part of what will eventually make up a trilogy... and promote its release... I need YOUR HELP.

Help me satiate the lust for life of these bloody "moon runners" by contributing to my campaign and sharing it with others... and help this screenwriter achieve his dream of defining THE modern American werewolf tale.

Upon completion of both the novel and screenplay, a pr campaign will commence, the novel will be published as an ebook, and my agent will  submit both of these to Hollywood studios for option consideration... I also envisage an xbox presence for you gamers out there!  And when the movie is made in partnership with my own producing partners at THEM...

 

... the premiere party will be well-stocked with the beer of my talented Acadiana Friends at BAYOU TECHE BIERE down in Arnauldville, Louisiana... for they are devising a Loup Garou (Cajun for werewolf) Stout... "dark as a moonless night...

...brewed with a lot of chocolate malts..." 

 

For any of you who have tackled the writing of a novel, you will know it is a labour of love.  It is also a process that requires one to live in the world one is creating.  This takes time and money.  No, I am not going to don a fur coat and start biting people up and down Hollywood Blvd... that job is already taken.  Read on and check back regularly for updates...

Here's a little about me:

As well as being a novelist, I have a television development deal with Insight Productions under my belt, and my screenplays have garnered interest from NBC/Universal and Fremantle International Distribution. I am currently developing a serialized cop-drama pilot with a production company in Hollywood. 

I'm a graduate of LAMDA in the UK and have acted in such films as Saving Private Ryan, The Patriot, and Four Minutes, as well as played guest-starring and recurring roles on numerous television series.  I was Co-Executive Producer of the feature rock doc, Saturday Night at Morley Gibson’s, an official selection of the Calgary Intl Film Festival.

I am proud to be a voting member of the British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA), and a member of the Writers Guild.

 

What You GET:

Whether it's the BUMPER STICKER 

-or-

The Raven In A Wolf's Wood T-SHIRT (small, medium or large).

      

                Front                             Back ($50 option)

-or-

The Gingerbread  Doghouse for the little werewolf in your life this Christmas 2013... designed by the award-winning, THE GINGERBREAD LADIES

-or-

SIGNED COPY OF THE NOVEL or A CHARACTER IN THE NOVEL NAMED AFTER YOU

-or-

a PDF copy of the EARLY CHAPTERS that tell the story BEFORE Raven's first dramatic turning into what she was always destined to become... emailed straight to your inbox within hours of your contribution. (**Note: you can email me at raveninawolfswood@outlook.com , and I will hit reply with the chapters, or I will check my indiegogo dashboard for your email address at the end of the day and email the chaps to you then.)

.... Whatever takes your fancy, there are great perks to choose from if you just look to your right!

 

What I NEED: 

After Indiegogo's fees/cut of the achieved budget ($1400), here is how it all breaks down:

1. Right off the bat, $6,000 gets set aside for contributor perks:

  • Bumper Stickers
  • T-Shirts
  • Wolf (dog)houses
  • Printed Novels
  • Postage and packaging (both domestic and intl.)
  • Hollywood Trip

2. Editing of the Novel (approx. $1,000).

3. Marketing costs (approx. $5,600):

  • social media/online marketing/print pr campaign
  • website creation/hosting
  • obtaining ISBN number
  • novel submitted to Amazon and other online book sale sites
  • Indie bookstore signings in L.A., Toronto and NYC (I have chosen these cities as I live in one place and have a couch to crash on in the other two... so it is just cheap flight and food costs.)
  • submission of novel for reviews in U.S. and Canada

4. Funds to cover my own writing time, research, admin expenses to complete novel and screenplay (approx.$6,000 - $1,000 a month) in the allotted 6 months.

 *If I am unable to obtain my full financial goal, items 3 and 4 would need to be scaled back.  Hopefully, it will not come to that.  If I raise more than my goal, I will expand the pr campaign reach considerably.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please TELL YOUR FRIENDS about my campaign.  A $5(first five chapters) pdf attachment makes an excellent little gift for the special reader in anyone's life to open on their lunch break.

Please use the SHARE TOOLS on Indiegogo to spread the word that RAVEN is on the prowl.  

POST, TWEET, EMAIL... all efforts greatly appreciated!  Just type -

igg.me/at/raven-in-a-wolfs-wood

I also wish to give a big shout out to: 

for their most excellent design and animation work 

-and- 

 

for the use of my new favourite song, "Left Behind", in the promo video (Yes,  the band will be featured on the soundtrack of any resulting film!)

 

SYNOPSIS of NOVEL

Raven
In A Wolf’s Wood
A novel by Grahame Wood

The Earth has teeth,
And it eats us all in time.

Almost two decades have passed since Raven Shilling witnessed the brutal abduction of her parents – not with her eyes, but with her ears.

Years of therapy couldn’t erase the hair-raising howls that invade her dreams on a nightly basis.

Now in her 20’s, Raven returns to the site of her parents’ disappearance - not to search for the bodies that were never found, but to film a low-budget, Hollywood horror movie in the remote hills above Wolf Woods, British Columbia.

Soon after shooting begins, one of the actors is found torn to pieces in the back alley of a seedy hotel. The townsfolk are quick to pass it off as a random bear attack. But that doesn't explain the naked girl seen running away from the body.

The locals are covering up a sinister truth. Raven is certain of it. She can feel it… literally. Her senses have never been so alive… so primal. It’s as though her soul is drawn to this place. And the howls in her mind are sounding more and more like voices… calling to her.

Yet Raven couldn’t have begun to imagine the scale of the terrible and astonishing truth behind her parents’ demise… nor the emergence of the monster within she must inevitably claim as a birth rite.

Raven in a Wolf’s Wood is the first instalment of a modern American werewolf trilogy where fur and fangs are a sexually transmitted disease. Story to be continued in Escape from Wolf Woods and concluded in A Conspiracy of Wolves.

story:
Short Summary

The Occidental slam team is a group of five students that qualified for the Oxy slam team in Nov. 2012, and who have been training to perform and compete at the College Unions Poetry Slam Invitational (CUPSI) in April. The competition is an annual one that invites college students from all over the country to connect, write, and perform poetry with each other; this year, Barnard College in New York is hosting the competition, and we need to raise money so that we can be a part of this amazing event!

"What's a slam?", you say? A poetry slam is a competitive poetry competition started in the 80s by March "So What" Smith in Chicago. At poetry slams, poets get up in front of an audience, perform their original 3-minute-long poems without the help of props or music, and get scored Olympic-style (on a scale of 1 to 10) by five judges, who are usually randomly selected from the audience. The audience is encouraged to respond, and slams often end up being a magical combination of church and comedy club, where poets share intimate secrets and stories that help individuals come together and connect as a community. 

Read more about CUPSI here: http://www.acui.org/programs/student/program.as...

What We Need & What You Get

Between the costs of airfare and lodging, our five poets (plus our amazing student coach) will need to raise about $2,000 in total. You can help!

A $5 donation gets you a candy gram to you or the sweetheart of your choice with an original haiku attached. (We can mail these if you're long-distance!)

A $10 donation gets you a hard copy of an Oxy poem performed at CUPSI, plus a signed picture of the team.

A $50 donation gets you a hard copy of an Oxy poem, a program from CUPSI 2013, plus a signed picture of the team.

A $100 donation gets you a souvenir from NYC, a hard copy of an Oxy poem, a program from CUPSI 2013, plus a signed picture of the team.

A $200 donation gets you an original group poem written in your honor (with a hard copy and recorded version), a souvenir from NYC, a hard copy of an Oxy poem, a program from CUPSI 2013, plus a signed picture of the team.

The Impact

CUPSI is an amazing, life-changing experience and if we go, we will be improved as artists and as human beings. In addition, we will be able to take critical concepts that we learn there (about social justice, identity, and community) and bring it back to the Oxy campus, thus benefitting all students that attend our school.

Last year, we beat teams such as Harvard and Dartmouth -- help us prove our mettle again this year!

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word! Please share this page with others.

story:
Simon Morrell is one of the United Kingdom’s leading Martial Artists and Inspirational Speakers but it hasn’t always been this way and his success has been hard come by. As a young child he was badly bullied which grew into violent assaults as he approached early adulthood. An attempted stabbing took place by a vicious youth during a particularly frightening period and further beatings followed. Simon became agoraphobic and suffered from life changing panic attacks before deciding he had endured enough. He entered the world of Martial Arts to gain confidence and quickly surprised himself and his loved ones by excelling in it. Today he holds multiple Black Belts including 6th Dan Karate and Dan Grade Krav Maga as well as being a two time Hall of Fame winner. He speaks around the country about his troubles and victories and his story is currently being made into the film Fight Back in the USA. He has spoken in the International Press and on the BBC about his experiences and is currently.

He has now been asked to travel to the USA to speak about the book on television as well as major magazines, and to tour American dojos, speaking to youngsters about the perils of bullying, the suffering it causes and to inspire, showing that there is an answer, there is light at the end of the tunnel. He hopes his story will give victims the inspiration and courage to overcome their problems and lead a healthy and happy life.


How the Funds Are Used.

All the funds used will go toward travel expenses and accommodation for Simon's trip the U.S.A. Aside from the expenses none of the funds raised will be used for Simon's personal benefit. Any excess funds raised will be put back into the promotion of From Bullied to Black Belt to raise awareness of the terrible worldwide bullying problem.

The Impact.

The positive impact of Simon's visit is that it will bring to the public's eyes the awful consequence bullying has on people. With the limited resources Simon has, he has already made a big impact in the U.K. and New York Publicist Bruce Lynn says this "I am confident given the perpetual outbreak of bullying incidents here (U.S.A.) that Mr. Morrell's intriguing efforts to thwart this tide will be of great interest".

It is Simon's great hope to talk to youngsters (and adults) throughout the States to help them break their 'victim mode' through positivity, confidence building and raising self esteem.

Risks & Challenges.

Whilst Simon has had success in the United Kingdom with his programs and a limited success in the States, America is still very new to Simon and his ideas. The country has produced some fine Martial Artists and Anti-Bullying Advocates but we believe nobody has suffered bullying to the level Simon has and then be able to come back with such a high level of success, going toward a different pole from the frightened youth he was.

He maintains a compassionate stance towards victims, identifying with them and helping to realistically address their problems and whilst he acknowledges the task ahead of him, supported by his family with a great work ethic, he truly believes he can make a difference

Other Ways You Can Help.

Of course we would be most grateful if you could contribute financially but in these tough times, we understand not everyone can. However instead if you are able to help spread word of Simon's mission we would be most appreciative. Ways you can do this are to post on your Facebook wall, tweet on Twitter, tell all your family and friends and use any media outlet at your disposal. You can follow Simon on Twitter ( @simonmorrell ) or befriend him on Facebook (Simon Morrell) and like his page to help us gain momentum.

story:
Hi, I’m Deirdre.

As a kid, I was given a globe, and I was fascinated by it. I kept imagining that I would go to all these wonderful places, especially the islands where all the lettering squished together on the globe. Or weird places like Ifni, which was on my globe and existed for only 11 years as a separate province.

For years, I traveled for business only, and I was able to travel to several continents. I wanted to travel for pleasure and had a long list of places I wanted to visit, but no real idea of how to make things happen. So many places to go. So many things to see. Learn how to reduce the possibilities to a manageable list, then how to plan your trips.

Then, earlier this year, I had a once-in-a-lifetime trip planned. Eight days before I was due to leave, I had a wrench thrown in my plans and had to either a) scrap the trip entirely, b) have it suddenly cost thousands of unplanned dollars more; or c) change my trip so fundamentally that it no longer resembled what I originally planned. Learn coping strategies for adversity.

It’s a big world. Let me help you get out there.

My Background

While I’ve primarily been a software engineer most of my life, most recently at Apple, I’ve also worked in the travel industry.

For (now defunct, but not my fault) Eastern Airlines, I was a reservationist with the group booking desk, planning trips for the Caribbean and northern South America. You can see an old Eastern Airlines route map here.

I’ve also worked in several capacities on several cruise lines, mostly Premier Cruise Lines (also now defunct, but also not my fault), from purser to medical records consultant to computer consultant–also mostly in the Caribbean.

More recently, I worked in reservations at (the still existing, yay) Classic Vacations, the luxury division of Expedia. Like everyone, I started on the Hawaii desk, booking custom air-and-hotel packages for travel agents’ clients. Then I expanded to the other locations they had at the time: Mexico, Canada, Caribbean, and Europe. Eventually, I worked in product development as a product administrator, specializing in Turkey and Western Canada.

Here’s a map of my travels in 2013. (233,863 km or 145,316 miles)

As a traveler, I’ve been to 61 countries as recognized by the United Nations, or 88 countries and territories as recognized by the rather-more-liberal Traveler’s Century Club. I’ve been around the world twice. After I failed to go around the world twice. I’ve visited six of the seven continents, five of them more than once.

All of which is a long-winded way of saying: I get this. This isn’t yet another Indiegogo campaign about someone wanting to fund their first trip to Europe.

I’ve delivered sixteen published books on time. In my past, I wrote twelve short adult western novels under pseudonyms. I have published four technical books through Que and Sams, and had a daily column of Linux tips for Earth Web in 1999.

The Calendar (and its pictures)

I also occasionally take decent photos, as you can see from the calendar here.

Note About Postcard Perks

Physical postcards can, unfortunately, take a long time to deliver. I always send myself a postcard at the same time as I mail them to others. When I sent postcards in early April from the Maldives, I received them in July. That’s unusual, but three to four weeks is not unusual.

There’s also a special case for Pitcairn: a) it’s one of the most remote islands in the world with very limited shipping to and from the island; b) there’s always the possibility we won’t be able to go ashore at all. Pitcairn has no airport and no harbor and is one of the most isolated places people live on Earth.

Because of delays in delivery, I’m also offering a virtual postcard, by which I mean a pretty photo I took at the location in question, e-mailed either from the location (available bandwidth permitting) or shortly thereafter, using a postcard application on my iPhone.

I’ll also take photos of the fronts and backs of postcards I send.

Why I Need Your Help

There are a bunch of other software engineers in the world, but there aren’t that many people who could–or would–write this book.

Historically, I can’t do significant amounts of writing at the same time as I’m doing software development. It uses too much of the same mental processes, unfortunately. In order to get this book written, I need to spend my time writing the book, not doing other things like looking for software engineering contracts or learning or refreshing existing skills. I need to turn down or delay other work in order for this book to happen.

Additionally, I’ve recently written part of a novel draft. The idea, synopsis, and opening was strong enough that I won $150 (2nd place) at a writer’s conference and was asked for a full manuscript (rare) by an agent at that conference. Story here. So I’d be putting this project on hold, too. The reality of traditional publishing timelines is such that it's not particularly likely this book would provide income in 2014.

I’ll have expenses for software (updating InDesign) to produce the physical books, as well as expenses related to cover design and editing services. Ideally, I’d like to get my camera repaired.

I have two (already paid for) trips coming up where I’ll be able to talk to people who are even better traveled than I am. We’ll be on a segment (partial) world cruise. I’ve been trying to get on one of these my whole life, and this is an opportunity to write about it.

After It’s Over

Once my hand recovers from all the typing and signing….

My plan is to continue to self-publish So You Want to Travel the World in both electronic and paper form, then go on to publish the occasional travel journey as a separate short book.

story:
Dear Friends, 

Thanks to your contributions we manage to collect the necessary amount to accomplish the project!

Now, when there is still time till the end of the campaign - we are looking forward to collect more funds - for another collection of H. Tumanyan's tales - in Western Armenian!


History:

“Tumanyan to Every iPad” Project

In the age of the high technologies eBooks are a new way of introducing Armenian literary heritage, both the works of classical and contemporary authors, making them available to Armenians worldwide.

Armenian eBooks Initiative (www.armenianebooks.com), launched in November 2012, managed to create a collection of more than forty digitalized books. Through the initiative, Armenian electronic books are now available in the whole coverage of Apple iBookstore and Google Play – in more than 50 countries, through iPhones, iPads and various eBook Readers. We present the Armenian literature in a new, entertaining and interactive way. Our eBook series vary from Ghazaros Aghayan’s and Khnko Aper‘s fairy tales and fables to the works of Hakop Paronean, Vahan Teryan and Yeghishe Charents.

This time Armenian eBooks Initiative is looking for a financial support to digitize and 7 illustrated books of Armenian prominent writer Hovhannes Tumanyan.

The outcome of the project will be a fully illustrated collection of the tales by Hovhannes Tumanyan (in Armenian), available for free on Apple iTunes. The amount of money needed for the whole process is 1250 USD, which includes digitization, proofreading, editing, design and illustration of the selected books + bank fees, transfer fees and taxes.

Thanks to Your financial support, it will be possible to download famous works of the writer for free and bring Armenian literary heritage to the Armenians residing outside the Homeland.

Find the list of the proposed books below:

1. Բարեկենդանը,

2. Սուտլիկ Որսկանը,

3. Ձախորդ Փանոսը,

4. Տերն ու ծառան,

5. Կիկոսի մահը

6. Չարի վերջը,

7.Մի կաթիլ մեղրը:
