story:
Averly se muere

Averly es una empresa con más de un siglo y medio de vida que tuvo que cerrar a causa de la crisis. Los propietarios se vieron obligaros a vender antes de ser subastados y el nuevo propietario (una constructora) quieren derribar esta joya del patrimonio industrial para construir 200 pisos.

Hemos intentado desde la Plataforma Salvemos Averly (quien ha creado esta campaña) que sea salvada por el Gobierno de Aragón, debido a su alto interés patrimonial, pero lo único que está primando en este caso es, como siempre, el dinero y los intereses de la constructora.

Necesitamos 5000€ para entablar un contencioso contra el Gobierno de Aragón que obligue a los responsables a responder ante un juez de su interés por destruir Averly en vez de salvarlo. Este conjunto está incluido dentro de la lista de los 100 Elementos del Patrimonio Industrial Español, por lo que no es algo que sólo afecta a Zaragoza, sino al patrimonio de todos los españoles.


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Hemos iniciado esta campaña de recogida de fondos para poder pagar las tasas, procuradores y demás gastos precisos para llevar adelante la demanda. Todos los gastos serán debidamente justificados ante quienes colaboren con nosotros por medio de esta página.

En caso de sobrepasar la cantidad precisa o que el gasto sea menor, se entregará el resto del dinero a alguna asociación estatal de protección del patrimonio.

En caso de no llegar a la cantidad precisa, se pagarán los gastos de las recompensas, que serán enviadas a todo el mundo y lo sobrante será entregado a alguna asociación estatal de protección del patrimonio.


Recompensas

  • Cualquier ayuda es buena, desde 1 €. Con la ayuda de todos podremos ir logrando más fondos.
  • Si realmente quieres marcar la diferencia, a partir de 5 € puedes conseguir un lote de 6 postales de Averly, mostradas a continuación. (Además de la foto de cabecera)


  •  A partir de 25 €, las postales incluyen una visita guiada para una persona a alguna de las propuestas por Gozarte y que esté disponible en la fecha deseada.
        La visita se concertará con la empresa previamente y se reservará la plaza.

  • La recompensa de 60 € incluye una fotografía a tamaño 40x50cm impresa en alta calidad y montada sobre cartón pluma. Fotografías realizadas por Carlos Blázquez y Mariano Candial. Hay 57 fotografías disponibles, numeradas y firmadas por los autores. Al hacer el pedido, especificar en los comentarios la foto deseada (sujeto a disponibilidad, fotos asignadas por orden de adquisición) Próximamente incluiremos el link con las fotografias disponibles. También se incluye una visita guiada para una persona de las propuestas por Gozarte, en las mismas condiciones que la recompensa anterior.
  • La recompensa de 100 € incluye una fotografía de entre las propuestas en la recompensa anterior, pudiendo elegir cualquiera de ellas hasta un tamaño de 50x60 cm. Igual que en la recompensa anterior, el colaborador obtendrá una visita guiada por parte de Gozarte en las mismas condiciones.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 Puedes colaborar con cualquier aportación, desde 2 €.
 A partir de 5 €, elige tu recompensa, pudiendo aportar incluso más dinero si así lo deseas. 

Además, colabora con nosotros difundiendo esta recogida de fondos, ayúdanos a Salvar Averly. Entre todos podemos conseguirlo.

  • Difundid nuestra campaña y que nos conozca todo el mundo
  • También tenemos un punto de venta físico donde poder conseguir las postales: Asociación de Vecinos Lanuza, Casco Viejo, C/ San Pablo 23, Zaragoza. Opción para quienes no pueden realizar compras por Internet y por lo tanto, no pueden participar en las recompensas aquí ofrecidas.
story_txt:
Averly se muereAverly es una empresa con más de un siglo
 y medio de vida que tuvo que cerrar a causa de la crisis. Los 
propietarios se vieron obligaros a vender antes de ser subastados y el 
nuevo propietario (una constructora) quieren derribar esta joya del patrimonio industrial para construir 200 pisos.Hemos intentado desde la Plataforma Salvemos Averly
 (quien ha creado esta campaña) que sea salvada por el Gobierno de 
Aragón, debido a su alto interés patrimonial, pero lo único que está 
primando en este caso es, como siempre, el dinero y los intereses de la 
constructora.Necesitamos 5000€ para entablar un contencioso contra el Gobierno de Aragón que obligue a los responsables a responder ante un juez de su interés por destruir Averly en vez de salvarlo. Este conjunto está incluido dentro de la lista de los 100 Elementos del Patrimonio Industrial Español, por lo que no es algo que sólo afecta a Zaragoza, sino al patrimonio de todos los españoles.Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienesHemos
 iniciado esta campaña de recogida de fondos para poder pagar las tasas,
 procuradores y demás gastos precisos para llevar adelante la demanda. 
Todos los gastos serán debidamente justificados ante quienes colaboren 
con nosotros por medio de esta página.En caso de sobrepasar la cantidad precisa o que el gasto sea menor, se entregará el resto del dinero a alguna asociación estatal de protección del patrimonio.En caso de no llegar a la cantidad precisa,
 se pagarán los gastos de las recompensas, que serán enviadas a todo el 
mundo y lo sobrante será entregado a alguna asociación estatal de 
protección del patrimonio.RecompensasCualquier ayuda es buena, desde 1 €. Con la ayuda de todos podremos ir logrando más fondos.Si realmente quieres marcar la diferencia, a partir de 5 € puedes conseguir un lote de 6 postales de Averly, mostradas a continuación. (Además de la foto de cabecera)
 A partir de 25 €, las postales incluyen una visita guiada para una persona a alguna de las propuestas por Gozarte y que esté disponible en la fecha deseada.         La visita se concertará con la empresa previamente y se reservará la plaza.La recompensa de 60 € incluye una fotografía a tamaño 40x50cm impresa en alta calidad y montada sobre cartón pluma. Fotografías realizadas por Carlos Blázquez y Mariano Candial. Hay 57 fotografías disponibles, numeradas y firmadas por los autores. Al hacer el pedido, especificar en los comentarios la foto deseada (sujeto a disponibilidad, fotos asignadas por orden de adquisición) Próximamente incluiremos el link con las fotografias disponibles. También se incluye una visita guiada para una persona de las propuestas por Gozarte, en las mismas condiciones que la recompensa anterior.La recompensa de 100 € incluye una fotografía de entre las propuestas en la recompensa anterior, pudiendo elegir cualquiera de ellas hasta un tamaño de 50x60 cm. Igual que en la recompensa anterior, el colaborador obtendrá una visita guiada por parte de Gozarte en las mismas condiciones.
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar Puedes colaborar con cualquier aportación, desde 2 €.  A partir de 5 €, elige tu recompensa, pudiendo aportar incluso más dinero si así lo deseas. Además, colabora con nosotros difundiendo esta recogida de fondos, ayúdanos a Salvar Averly. Entre todos podemos conseguirlo.
Difundid nuestra campaña y que nos conozca todo el mundo
También tenemos un punto de venta físico donde poder conseguir las postales: Asociación de Vecinos Lanuza, Casco Viejo, C/ San Pablo 23, Zaragoza. Opción para quienes no pueden realizar compras por Internet y por lo tanto, no pueden participar en las recompensas aquí ofrecidas.

story:
Pre-Order Albert DeGenova's Limited Edition A Good Hammer

A Good Hammer, is being produced and published by Timberline Press in 2014.  Timberline produces beautiful hand-made, limited-edition, letterpress art books.

Beyond the art and craft of the poetry, A Good Hammer will truly be a limited edition, signed and numbered, collectible.  Because there will be no “second print run,” and due to the financial limitations of small press enterprises, you have this opportunity to order your copy of A Good Hammer early…at a discount, and with special extras.   And you’ll be helping to kick-start the production process of the book.

Early Praise for A Good Hammer

From Kathleen Driskell, associate director Spalding University MFA in Writing program, associate editor of The Louisville Review, and author of the national bestseller Seed Across Snow: Poems

Albert DeGenova’s new poetry in A Good Hammer is full of musical moments that leap from the page, calling us to consider the complicated whole of a man’s life. Exploring “fatherblood,” “divorce’s rough cut hole,” and the many lessons a man might learn from his growing sons, this collection unfolds like a fugue, interweaving poems that are honest and accomplished, strains that lament, soothe, and rejoice. A Good Hammer reminds the reader that though a modern-day family might inhabit many households, its ties are never fully unraveled.


From Ralph Hamilton, poet and editor of RHINO magazine:


Perhaps it’s in “pockets stuffed / with brown paper bags that / smell of Swiss cheese / and peanut butter and limp garlic pickles.”  Perhaps in the cool moonglow touch of each finger on a saxophone’s keys, or three young women in black bikinis riding bikes in the rain, or in the “baby finding her toes.”Or maybe in “splinters, the little / cuts that never bleed.”  Even, the simple wine-rich romance of how “she washed my back, / I combed her hair.”  Whatever, wherever, the transcendental catalyst that makes a book of poems come fully alive—take breath, aching, literally begin pulsing on the page, grow more vital, more necessary with each poem—Albert DeGenova’s A Good Hammer has it in spades. Skillfully crafted and deeply humane, Hammer celebrates the lasting, sonorous bond between fathers and sons, husbands and wives, the power of families, the simple joys of ordinary life, of music and dance; but also the fact of failure, of loss, of disease, divorce, the need for forgiveness, the sad fortunate gift of what the Portuguese sumptuously call saudade (and we, meagerly, longing). For DeGenova love is corporeal.  And it lives at the center of this moving collection: not love as easy sentiment, but as blood and gossamer air, as beat and beauty, as hunger and bliss. DeGenova finds this link even in long forgotten words written on a yellowed cocktail napkin discovered “inside his father’s black fisherman’s cap – / a jagged sweat line, dry salt; a wiry / white hair caught / in a seam…”It’s no wonder the collection begins with a quote from Basho, the Japanese master of the brief, brilliant, firefly moment.Like its namesake poem, A Good Hammer delights in the living legacy of everything that binds us to each other and to the world, the one true thing, finally, “you can hold in [your] hand.”


Read the title poem "A Good Hammer" below, the theme of which reflects why it is so appropriate that this collection be a hand-made edition.


About Albert DeGenova

Albert DeGenova is the author of: two books of poetry, The Blueing Hours (Virtual Artists Collective, 2008) and Back Beat (Fractal Edge Press, 2nd ed., 2006); and two chapbooks, A Tender Spot (BlueBari Press, 1992) and most recently Postcards to Jack (Naked Mannekin, 2010).  From 1978-1980 he was an editor of the Oyez Review (published by Roosevelt University); in June of 2000 he launched the literary/arts journal After Hours, for which he continues as publisher and editor.  Albert is half of the performance poetry duo AvantRetro (with Charles Rossiter) which appears throughout the Midwest and greater Chicago area. 

Albert received his MFA in Writing from Spalding University, Louisville. He is an adjunct professor at Concordia University, River Forest, Ill, and now teaches the annual Norbert Blei Writing Workshop at The Clearing Folk School in Ellison Bay, Wisc.  He is a blues saxophonist and one-time contributing editor to Down Beat magazine. 

About Timberline Press

Since Timberline Press was founded in 1975 by Clarence Wolfshohl, authors and readers had come to depend on Clarence and the press to produce beautiful books at reasonable prices. When Clarence announced that the press would cease operation at the end of 2010, the Virtual Artists Collective put its collective heads together to think about how to keep it alive — with the same commitment to beautiful books at reasonable prices.

Now the fine press imprint of the Virtual Artists Collective, Timberline continues under the master efforts of Regina Schroeder to produce hand made books in the long tradition of its founder — beautiful books of fine poetry that readers can afford.

During his thirty-five years running Timberline, Wolfshohl developed his craft of letterpress printing. Although he was willing to use other processes if justified by the book’s need, his original economic decision to use letterpress became an aesthetic one. The full involvement of our senses with a well-crafted letterpress book became his goal equal to the presentation of well-crafted and sincere poetry. It is this attention to the literary art and book-making craft that Timberline Press continues into the future.

Your support of the important small press literary heritage is critical to this project!

Pre-Publication Orders Save You Money….And underwrite the costs of producing the book.  Without your support the book may never become a reality.  Order now and make this project come to life.  We appreciate anything you can do.  

Thank you, sincerely.


Timberline Press will produce two editions of A Good Hammer:

  --Letterpress edition on commercially produced paper, $30.00 (upon publication)

  --Letterpress, hand-bound edition on hand-made paper, $60.00 (upon publication)


"A Good Hammer" by Albert DeGenova


Blessed are the splinters, the little

cuts that never bleed, the dark

blue-black fingernails –

at 53 you long

for more hours as a carpenter

nailing and planing, a pencil

behind your ear, sawdust

on your shoes, the clean

sweet smell of fresh-cut lumber

in the basement, the backyard,

in the new attic bedroom –

eager for that brief moment when you close

the toolbox and exhale the good

and strong of completion, something

your sons can sit on, climb up

or walk under.  What is

a marketing manager anyway?

A son should see his father’s work, see

that a sound joint fitted in the wind will hold

against rain and hail and time, should

remember his father’s sweat.

Learn the only tool he needs,

finally, is a good hammer, love

he can hold in his hand.

story:
WHO AM I?

I'm an older Aussie - 57 this July! I have variously and simultaneously: raised two children (I do love my children!), educated other children as a primary teacher, renovated, run a business (boarding cattery - I do love cats!), and cared for wildlife and lost felines. But one love which has mainly resided within hope and been neglected within drawers, has been my writing. Until recently, at least. 

WHAT IS MY PROJECT?

In 2010 I began in earnest to bring a dream into reality - the dream to live and support myself as an author. At first I wrote and illustrated two picture books, self-publishing in the Spring of 2012. What a learning curve! But those two books are 'out there' - in homes, schools and libraries and hopefully too, in the hearts of all who've read them.

In December 2012, I began the writing of the book for which I now need your help - my first novel . A young adult coming of age fantasy, it made an ebook debut in September 2013, on Amazon, under the title Heart of Esor.

The positive response and feedback I received , especially from female readers (t'weens, teens and adults alike), prompted a greater commitment towards this novel's future. It had touched the hearts and souls of readers and needed to be out there, in the big world, being noticed, being read.

Since then I have spent every spare moment and every spare cent giving this beautiful story a thorough make-over. It's had an editing tidy up, has a new professional cover by amazing fantasy artist Laura Diehl, has been professionally formatted for the printers and has a refreshed title - it's now simply, ESOR.

And though ESOR will be available in more ebook formats very soon, ESOR also needs to experience print. For this novel houses a quaint, almost old-fashioned story, whose true soul lies in  print. Just like Pinocchio wanted to become a real boy, ESOR wants to become a real book.  

HOW YOU CAN HELP

I'm just $2500 short of this goal and am relying on a short term loan to fund the final stages until  public support arrives. And this is where I need and appreciate your help and support. ESOR needs and appreciates your help and support also. It needs to become printed and so  join the other real books, tempting and tantalising, in the real world.

Please make a donation - (even $1 from you would make a difference!) or pre-order your copy of ESOR. Check out the perks - I've kept it simple and straightforward, because what I really want is for you to read and  experience this story. 

The book will be available, by hook or by crook, from the southern Winter Solstice, so 21 June, 2014. Even if all funds aren't raised, one way or another this will go ahead. All books pre-ordered will be posted  within 48 hours of that date.

I hope you'll feel positive about contributing, but if you decide otherwise, please share this information with others. Do you have a niece, friend, child or grandchild, who might enjoy it? Do you know a school or library which would appreciate a beautiful addition to their collection?   

Thank you for your time and interest in my project.

(Please note that this book is to be printed in Australia by an Australian company with a sustainability policy. The internal design was also done in Australia by an Australian company. So Aussie employment has been supported! The cover was by a US artist , so all you Americans out there, please get behind her beautiful work.)

Here's a link to some front pages and two chapters of the book .

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5115byTKeuSV1Q5TnVNRVlsNjQ/edit

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hi. My names are Prince Israel Maduabunachukwu. I live in Port Harcourt, Rivers state of Nigeria. I lost my beloved wife of over nine years on the 24th of February 2013 to complications related to pregnancy. I have written a book to keep her worthy memory evergreen in my heart.

She was pregnant of our twin, our first babies since nine years. There have been other pregnancies, mainly ectopic and there have been many miscarriages over the years but we had been hopeful. However, the miscarriages got to a heartbreaking point, so much so, that at a point I begged her that we should give up trying since it was costing us so much money and so much pain.

Imagine our happiness when this last pregnancy resulted and tests confirmed twin gestation. (See attached scanned document in gallery.) but my beloved wife, my best friend, died early in the third trimester after much pain. I am still in shock and can never ever ever forget her. Please help me keep her beloved memories alive.


The memorial is close; she passed away on the 24th of February 2013  and I have been wondering how to keep the memories of this amazing woman who gave me so much love alive. Ijeoma was not only beautiful in appearance; this woman had angelic heart. Since there are babies in the union to remind me of her I have decided to imprint her names forever in the pages of my book Changing Hearts.

About The Book

Changing Hearts is the traumatic story of a young child diagnosed of life threatening heart disease and the riveting court case to determine if she lived or died.

It us the story of little Wendy; she lives with her mother Gina in a derelict Harlem apartment; her father Richard Jones had abandoned them and eloped with another woman. Wendy became terribly ill and all effort at treatment was unsuccessful. Advanced medical tests soon revealed she had life threatening medical condition described as cardiomyopathy; her heart was failing her. Wendy would need to undergo an organ transplant if she must live. She is  put in the UNOS list; a waiting list of patients in need of organ. For Wendy however, getting a matching heart that fits in her pericardial cavity proved was proving a formidable task.

At this time, however Richard Jones would return to his family after his woman friend left him for a younger partner; he found his family in distressing conditions. Remorseful, heavy with guilt and desperate to correct the past wrongs he offers to swap organs with his dying child.

It was the greatest gift any parent could have given to a loving child.

But the team of organ transplant specialists declined to carry out the surgery citing unprofessional, suicidal and unethical grounds. According to one of the specialists, “this is a prodigious medical experiment that could go awfully wrong. When that happens we will, every one of us present in this room, be dragged to court for unprofessional medical practice; at the end  we will either have our licenses revoked or suspended.”

More desperate than ever, knowing his daughter had but a short time to live Richard solicits the services of Susan Spencer, a brilliant but reluctant Childs Rights Advocate and together they dragged the transplant Team and the state of New York to court.

It marked the beginning of a riveting case that would ultimately determine the fate of a dying child.

For Susan, though,  this was no doubt  her most trying case ever. The man from the DA 's office whose job was to ensure the case is struck out was her lover and the man she hoped to marry; a man with a king-size grudge. Now Susan must choose between saving a crumbling relationship or the life of a dying helpless child.

For little Wendy the time ticked away quickly; too quickly.

Would she get the organ she so desperately needed before her heart finally fails her?

The climax will shock you!


You may read random section of the book at wattpad

Why publishing Changing Hearts will make a world of difference

I started work on the book changing hearts 2009 but had to abandon writing severally because I figured landing an agent would be formidable considering the high rate of manuscripts rejection in the industry. It was my beloved wife who encouraged me to continue with the work because the plot fascinated her; she told me she had faith in me and had confidence that if given opportunity Changing Hearts would do well.

It is ironical and tortuous that the book she helped nurtured would be coming out after she was gone. It makes me bleed at heart.

Please kindly help me as I plan to dedicate this awesome writing to her loving memory and to other women who are going through trying time trying or hoping to conceive. My heart also goes out to pregnant and nursing women; this is telling you that you are all appreciated. It is the toughest period of a woman’s life, especially when standard medical care is sorely lacking or just too expensive and out of reach of the poor. I have been there, so I should know.

I have such great perks for you as you join to help make this dream reality. Your contributions make you, not a book buyer but a kind considerate partner to this project.  Although my wife never had a child of her own, the birth of Changing Hearts will be like watching her finally bring a baby to life.

One of the perks is the beautiful Changing Hearts tshirt. Here are samples

Sample B

Back view



How I plan to utilize the fund

My idea is to self-publish. The book stands a better chance at being published that way. However, self-publishing can be expensive, especially if you plan to churn out quality work that will please your readers. My publisher of choice is outskirtspress, Denver based self publishing firm. Changing Hearts will cost approximately $6,800. Below is a breakdown of how the fund realized will be used.

Outskirtspress…

PUBLISHING

One-click fiction publishing ----------------$3,800

Book trailer/distribution----------------------$699

Amazon listing optimization-----------------$119

Virtual book tour------------------------------$399

Book blast promotion-- ----------------------$400

Interactive book blog-------------------------$250

A used set of PC (optional) ##----------------$85

REVIEWS

Bookpleasures---------------------------------$119

Kirkus reviews--------------------------------$575

Total =$6,454

Take-away estimate

Indiegogo % fee on funds raised + third party payment processors charge

If you reach your goal, expect to receive:
Goal – Fees = Your Take-away
$7,000 - Fees = $6,510


If I exceed my goal, I shall enter Changing Hearts for book awards. If changing Hearts become successful, I will be happy to become life patron of a motherless babies’ home. If Changing Hearts goes on to become a runaway success, I plan to build a compact motherless babies home and name after my wife.

Please Kindly select a perk in the perks' corner.

Sometimes, even with the best of intentions we are unable to contribute financially to a project we cherish but we could kindly help spread the word. PLEASE, SHARE, TWEET, EMAIL. If you just take a moment to share this story with your friends or anyone you know who might be encouraged by it, I'll be so thankful. I so passionately believe in the power of a good book and also believe Changing Hearts both as a book and as a campaign will positively affect many lives

Please add $10 for shipping if living outside US

*Since I am not physically present, I have discussed with an outskirtspress consultant about using digitally scanned signatures. Where this may not be feasible, for any reason I shall update you accordingly and urge you please kindly bear with me. This is really beyond me.

## My old PC keeps crashing and ‘hanging’. I borrow a kind neighbor’s for typing and book final changes
story_txt:
Hi. My names are Prince Israel Maduabunachukwu. I live in
Port Harcourt, Rivers state of Nigeria. I lost my beloved wife of over nine years on the 24th
of February 2013 to complications related to pregnancy. I have written a book to keep her worthy memory evergreen in my heart.She was pregnant of our twin, our first babies since nine
years. There have been other pregnancies, mainly ectopic and there have been
many miscarriages over the years but we had been hopeful. However, the
miscarriages got to a heartbreaking point, so much so, that at a point I begged
her that we should give up trying since it was costing us so much money and so
much pain. 
Imagine our happiness when this last pregnancy resulted and
tests confirmed twin gestation. (See attached scanned document in gallery.) but
my beloved wife, my best friend, died early in the third trimester after much
pain. I am still in shock and can never ever ever forget her. Please help me keep her beloved memories alive. 
The memorial is
close; she passed away on the 24th of February 2013  and I have been wondering how to keep the
memories of this amazing woman who gave me so much love alive. Ijeoma was not only beautiful in appearance; this woman had angelic heart. Since there are babies in the union to remind me of her I have decided
to imprint her names forever in the pages of my book Changing Hearts.

About The Book
Changing Hearts is the traumatic story
of a young child diagnosed of life threatening heart disease and the riveting
court case to determine if she lived or died.It us the story of little Wendy; she lives with her mother Gina in a derelict Harlem
apartment; her father Richard Jones had abandoned them and eloped with another
woman. Wendy became terribly ill and all effort at treatment was unsuccessful.
Advanced medical tests soon revealed she had life threatening medical
condition described as cardiomyopathy; her heart was failing her. Wendy would need to undergo an organ
transplant if she must live. She is  put in the UNOS list; a waiting list of patients in need of
organ. For Wendy however, getting a matching heart that fits in her
pericardial cavity proved was proving a formidable task.
At this time, however Richard Jones would return to his family after
his woman friend left him for a younger partner; he found his family in distressing conditions. Remorseful, heavy with guilt and desperate to correct the past wrongs he
offers to swap organs with his dying child.
It was the greatest gift any parent could have given to a
loving child. 
But the team of organ transplant specialists declined to
carry out the surgery citing unprofessional, suicidal and unethical grounds. According
to one of the specialists, “this is a
prodigious medical experiment that could go awfully wrong. When that happens we will, every one of us present in this room, be dragged to court for unprofessional medical practice; at the end  we will either have our licenses revoked or suspended.” 
More desperate than ever, knowing his daughter had but a
short time to live Richard solicits the services of Susan Spencer, a brilliant
but reluctant Childs Rights Advocate and together they dragged the transplant
Team and the state of New York to court. It marked the beginning of a riveting
case that would ultimately determine the fate of a dying child. For Susan, though,  this was no doubt  her most trying case ever. The man from the DA 's office 
whose job was to ensure the case is struck out was her lover and the man she hoped to marry; a man with a king-size grudge. Now Susan 
must choose between saving a crumbling relationship or the life of a dying helpless child. For little Wendy the time ticked
away quickly; too quickly. 
Would she get the organ she so desperately needed before her
heart finally fails her? The climax will shock you!
You may read random section of the book at wattpad
Why publishing Changing Hearts
will make a world of difference
I started work on the book changing hearts 2009 but had to
abandon writing severally because I figured landing an agent would be formidable
considering the high rate of manuscripts rejection in the industry. It was my beloved wife who
encouraged me to continue with the work because the plot fascinated her; she
told me she had faith in me and had confidence that if given opportunity Changing Hearts would do well.
It is ironical and tortuous that the book she helped
nurtured would be coming out after she was gone. It makes me bleed at heart.
Please kindly help me as I plan to dedicate this awesome
writing to her loving memory and to other women who are going through trying
time trying or hoping to conceive. My heart also goes out to pregnant and
nursing women; this is telling you that you are all appreciated. It is the
toughest period of a woman’s life, especially when standard medical care is
sorely lacking or just too expensive and out of reach of the poor. I have been
there, so I should know. 
I have such great perks for you as you join to help make
this dream reality. Your contributions make you, not a book buyer but a kind considerate partner to this project.  Although my wife never had a child of her own, the birth of

story:
As the author of the acclaimed e-book Fix Your Gut, I have helped numerous readers and coached a lot of different people to better digestive / overall health over the years.

In my next book, I want to tackle a whole host of medical issues that stem from mitochondrial dysfunction. Heart disease, diabetes, chronic fatigue, and poor performance can all be linked to mitochondrial dysfunction.

So what are mitochondria?

"A Mitochondrion is a membrane-enclosed organelle structure found in all cells in the human body. These mitochondria are known as the “power plants” of the cell. The mitochondria of the cell generate the most of the cell’s supply of adenosine triphosphate, which is used by the cell as a source of chemical energy. "

Do you not have enough energy to get through the day?

Mitochondria produce the energy that we need to get through our everyday hectic life.

Mitochondria are even responsible for more actions in the body including cellular signalling, cellular differentiation, and cellular death.

Are you tired of you skin and joints aging rapidly?

There even is a Theory of Mitochondrial Aging, meaning that the health of our mitochondria is directly linked to how fast we age!

This book will change how we tackle chronic diseases /conditions including heart disease, diabetes, Alzheimer disease, and stroke. Is it possible to grow new brain and heart cells in our body, by increasing mitochondrial function, after the damage from these diseases have been done?

In the fast paced world we live in; we need all the energy we can produce to keep up with the hectic pace of life! This constant need for increased energy is what my book Fix Your Mitochondria will address, how proper mitochondrial function equals enough energy to get you through the day!

What do you receive for donating?

The offered perks range from receiving my books, Fix Your Gut, or the Fix Your Gut Probiotic Guide, to receiving e-mail coaching or skype coaching by me. Over the past few years, I have been able to help many people through coaching them and providing information for free on forums and my website Fixyourgut.com.

The Fix Your Gut Supplement Guide is finally completed and will be offered as a perk for your donations as well. The supplement guide covers vitamins, minerals, brands, updated multivitamin recommendations, hypervitamin / mineralosis, what is the best place to purchase your supplements, in-depth omega 3 information, supplement regimens on a budget, and supplement information of what should be in anyone's medicine cabinet.

What is the money raised  going to?

The money raised during this fundraiser will help me pay some bills so I can make a small living during the research and writing of this book. I also need to purchase sources and materials for the research of the book. I will also need to pay for an editor for the book and a graphic designer. I want to thank you for all the support my readers have given me over the years.


About the Author

My name is John W. Brisson, I am the author of Fix Your Gut, and a regular guest on the Not Just Paleo Podcast. I have worked with supplement companies educating and designing products. I am also a frequent contributor on the Bulletproof Executive and Mark's Daily Apple forums. I have also coached many different people through their medical conditions and into better health!


I personally thank everyone who will donate. Share this campaign on Facebook please if you are unable to. Thank you.

John Brisson

story:
Vagina Matters, a sex ed book for girls

Hi! We are Fine Acts, a playground for social change.

Vagina Matters is our illustrated book project dedicated to bringing sexual health education to girls and women – in Bulgaria, and beyond.

The female body, menstruation and sex continue to be taboo topics in many countries, which makes it extremely difficult to have open conversations about sexual health issues that affect our physical, mental and social well-being. While both girls and boys receive poor sexual health education (only 10% of schools in Bulgaria have dedicated classes according to a statement by the Bulgarian Ombudsman), we’ve found that girls are disproportionately affected. Bulgaria, along with Romania, has the highest rate of teenage pregnancies in the EU (WHO, UNDP).

We are set on encouraging a culture of curiosity and openness about sexual health issues that are crucial to growing up and understanding ourselves.

After successfully publishing the book in Bulgaria, we plan to take the initiative further on a more global scale, and target other countries lacking a working sexual health education curriculum. The first step in this direction would be to translate the book in English, to make it widely available to anyone wishing to collaborate!

Our Vagina Matters team is passionate about bringing the book to life. We believe in compassionate and comprehensive sexual health education where girls not only learn about the negative issues such as unwanted pregnancies and STI’s, but really get to know their body and how it functions. By supporting our campaign, you join us in empowering girls, which begins with adequate education on sexual health and relationships.  

 

The Vagina Matters Squad

The authors of the book are:

  • Svetla Baeva and Raya Raeva are human rights activists. Svetla is the Campaigns Director at Fine Acts, a global platform for socially engaged creative solutions, while Raya is the acting Campaigns Director at the Bulgarian Helsinki Committee, the leading human rights organization in Bulgaria. We’ve been championing women’s rights for years and have worked on a number of campaigns and initiatives concerning violence against women, women’s rights history in Bulgaria, including how women are portrayed in public spaces and literature, lack of representation of women artists in galleries and museums, etc.

We started our research over a year ago and today we have more educational content than we could’ve hoped for, exploring issues such as the female body, menstruation and sex, as well as issues of equality, stereotypes, and violence. To make Vagina Matters appealing and engaging, we reached out to two talented illustrators:

  • Borislava Karadjova (with artistic name Borislava Willnevermadeit) and Mihaela Karadjova (with artistic name STALKERSINCE 1993) are one-of-а-kind, fearless artists and human beings, with a colorful vision of the world and a positive mindset. They’re into illustration, storyboarding and design. Borislava gets her inspiration from the world around her, that’s why she loves to travel, capturing every moment with pen and paper. Mihaela is inspired by music notes, the wilderness, skateboarding, the circus, and fashion.
     


We’ve also engaged a number of experts in the field like medical and sex ed professionals, midwives, lawyers and many more, who have certified our content. During this period, we’ve worked hard to onboard a number of partners such as Loveguide.bg, the largest online platform for sexual education, and the Bulgarian Helsinki Committee.

The project has so far been backed by the Bulgarian Fund for Women, a grant-making organization working to achieve gender equality in all spheres of public life, with an initial grant (EUR 1000) that has helped us carry out our research, pilot the first illustrations and launch our website.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Making a big, beautiful book requires a lot of funding. Paper costs go up every year, and we want to work only with dedicated printing shops. It's made in Bulgaria so that we can oversee every step of production.

The book will be a full-color, softcover edition, sized at 15 x 21 cm and over 200 pages long!


But we still have much to do. We’ll need a total of USD 6000 to finance the remaining production phases:

  • edit and review the book content;
  • complete all illustrations (over 150 of them!);
  • print 2000 copies of the book;
  • disseminate 1500 books for free within disadvantaged groups in schools across the country;
  • sell 500 book copies so that we can support further printing and dissemination of the book;
  • publish a free version of Vagina Matters on our website so that anyone wishing to access the information can do so;
  • organize an exhibition with the book illustrations on October 11, International Girl’s Day.

By supporting us, you will help us grow our community, who wants to see real changes. Nearly 78% of people, aged 15 to 49, are certain that students should be taught sexual health in school (Loveguide.bg).

We’ve prepared a bunch of unique gifts for you, our supporters! You’ll not only get early access to our illustrations but by using our goodies you’ll be spreading our message further. Check out the tiers to find out which of the goodies below are included:

  • A postcard of gratitude
  • A sticker pack (4 stickers)
  • A phone wallpaper
  • A Vagina Matters tote bag
  • A poster with an illustration right out from the book (downloadable)
  • A special pin
  • A unique illustration, just for you
  • And of course, our Vagina Matters book (in Bulgarian initially)!

You have the option to support us through picking a pre-determined tier and pricing or you can support us by donating a sum that best fits your needs, with as little as 1 USD.

Roughly, all merch and admin costs aside, this is what your contribution does:

  • 25 USD – you gift two books to girls that can't afford them;
  • 50 USD – you gift two books (and you get one);
  • 100 USD – you gift three books (and you get one);
  • 500 USD – you gift ten books (and you get one).
     

What we hope to achieve

Vagina Matters responds to an existing gap in sexual health education. It creates engaging and accessible information for girls. It’s essentially a pocket guidebook with the answers to all the burning questions that girls might have about the female body, menstruation, sex and more.

We plan to freely distribute our book in schools and local workshops on sexual health education organized across the country. With the support of our partners such as Loveguide.bg and the Bulgarian Fund for Women’s network, we will be able to directly reach our target group: young girls between the ages of 14 and 19.

Due to the existing taboo around speaking about the female body, menstruation and sex, the book is just as relevant for women in their twenties or thirties. We also plan to sell our book online for anyone who wants to get a print edition. We know there’s interest because we’ve already been featured in the news in publications such as Cosmopolitan and Vij Magazine (print and online) even before we launched our campaign! All funds from sold copies will support our book distribution on the ground.

We believe in access – the more people who can read Vagina Matters, the more we can change damaging myths and stereotypes. This is why we will also make a version of the book available online for anyone to download and read!

We’re bursting with ideas on how to spread the word! One of them is to translate Vagina Matters in English – we know that compassionate materials on sexual health, that are also well-designed, are lacking across Eastern Europe and beyond. If we can translate it, we will be able to reach more girls regarding their sexual health and relationships. That’s why we’ve enabled Indiegogo’s Indemand option for campaigning, which means that we’ll be accepting contributions after our campaign ends.

Our team is experienced in producing children’s books and products. We’ve just launched a children’s comic book, Party for the Narwhal, with quirky illustrations that draw out the story of a narwhal seeking asylum from the pollution that has destroyed his home in the Arctic waters. Not only that, last year we launched an educational pack of illustrated coloring cards called The superwomen, with stories of women historical figures.

We’ve also produced a number of projects, championing women’s rights, such as BEAT., a campaign featuring an art installation and a video, tackling the silence around domestic violence, or the MONUMENT #1 action that supported the Monumental Women campaign in Bulgaria about women’s rights history, which also called for more female statues across Sofia.

 

Risks & Challenges

One of the risks is that we won’t be able to raise enough funds to produce the book. That’s why apart from our crowdfunding campaign, we’re working hard to diversify our funding sources by reaching out to grant-making organizations and companies that are aligned with our values.

 

Other ways you can support us

There are plenty of ways you can pitch in! Here are just a few:

  • Share our campaign with five other potential supporters! You’ll be helping us get the word out about the importance of sexual education. That would be A LOT of support!
  • If you’re a company or an organization, interested in supporting the Vagina Matters initiative, let’s start talking about collaborating!
  • If you believe in our mission, join us as a volunteer! Whether you’re a student in high school or a university professor, your enthusiasm makes our community grow.
  • If you have any other ideas, drop us a line on our website. We want to hear from you!

We plan to freely distribute our book in schools and local workshops on sexual health education organized across the country. With the support of our partners such as Loveguide.bg and the Bulgarian Fund for Women’s network, we will be able to directly reach our target group: young girls between the ages of 14 and 19.
Due to the existing taboo around speaking about the female body, menstruation and sex, the book is just as relevant for women in their twenties or thirties. We also plan to sell our book online for anyone who wants to get a print edition. We know there’s interest because we’ve already been featured in the news in publications such as Cosmopolitan and Vij Magazine (print and online) even before we launched our campaign! All funds from sold copies will support our book distribution on the ground.
We believe in access – the more people who can read Vagina Matters, the more we can change damaging myths and stereotypes. This is why we will also make a version of the book available online for anyone to download and read!
We’re bursting with ideas on how to spread the word! One of them is to translate Vagina Matters in English – we know that compassionate materials on sexual health, that are also well-designed, are lacking across Eastern Europe and beyond. If we can translate it, we will be able to reach more girls regarding their sexual health and relationships. That’s why we’ve enabled Indiegogo’s Indemand option for campaigning, which means that we’ll be accepting contributions after our campaign ends.
Our team is experienced in producing children’s books and products. We’ve just launched a children’s comic book, Party for the Narwhal, with quirky illustrations that draw out the story of a narwhal seeking asylum from the pollution that has destroyed his home in the Arctic waters. Not only that, last year we launched an educational pack of illustrated coloring cards called The superwomen, with stories of women historical figures.
We’ve also produced a number of projects, championing women’s rights, such as BEAT., a campaign featuring an art installation and a video, tackling the silence around domestic violence, or the MONUMENT #1 action that supported the Monumental Women campaign in Bulgaria about women’s rights history, which also called for more female statues across Sofia.
 

Risks & Challenges
One of the risks is that we won’t be able to raise enough funds to produce the book. That’s why apart from our crowdfunding campaign, we’re working hard to diversify our funding sources by reaching out to grant-making organizations and companies that are aligned with our values.
 

Other ways you can support us
There are plenty of ways you can pitch in! Here are just a few:


Share our campaign with five other potential supporters! You’ll be helping us get the word out about the importance of sexual education. That would be A LOT of support!
If you’re a company or an organization, interested in supporting the Vagina Matters initiative, let’s start talking about collaborating!
If you believe in our mission, join us as a volunteer! Whether you’re a student in high school or a university professor, your enthusiasm makes our community grow.
If you have any other ideas, drop us a line on our website. We want to hear from you!

story:
Short Summary

It's time for the Indian side of the story to finally be told about America's first named Indian war — The Tiguex War (pronounced TEE-wesh). So far, it's the least known, with only a few eyewitness Spanish chroniclers having written about it 470-plus years ago. And all of them told the story from the sixteenth-century conquistador point of view.

Winter of the Metal People: The untold story of America's first Indian war tells at last the Indian side of the story. You can find more information about the book at my author's website and on the book's blog.

This historical novel tells how a young Pueblo warrior named Poquis reluctantly accepts leadership after Spaniards and their Aztec allies inflict major defeats on his tribe in 1540-41 in the Southwest. When all seems lost, he resorts to guerilla warfare to better fight the invaders. Unlike most Indian wars to follow, the Natives win this time. The Spaniards withdraw from the Southwest and do not return for half a century.

Sorry, no video, but click here for a newspaper article about the book.

After publication, it's all about marketing

Perhaps the most difficult job in the crowded book market is figuring out how to let people even realize a book exists.

A prestigious small, independent press has signed a contract to publish Winter of the Metal People early in 2013. Because the publisher is small, however, it will be mostly up to me to publicize and promote the book so people can learn the Native side of the story.

Your support of this Indiegogo project will raise the funds necessary to finance the perks listed on the right and successfully market both e-book and print editions of Winter of the Metal People. Your pledges will pay advertising and marketing costs as well as commission a Puebloan artist for the cover. (I have an artist already committed.) Your pledges will also provide copies I'll donate to school libraries in each of New Mexico's 20 pueblos so their students can learn more of their own proud history. 

Funds will go to complement social marketing with expenses such as advertising, a book tour, public relations, and promotional items such as bookmarks, fliers, review copies, promotional copies, etc. 

Join me in giving voice to the early Pueblo Indians who have been portrayed by only the conquistadors' most negative stereotypes since 1540. Any funding will go to distribute and promote the book to the largest possible audience. If we go over our goal, I can provide extra benefits for all backers.

For a book sample, download a free pdf of Chapter 6. A link to the historical notes is on the book's complementary website so you can compare the Chapter 6 notes with the chapter.

About the author and book

I'm the author of several published short stories and two novels that you can see on my author website at dennisherrick.com. I have been researching, writing, and rewriting Winter of the Metal People for the last 10 years.

I did have Winter of the Metal People under contract two years ago, but that publisher entered bankruptcy during the recession and released all rights back to me. Different publishers have offered contracts over the past two years, but I feel the publisher I ultimately accepted will do the best job for the book. 

The Impact

The novel is complete at 86,000 words and includes a map. In addition to historical background notes already posted on the book's complementary website, a special section on today's surviving Tiguex Province pueblos also will be posted there. The conquistadors are gone, but the Puebloans are still here — as tourists can attest who fall in love with Puebloan art, architecture, and dance ceremonies when they visit the Southwest. 

Three unique aspects about this book: 

  • This is the first book ever devoted to the Tiguex War, so it should attract interest throughout the Southwest and also appeal to the many people interested in the Indian wars and history in general; 
  • The 1500s Spanish conquest viewpoint has been presented repeatedly, but this is the first book on what the encounter must have been like for the Puebloans; 
  • The novel is researched so thoroughly that professors at two universities already have expressed interest in using the book in their classes, and a teacher at a Pueblo school wants the book for her students.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, you can still help by spreading the word about Winter of the Metal People.

If you want to see the Native side of the story finally told, alert your friends by posting a reference to this campaign on your Facebook pages, Twitter, other social media sites, and anywhere else you can think of.

Thanks in advance for your help.

story:
Click Here for English!


"Aidez la Fondation des Jeunes à atteindre ses objectifs !"

La Fondation des Jeunes pour un développement Durable (FJDD) a une double mission auprès des jeunes (13 à 35 ans) : 1- Éduquer sur les enjeux environnementaux actuels et futurs et 2- la réalisation de projets durables dans les pays en développement et émergents.

Depuis son inauguration en 2007, la FJDD a réalisé six programmes et deux initiatives qui ont mobilisé plusieurs dizaines de milliers de jeunes au Québec et à travers le monde. Plus de 150 partenaires et collaborateurs ont participé à ce succès. Plusieurs grands noms ont soutenu nos programmes : Dr. David Suzuki, Dr. Hubert Reeves, M. Jean Lemire, M. Steven Guilbeault et Madame Laure Waridel en sont quelques exemples.

Le programme Jeunes au Coeur du Changement créé par la FJDD a pour objectif de faire participer la jeunesse québécoise (13 à 35 ans) dans le cadre d’un voyage humanitaire ou ils auront à réaliser un projet communautaire, spécifiquement, mais non exclusivement, dans les pays émergents et en développement.

Grâce à la collaboration de l’Association pour le projet Samanà en République Dominicaine, la FJDD bâtira en novembre prochain un Resto Populaire dans la ville de Samanà. Basé sur le succès vécu dans la ville de Sanchez, nous comptons offrir plus de 500 repas à faible coût par semaine et générer au bout d’une année de fonctionnement, 3 emplois à temps plein.

Comment allons-nous utiliser votre argent ?

Afin de rendre ce projet concret, nous avons besoin d’amasser une somme de 15 000$. De ce montant, 10 000$ servira à la construction du Resto Populaire et 5000$ sera utilisé pour les équipements de la cuisine et un inventaire complet en aliment sera mis sur pied pour le premier mois de fonctionnement du Resto Populaire.

Si jamais nous n’arrivons pas à atteindre l’objectif pour la collecte de fonds, nous poursuivrons encore quelques mois afin de nous assurer d’avoir l’argent nécessaire pour mener à bien ce projet.

Advenant le cas où nous dépassons l’objectif, la balance sera remise à la communauté de Samanà afin de mettre en place un jardin communautaire pour soutenir le Resto Populaire.

Comment nous aider concrètement ?

Actuellement, vous avez le pouvoir de changer les choses. Nous avons besoin de vous afin de promouvoir notre projet. Que ce soit par téléphone, messagerie texte, email, Facebook, ou tout simplement en parlant à vos amis(es). Les encourager à contribuer nous aiderait grandement. Nous avons plus de 16 000 membres Facebook qui nous supportent et nous souhaitons augmenter davantage.

Espace Commandite !

Pour vous motiver davantage, nous avons créé des contreparties afin de vous offrir une visibilité :

·  Nom listé sur la page web pour les donateurs

·  Participation à un tirage d’un voyage humanitaire pour 2

·  Participation au Gala Action Jeunesses Édition 2015

·  Nom sur la plaque exposée dans le Resto Populaire

·  Nom cité dans un communiqué de presse

·  Nom donné au bâtiment

* Pour les voyages humanitaires, les participants s'engagent à respecter les règles et conditions établies par la Fondation. La livraison se fera entre la période du 1 Janvier au 31 Décembre 2015.

Merci pour votre engagement. Ensemble nous pouvons faire une différence dans la vie des gens en République Dominicaine.

* Pour les citoyens du Canada, à partir de 20 $ vous recevrez un reçu pour fin de charité !


-----------------------------------------------------------

English Version 

"Help the Youth Foundation to achieve its objectives" 

The Youth for Sustainable Development Foundation (YSDF) has a dual mission with youth (13-35 years): 1- Educate on current and future environmental issues and 2- to achieve sustainable projects in emerging countries. 

Since its inauguration in 2007, the YSDF conducted six programs and two initiatives that mobilized tens of thousands of young people in Quebec and around the world. More than 150 partners and staff have contributed to this success. Several big names have supported our programs: Dr. David Suzuki, Dr. Hubert Reeves, Mr. Jean Lemire, Mr. Steven Guilbeault and Mrs. Laure Waridel are some examples. 

The Youth United for Change program created by YSDF aims to involve Quebec Youth (13-35 years) as part of a humanitarian trip where they will have to complete a community project, specifically, but not exclusively in emerging and developing countries. 

Through the collaboration of the Samanà Project Association in Dominican Republic, in November 2014, YSDF will build a Meal Center in the town of Samanà. Based on the success experienced in the town of Sanchez, we plan to offer more than 500 meals a week at a low cost and generate after one year of operation, three full-time jobs. 

How we are going to use your money? 

To realize this project, we need to raise $ 15,000. Of this amount, $ 10,000 will be used for the construction of the Meal Center and $ 5,000 will be used for kitchen equipment and a complete inventory of the food will be set up for the first month of operation. 

If we ever fail to achieve the purpose for raising funds, we still continue a few months to make sure we have the money needed to complete this project. 

In the event that we exceed the target, the balance will be given to the community of Samanà to set up a community garden to support the Meal Center. 

How can you help in practice? 

Currently, you have the power to change things. We need you to promote our project. Whether by phone, text messaging, email, Facebook, or just talking to your friends. Encourage them to contribute would help us greatly. We have over 16,000 Facebook members who support us and we want to increase further. 

Sponsorship space! 

To further motivate you, we have created some special gifts to offer you a visibility: 

· Name listed on the web page for donors 

· Participation in a draw for a humanitarian trip for 2 

· Participation in the Youth Action Gala 2015 Edition 

· Name on the exposed plate in the Meal Center 

· Quoted in a press release name 

· Name given to the Meal Center

* For humanitarian trips, participants agree to abide by the rules and conditions established by the Foundation. Delivery will be between January 1 to December 31 of 2015. 

Thank you for your commitment. Together we can make a difference in people's lives in the Dominican Republic. 

* For citizens of Canada, from $ 20 you will receive a receipt for charity!

story:
Hello, my name is Ron Kolman and I need your help.  I am asking you to reach out and help me touch people's lives and perhaps give hope to those who are going through challenging times in their lives, specifically those battling cancer.

You see, I've just come through my own battle with neck and throat cancer and have learned some very valuable lessons and that's why I'm here.  I'd like to ask you to share in the creation of my story by contributing towards the publishing of a book that I am writing.

My case was one of the hardest and most complicated cases that they had ever seen at the cancer clinic and in fact was so unique that they didn't even have any statistics to go on and they really had to think outside of the box to put together a treatment program for me.  My cancer was so advanced and aggressive that the doctors had to decide whether to just put me in palliative care and let me go or to try and get after the cancer, and I am thankful and grateful that they chose the latter.

So please help me make a positive impact on other people's lives by choosing one of the contribution levels with the perk or perks that you'd like to receive as thanks from me.

Thank You!

The mask that I wore during my radiation treatments.  The radiation is so precise that my head had to be completely still and they would lock the mask into place so that I wouldn't move during treatment. 

What's the money for?

Over the next 35 days I am seeking to raise $20,000 for my campaign.  Here is the plan for how it will be utilized.

• Initial Reading Fee: $300.00

• Digital Format: $3700.00

• Cover Design: $350.00

• Artwork: $1,000.00 

• Legal: $300.00

• Labor/Admin: $1500.00

• Final Proofread: $800.00

• Kindle Version: $900.00

• Amazon Listing: $200.00

• Editing: $3,500.00 

• Printing of 500 copies: $6,000.00

• Support of perks: $1,500.00


The effects of 35 radiation treatments burned not only the outside of my skin but the inside of my throat also to the point that I could not eat or even take a sip of water orally and had to have a feeding tube inserted into my stomach to be able to provide nourishment for my body.

About two weeks after learning that I had cancer I had a dream.  It was very profound and was for the first time since learning of my diagnosis I knew that not only was I going to fight it, but that I was going to do anything that I had to in order to win the Good Fight.  I have decided to start my book by sharing that dream and I have included it below as a bit of a sneak peak introduction.

I humbly and gratefully thank you for helping me in anyway you can to  achieve my goal of writing and publishing my book.

I wish you peace, love and fulfillment in your life.

Ron :)


Learning how to use the feeding tube so that I could eat and drink.

                                                   

The Dream

I could barely hang on, my left hand reaching up, precariously holding the edge of the cliff, "The White Cliffs of Dover."  If I slipped it was a hundred meters straight down to the rocks and ocean below and my death.  The fear that coursed through my body was unlike any sensation that I had ever felt before.  What was I going to do?

I looked up and saw him.  He was kneeling down on one knee his right elbow resting on his right knee as he looked down at me.  His emotionless, cold dark stare adding to the already chilling fear that I felt.  He was dressed in the uniform of a Nazi officer, that familiar despised grey-green uniform with the peaked cap, or "Schirmmutze" as they were called, and the black high leather jack boots.

I knew immediately who he was.  His name was Cancer.

Looking up at him and feeling the fear I started to talk to him, trying to rationalize with him, pleading with him to give me a chance.  He could have easily reached over and flicked my fingers off the side of the cliff or stood up and stepped on them, the result being the same.  Death.  My life was his at that moment.  He stared at me for what seemed like an eternity.  I thought, how do you rationalize with something so evil, so corrupt at it's core that just the thought of it is enough to bring the strongest of souls to their knees? 

I didn't know, I only felt deep down that I had to try, I had to fight.  It was my life.

And so I continued to talk to him, plead with him, starting what I would come to call the "Good Fight," when slowly and methodically, without taking his eyes off of mine, he stood straight up, turned and slowly walked away.

I knew at that moment that I was being given a chance.

I pulled myself up to the top of the cliff and stood up.  I looked inland and saw a large Nazi prisoner camp surrounded by barbed wire, guard towers on each corner surrounded by dozens of Nazi soldiers.  Some had dogs with them, some were walking in pairs, some alone, all of them with the familiar Mauser 98K rifles slung over their shoulders. I knew who they were and what they represented.  They were cancer cells. 

I knew that in order to survive I had to somehow get past them.

I looked to my left past the prisoner camp, the cancer, and off in the distance I saw the most beautiful open field, the epitome of a prairie scene with the wheat and grass golden and soft, gently bent over in a soft wind.  I immediately felt the peace it stirred within me and I instinctively knew that if I could get to that field, if I could just make it there that everything would be okay.  It represented a place of healing, peace and cure to me. 

And so I continued The Good Fight, praying, affirming life and allowing myself to relax into a state of mindful peace and faith and started to walk forward.  I do not know why, perhaps as a disguise, maybe as acknowledgement of what was before me, but I found myself also dressed in the uniform of the Nazi guards.

I kept present within the situation, an acceptance of where I was with peace and calm.  I started to walk towards them with a sense of faith and confidence, through them and passed them, the soldiers, the cancer cells, and past the prisoner camp, the representation of the cancer that had now manifested itself inside of me, and towards the beautiful field that resonated healing and life to me.

I awoke that morning feeling a sense of peace and comfort.

"Let us not pray to be sheltered from dangers but to be fearless when facing them."             ~ Rabindranoth Tagore ~
story_txt:
Hello, my name is Ron Kolman and I need your help.  I am asking you to reach out and help me touch people's lives and perhaps give hope to those who are going through challenging times in their lives, specifically those battling cancer.You see, I've just come through my own battle with neck and throat cancer and have learned some very valuable lessons and that's why I'm here.  I'd like to ask you to share in the creation of my story by contributing towards the publishing of a book that I am writing.My case was one of the hardest and most complicated cases that they had ever seen at the cancer clinic and in fact was so unique that they didn't even have any statistics to go on and they really had to think outside of the box to put together a treatment program for me.  My cancer was so advanced and aggressive that the doctors had to decide whether to just put me in palliative care and let me go or to try and get after the cancer, and I am thankful and grateful that they chose the latter.So please help me make a positive impact on other people's lives by choosing one of the contribution levels with the perk or perks that you'd like to receive as thanks from me.Thank You!

The mask that I wore
during my radiation treatments.  The radiation is so precise that my head
had to be completely still and they would lock the mask into place so that I
wouldn't move during treatment.  


What's the money for?Over the next 35 days I am seeking to raise $20,000 for my
campaign.  Here is the plan for how it
will be utilized.
• Initial Reading Fee: $300.00 
• Digital Format: $3700.00 
• Cover Design: $350.00
• Artwork: $1,000.00  
• Legal: $300.00 
• Labor/Admin: $1500.00 
• Final Proofread: $800.00 
• Kindle Version: $900.00 
• Amazon Listing: $200.00 
• Editing: $3,500.00  
• Printing of 500 copies: $6,000.00
• Support of perks: $1,500.00



The effects of 35
radiation treatments burned not only the outside of my skin but the inside of
my throat also to the point that I could not eat or even take a sip of water
orally and had to have a feeding tube inserted into my stomach to be able to provide
nourishment for my body.
About two weeks after
learning that I had cancer I had a dream.  It was very profound and was
for the first time since learning of my diagnosis I knew that not only was I
going to fight it, but that I was going to do anything that I had to in order
to win the Good Fight.  I have decided to start my book by sharing that
dream and I have included it below as a bit of a sneak peak introduction.
I humbly and gratefully thank you for helping me in
anyway you can to  achieve my goal of writing and publishing my book.
I wish
you peace, love and fulfillment in your life.
Ron :)
Learning how to use the feeding tube so that I could eat and drink.












                                                   

The Dream
I could barely hang on, my left hand reaching up,
precariously holding the edge of the cliff, "The White Cliffs of Dover."  If I slipped it was a hundred meters straight
down to the rocks and ocean below and my death. 
The fear that coursed through my body was unlike any sensation that I
had ever felt before.  What was I going
to do?
I looked up and saw him. 
He was kneeling down on one knee his right elbow resting on his right
knee as he looked down at me.  His
emotionless, cold dark stare adding to the already chilling fear that I
felt.  He was dressed in the uniform of a Nazi officer, that familiar despised grey-green uniform with the peaked
cap, or "Schirmmutze" as they were called, and the black high leather jack
boots.
I knew immediately who he was.  His name was Cancer.
Looking up at him and feeling the fear I started to talk
to him, trying to rationalize with him, pleading with him to give me a
chance.  He could have easily reached
over and flicked my fingers off the side of the cliff or stood up and stepped
on them, the result being the same. 
Death.  My life was his at that
moment.  He stared at me for what seemed
like an eternity.  I thought, how do you
rationalize with something so evil, so corrupt at it's core that just the
thought of it is enough to bring the strongest of souls to their knees?  
I didn't know, I only felt deep down that I had to try, I
had to fight.  It was my life.
And so I continued to talk to him, plead with him,
starting what I would come to call the "Good Fight," when slowly and
methodically, without taking his eyes off of mine, he stood straight up, turned
and slowly walked away.
I knew at that moment that I was being given a chance.
I pulled myself up to the top of the cliff and stood
up.  I looked inland and saw a large Nazi
prisoner camp surrounded by barbed wire, guard towers on each corner surrounded
by dozens of Nazi soldiers.  Some had
dogs with them, some were walking in pairs, some alone, all of them with the
familiar Mauser 98K rifles slung over their shoulders. I knew who they were and what they
represented.  They were cancer
cells.  
I knew that in order to survive I had to somehow get past
them.
I looked to my left past the prisoner camp, the cancer,
and off in the distance I saw the most beautiful open field, the epitome of a
prairie scene with the wheat and grass golden and soft, gently bent over in a
soft wind.  I immediately felt the peace
it stirred within me and I instinctively knew that if I could get to that field,
if I could just make it there that everything would be okay.  It represented a place of healing, peace and
cure to me.  
And so I continued The Good Fight, praying, affirming life
and allowing myself to relax into a state of mindful peace and faith and started
to walk forward.  I do not know why,
perhaps as a disguise, maybe as acknowledgement of what was before me, but I
found myself also dressed in the uniform of the Nazi guards.
I kept present within the situation, an acceptance of
where I was with peace and calm.  I started
to walk towards them with a sense of faith and confidence, through them and
passed them, the soldiers, the cancer cells, and past the prisoner camp, the
representation of the cancer that had now manifested itself inside of me, and
towards the beautiful field that resonated healing and life to me.
I awoke that morning feeling a sense of peace and comfort.
"Let us not pray to be
sheltered from dangers but to be fearless when facing them."             ~ Rabindranoth Tagore ~

story:
Hidden Valley: The Awakening Marketing Campaign

Jon Morgan Woodward, Author and Actor, lives by the motto, "no part too small, and no character too large." His talent is incredible; both in range of ages portrayed and versatility of acting styles. Comedic, dramatic, or psychological thriller as in One Hour Fantasy Girl, Jon gives his audience the ride of their lives.

  • Jon Morgan Woodward has written an amazing book; now it's time to market it to the masses!!
  • By backing our campaign, you will receive perks from receiving a digital copy of the e-book, to signed copy of the book, to being flown out to the release party of the second book in the series (Titled Hidden Valley: Game On), meeting and having drinks with the Author, meeting the cast of Hidden Valley: The Awakening Movie, and more!!

"A Howling good read" 

-M. True, Amazon.com


We Need $75,000 for a Marketing Campaign - You Get Everything from a Thank You to an all access pass to the release party in Hollywood, California!!

We need $75,000 for:

  • Travel expenses for book signings/TV/Radio appearances!
  • Facebook/Twitter/Instagram Ads!
  • Marketing budget for YouTube, TV, Newspaper commercials, the whole shebang!
  • Even if we don't reach our budget, WE'RE STILL MARKETING IT BABY!

"Could not put it down...Book 2, please!?" 

-Nancy Pegarella, Amazon.com


CRITICS SAY:
"Could not put it down! Then read it again looking for where I missed clues. Aggravating how much this book got under my skin - in a "smiling thru my aggravation" way.

Characters are well developed, making you like them and enjoy their personalities. I found myself rooting for them, cheering them on and screaming inside my head for them to RUN!

Has the requisite "things that go bump in the night" format with a dash of suspense followed by a side of terror with a bit of humor. How do you make all of those elements come together? Ask Jon Woodward! He made it happen seamlessly.

My only disappointment with the book? It ended way too soon with a cliff hanger. Book 2, please?"
-Nancy Pagarella


"Prepare yourself for one hell of a ride!"

-Dakota Hines


"This book is by far one of the best books I have read in a long time; it was absolutely phenomenal. Jon Morgan Woodward has captured something we haven't seen in young adult fantasy in decades; he definitely kept me on the edge of my seat. So look out, because this book is one you wont want to put down. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for a good thriller. So excited for the movie!"
-Dakota Hines

 "A must read!"

-Erin J. Morgart


Risks & Challenges

Luckily, there's no real risk! Help us market this to the masses, and we all win!! The more we earn through this campaign, the more we can get the word out, the better the movie is, the better the rest of the series becomes, etc. etc. so on and so forth!!!

No money? No problem!

Hey, we've all been there. Even if you don't have a DIME to your name, you can still help in a BIG WAY!

  • SHARE this campaign on your Facebook/Twitter/Instagram
  • LIKE us on Facebook!
  • COMMENT on our facebook page!

And that's all there is to it! Thank you so much for contributing, you are freaking awesome!!!
